story:
As yet another war in Gaza has wound down, we must look toward rebuilding. Thousands of buildings have been destroyed, but thousands more still stand and they will have to be filled with people and businesses to bring prosperity back to this little strip of land.


My name is Marwa and I would like to fill one of those buildings with the beauty salon I've always dreamed of owning.

I always enjoyed playing with hair styles and makeup. Growing up, I would cut and dye mine and my mom's hair, and put makeup on my sisters' faces. They still let me play with their hair whenever I feel bored. Even my sister's friends visit so that I can style their hair and put makeup on them for special occasions. It's something that I understand and love, and it has been my hobby for years!


Finding a decent job in Gaza is not easy, and, even with my education, I have had a difficult time earning a reasonable living. The only employment experience I have other than extensive freelance translating consists of work as a secretary and translator for a private company. I had to work 6 days a week from 9 am to 4 pm for $200 a month. I took it because it was better than staying home and doing nothing, however I eventually left because online translating was better rewarded, and I love the freedom of being my own boss.


Today, with your help, I could realize my dream of owning a salon in Gaza City where I can do what I love and be my own boss. I would like my salon to be a ray of hope and beauty as we rebuild our city.



What We Need & What You Get 

Here are the prices for everything I need for the salon:
- Rent: $10,000 per year. This is the average rent price of a not so big store. If I get more, I will be able to have a big salon and add more sections to it (e.g. massage and/or hair removal).

- Remodeling the storefront and inside: $3000. This includes the basics of any beauty salon; chairs, mirrors, shelves, walls, etc.

- Lighting, air-conditioning, electric generator and fuel: $2000. Electricity isn't particularly reliable in Gaza even in the best of times. Because it goes out a lot, the generator is necessary for the customers to know that the salon will be available and ready at any time during the working day.

- Hair styling tools and basic makeup: $1500. This should be enough to get what I need to begin the business. Beside makeup I need dryers, curlers, flat irons, brushes, hair colors, hair accessories and shampoo. If I get more, I will be able to buy more and higher quality makeup and equipment.

- Extra money to pay all the workers who will build the salon. 

* Here is what I can offer in return:
For $5: I will send you a personal email thanking you for contributing to turning this dream into a reality.

$25: Wake up with a fresh cup of coffee in this ceramic mug with the Quartz logo.

$75: Join me as we make Quartz Beauty Salon a reality. You will see exclusive photos and videos of the rental, construction, decoration and everything else up until the opening day! You will be invited to join the group once you get the perk!

$150: I will paint your name on our gratitude wall in the salon for everyone to see; everyone who comes in will know that people all over the world helped make the salon a reality. Each contributor at this level will receive an email of their name on the wall.

$200: In addition to your name, you will also have a photo of yourself on the wall so that everyone can see who our highest level contributors are.

Not only will your help get me a secure job and stability, it will also help 3 to 5 employees who will be able to use the money from working in the salon to help their family. Your contribution will certainly help at least 4 families have a better life in Gaza. The more money we raise, the bigger the salon gets, which means more employees, which naturally means financial help and happiness for more than 4  Palestinian families in Gaza! So, what are you waiting for?!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help me financially but you still want to contribute, please share the campaign with everyone you know. Sharing it will give me a bigger chance to achieve my dream.

Also, don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
If the above link is too high resolution I have an alternate link with lower res for slower internet speeds http://youtu.be/N7i4_IGSreQ

My name is Stephen Genthner. I am opening a brewery with the help of my community, friends, and family. My goal is to create a brewery unlike what is currently out there; it will be a collaboration of styles from all over the globe, with influences from fine cuisine, as well as experimental and traditional brewing practices.

Blank Canvas Brewery will offer an exciting service that is a first for a production brewery, we will create custom batches of beer. Not just beer inspired from suggestions or feedback from the public, but we will sit down with customers to create a beer and brew it specifically for them. They will go home with a beer unique to all others because it was created by them and produced by a production brewery. They will be able to share the creation with others, not only at home, but also at the tap house until the keg runs dry. Everyone will benefit from the creativity and innovation of our combined imagination.

With the donations garnered here, I will purchase fermentation tanks and kegs to increase production to a viable business level. I have the initial production system that will become the custom system later as we grow. Blank Canvas Brewery will also use the capitol to sign and pay for a lease, as we go through the legal process of getting our liquor license, a sometimes lengthy and potentially costly process that requires inspections on both the federal and state level, with physical changes to the brew house a possible requirement. Every dime will go directly to the creation of the brewery.

The benefit to our community is obvious, tax revenue and job creation, as well as enriching the already varied tapestry of breweries in the great state of Maine. Our beer will be an inspiration to our fellow breweries, as well as home brewers and potentially the world of brewing.

I am a husband and the father of two children, who wants to show his family that it is possible to follow your dreams and make them into reality. There are many risks I am taking entering into this business, one of them being the financial security of my family. I have returned to college to finish my degree and I have invested money in production equipment. I have tested this system out many times and taken over the kitchen table with carboys and fermenting buckets. I have been working on this dream since 2001, when I left my job at Mercy Hospital to pursue my brewing dreams to work at Allagash Brewing Co.

I now have the education in business I needed to understand and speak the language of the business world. I have the experience of brewing for 13 years, both professionally and at home. If you've made it this far I have only one more thing to ask of you. If you are not able to give generously to this campaign please share this story with as many people as you are able. With your support, I know I can make Blank Canvas Brewery a real success.

story:
Introduction

Hello! We're a group of high school students developing a nonprofit organization based in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

When tasked with starting our own business, we saw two problems that we, as a team, wanted to solve. First off, individuals with developmental disabilities often times find their employment options disappear after they finish their high school or college education. On the other side, entrepreneurs who begin startup business often times have lots of tasks which can be given to others such as data entry, packaging, mailing, and simple product assembly. In order to help solve both these issues, we decided to create a platform that connects startups to these developmentally disabled individuals in an internship style program that will hopefully lead to permanent employment for the participant and more time for the entrepreneur to focus on the long-term goals for their business.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to be able to sponsor our first four participants. We already have contacted startups to commit to our pilot program but if we are unable to provide stipends for the participants, we won't be able to make an impact. The perks we offer really allow you, as a donor, to see exactly what kind of an impact you're making. Listed below is a diagram of how are funds are distributed.



    The Impact

    We all know someone with a developmental disability so this is a cause that touches every single person. Our program's impact is immense. Together we can truly transform lives for the better. With just a simple donation, you could be helping an individual with a developmental disability attain permanent employment and valuable skills moving forward. As this spreads and becomes a nationwide business, we can change hundreds of thousands of lives and all it takes is one small donation. 

      Risks & Challenges

      The main challenge that we, as a group face, is a lack of business experience. Being high school students we are constantly working to reach higher goals and as we move forward, we'd need to contract outside help to continue our venture. Our future goal is to have our program added into a greater organization such as Autism Speaks so that we can reach a wider audience and make a greater impact on a greater scale.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        As always, we'd appreciate it if you could just share the word with your friends, family, and coworkers to help us raise the funds we need. Also, using the power of social media by using the share buttons offered on Indiegogo would help our campaign immensely.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone!

I am starting a small business fundraising campaign for my daughter's new business.

Tia is currently a personal trainer. She does private training sessions and boot camps. She already has a pretty solid clientele and currently training people in her garage at home with 2 boot camps a week at a private training facility in Auburn.

The opportunity has come up for her to purchase the private training facility at a very good price.

I would like to help her raise as much as I can in order to reduce the size of the loan that she will need.

l am hoping to raise around $30,000 for her. that amount would cover the purchase of all of the equipment and leave a small amount to do some updating of the facility. My hope is that she not start off with a large debt. She has been training people for 4 years now and had a pretty steady following and she has the support of all of her clients, friends, and family. I know she will be successful.

She trains all fitness levels and tailors the sessions and boot camps to suit your specific need.

I wanted to start this campaign to give her a little hand up in getting her business to expand to the new facility. She will still be paying rent on the space but she has been working on ways to share the rent. There are 2 massage therapists that are renting space   and a couple of other trainers will rent space from her also to keep expenses down and help her achieve her goals and dreams.

I know not every one can help by contributing, but it would help a lot if you could  spread the word by passing it on or sharing with friends.

As a special thank you , come join us for a free boot camp. Saturdys and sundays at 10:30.


Champions Edge

1501 15th St NW #102

Auburn Wa 98001

story:
What's Happening

Frankly, I absolutely hate having to ask for help from people who don't know me, but we're desperate. Last week, my mother was arrested over something that turned out to be pretty minor and pointless, but they still charged her a ton for her bail and also impounded my vehicle in the process. That was my car, and I wasn't even driving it, and without it I can't get a job at all, and she certainly can't get to her job, either. There is literally no other form of transportation in our area, like cab or bus service. We don't have any access to those. And as long as my mother's van stays unusable, my car is the only way for us to be able to leave the house. Obviously, it's a major necessity for us to survive.

What we also need is help paying for our power bill. It's due to be turned off this week, and originally my mother would've had the money to pay for it sooner. But with having to pay bail and everything instead, she hardly has any money left. We're trying to get help with this from the places in our area that help families in need like us, but it's hard when they have specific hours when you can call and we may not have enough time to get that help, either.

What You Can Do

It would be so incredibly helpful if, somehow, you could donate something to us to help us get closer to solving these problems. We may be able to sort out power on our own, but there's no guarantee, and the payment for the car is much more difficult because when a car is impounded, they add a charge for every day that it's still with them, so the cost keeps rising. Anything you could give would do a world of good for us! Even if we can't reach the goal, whatever you send will go entirely toward the bills that we're behind on.

If you can't donate, that's okay! You can share this with as many people as possible and spread the word so that we can get past this awful time and move forward with our lives.

story:
Our Story

Ooples Anime Center has been in business for almost two years and we are looking to expand the store to include a dedicated cafe, manga reading room, LAN center and arcade.

 

The Impact

There are not many places in San Antonio which offer an authentic arcade experience with import Japanese and classic games. We also wish to construct a more suitable environment to host our cosplay café, with nice tables and chairs for guests to sit in. We also intend to install a kitchen so that food can be prepared fresh onsite and made to order. We want the cosplay cafe to become a permanent part of the store and open every day of the week!

We would also like to offer a quiet library room for those renting manga to read them in. Not to mention we will be opening the first geek themed bar in San Antonio!

 

Ooples has always offered a safe and fun location for people to socialize and play together. This expansion would allow us to provide even more entertainment options to the community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $250,000.  The Funds raised will be used for the following purposes:

 

-Expansion of Ooples store to consume the rest of the building, which includes construction and lease agreement for first few months.

-Manga reading room w/ beanbags and couches for guests to comfortably sit in.

-LAN center for internet cafe and events.

-Dining area for Cosplay Café, w/ stage for a live band, karaoke, or other kinds of performances.

Here is a video of some of our previous maids performing at one of our events.

http://youtu.be/GIsHVDY_qqo

-Liquor license for serving alcholic beverages, including import Japanese beers and sake.

-On-site kitchen for preparing meals for the cosplay cafe, to be served by our maid and butler wait staff.

-Arcade center with new imported Japanese arcade units (such as Pac Man Battle Royale) & classic arcade units (such as The Simpsons Arcade, Metal Slug, Alien 3, Aliens Vs Predator)

 

 

We also need to purchase the following restaurant equipment:

Refrigerator

Freezer

Sink

Tea machine

Espresso machine

Soft drink machines

Ice cream machine

Gellato station

Sushi bar

 

All equipment must be inspected by and pass the health and safety regulations set by the city of San Antonio.

How You Can Help

Choose from one of our many pledge categories located on the right hand side of this page. All money raised will be used to make this dream a reality!

Please also share this page with friends, family and anyone else you think might be interested in seeing a maid cafe and REAL arcade in San Antonio. We really need to tap into the community to make this happen!

 

Also don't forget to find us on our Ooples Facebook Page and let us know what you think about our plans!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

We are the Zulu Orphan Alliance (www.zuluorphans.org), an ALL VOLUNTEER American Nonprofit organization.  We work in South Africa with children orphaned by HIV/AIDS and other children who are in danger of being orphaned.  By 2015, it is estimated that 1/3rd of South African Zulu children will be orphaned.  We currently help house 25-30 children at Bhekanisizwe, a small children's home in Adams Mission, South Africa.  We also feed and additional 23-30 children twice daily who otherwise would not eat. Long term plans include building a larger compound that will have dormitories, a modern kitchen, composting toilets, solar energy, and a community building that will be used by local Zulu women for an income generating beading cooperative--but all of that will be very expensive--about $80,000 US.  So we are starting with a smaller project that will have a huge impact on our ability to feed everyone.

Our primary goal now is to build a greenhouse and a chicken coop/goat pen to ensure that our kids have access to healthy, abundant food on a consistent basis.  Food security is very important to children who have known constant hunger for the majority of their lives.

We need $4750.00 to purchase building materials, organic seeds, chickens, goats, and other supplies, as well as money to hire local Zulu workers to actually build the buildings.  This will help the local economy, where unemployment is over 60%.

By helping us, you will not only receive good Karma for keeping children safe and alive, but we have some pretty cool gifts for you as well!

For donations of $25, you will receive a hand-written thank you note and a picture and short bio of one of the children you are helping.

For donations of $50, you will receive the above, plus a piece of original art drawn by a Zulu child living at our facility in South Africa.

For donations of $100, you will receive the above plus a Zulu Orphan Alliance T-shirt.

For donations of $500 or more, we will give you all of the above, plus WE WILL NAME A GOAT AFTER YOU!

  • If we don't reach our entire goal, you can be assured that the entire amount we do raise will go directly to feeding the children.  Since we are an all volunteer organization, no money goes to salaries, offices, or anything not directly related to helping these kids.

The Impact

How often can you say that you actually made a difference in a child's life?  By helping us you are literally saving lives.  People ask us all the time why we work with kids in a foreign land when there is so much need here in the US--we tell them we work in South Africa because, unlike here in America, there are no social safety nets--no welfare, food stamps, or homeless shelters.  Without intervention, these children very likely might die.  We just can't let that happen.  And with your help, we won't.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, please help us by spreading the word.  Use Facebook, Twitter, word-of-mouth--to help us expose folks to what we do and who we are helping.  Please share our website: www.zuluorphans.org.

Thank You!!!
story_txt:
What We Need & What You Get
We are the Zulu Orphan Alliance (www.zuluorphans.org), an ALL VOLUNTEER American Nonprofit organization.  We work in South Africa with children orphaned by HIV/AIDS and other children who are in danger of being orphaned.  By 2015, it is estimated that 1/3rd of South African Zulu children will be orphaned.  We currently help house 25-30 children at Bhekanisizwe, a small children's home in Adams Mission, South Africa.  We also feed and additional 23-30 children twice daily who otherwise would not eat. Long term plans include building a larger compound that will have dormitories, a modern kitchen, composting toilets, solar energy, and a community building that will be used by local Zulu women for an income generating beading cooperative--but all of that will be very expensive--about $80,000 US.  So we are starting with a smaller project that will have a huge impact on our ability to feed everyone.
Our primary goal now is to build a greenhouse and a chicken coop/goat pen to ensure that our kids have access to healthy, abundant food on a consistent basis.  Food security is very important to children who have known constant hunger for the majority of their lives.
We need $4750.00 to purchase building materials, organic seeds, chickens, goats, and other supplies, as well as money to hire local Zulu workers to actually build the buildings.  This will help the local economy, where unemployment is over 60%.
By helping us, you will not only receive good Karma for keeping children safe and alive, but we have some pretty cool gifts for you as well!
For donations of $25, you will receive a hand-written thank you note and a picture and short bio of one of the children you are helping.
For donations of $50, you will receive the above, plus a piece of original art drawn by a Zulu child living at our facility in South Africa.
For donations of $100, you will receive the above plus a Zulu Orphan Alliance T-shirt.
For donations of $500 or more, we will give you all of the above, plus WE WILL NAME A GOAT AFTER YOU!


If we don't reach our entire goal, you can be assured that the entire amount we do raise will go directly to feeding the children.  Since we are an all volunteer organization, no money goes to salaries, offices, or anything not directly related to helping these kids.
The Impact
How often can you say that you actually made a difference in a child's life?  By helping us you are literally saving lives.  People ask us all the time why we work with kids in a foreign land when there is so much need here in the US--we tell them we work in South Africa because, unlike here in America, there are no social safety nets--no welfare, food stamps, or homeless shelters.  Without intervention, these children very likely might die.  We just can't let that happen.  And with your help, we won't.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't help us financially, please help us by spreading the word.  Use Facebook, Twitter, word-of-mouth--to help us expose folks to what we do and who we are helping.  Please share our website: www.zuluorphans.org.
Thank You!!!

story:
Čisto prírodné stavebné panely zo slamy.

Rodinný, ekologický a pasívny dom, ktorý je 100% recyklovateľný, lacný a postavíte ho za 2 dni vďaka našej revolučnej technológii stavebných panelov zo slamy.

The English version is below 

 

Niekoľko slov o mne ...

Volám sa Anton Gajdoš a mám rád svoju prácu. Dlho som hľadal možnosti nízkonákladového bývania, no konvenčné spôsoby výstavby to nedovoľujú .Preto som začal  hľadať alternatívne a najmä lacnejšie spôsoby výstavby domu...a nakoniec som našiel riešenie "dom zo slamy".  Prírodnému staviteľstvu som sa začal venovať v roku 2009 navštívil som množstvo workshopov a seminárov v Čechách a na Slovenku.  Na základe mojich zručnosti a vedomostí som sa rozhodol tejto činnosti venovať profesionálne. V roku 2010 som spolu s mojou rodinou a známymi postavil svoj prvý slamený dom, ktorý momentálne slúži ako ateliér, ukážkový domček a chalupa na rekreáciu zároveň...;-) Viac informácií o mne a mojej práci nájdete na mojom webe www.slamene-domy.eu.

 

Aké sú moje ciele a zámery...

Prečo to vlastne robím...?Mám rád svoju prácu pri ktorej som v kontakte s tradičnými materiálmi ako sú hlina, slama, drevo, kameň a vytváram  z nich niečo úplne nové v čom sa noví majitelia budú cítiť veľmi príjemne a najmä zdravo. Chcem pomáhať ľudom postaviť si svoj vlastný dom zo zdravých, prírodných a recyklovateľných materiálov, aby si tak splnili svoje predstavy  o svojom vysnívanom domove. Vďaka Vám a Vašej finančnej pomoci budem môcť  začať vyrábať  ekologické slamené panely. Slamené panely spĺňajú najvyššie štandardy kvality a bezpečnosti Európskej únie.  Z týchto prefabrikovaných panelov sú čisto prírodné ekologické domy postavené veľmi rýchlo a ľahko, šetria náklady na výstavbu  a samozrejme šetria prírodné prostredie. Vybrané peniaze použijeme  na rozvoj výroby organických panelov z lisovanej slamy a prenajmeme si nové väčšie skladovacie priestory, ktoré sú už v súčasnej dobe nedostačujúce. Ak sa rozhodnete pre akúkoľvek formu pomoci, nepomáhate iba mne, ale aj iným ľuďom ,ktorí  sú ,alebo budú zapojení do tohto projektu. Pomôžete vytvoriť unikátne miesto, kde prebieha výroba, predaj a distribúcia „čisto ekologických produktov“. Vďaka tomuto projektu vzniknú nové pracovné miesta , pomôžeme aj miestnym roľníkom a nakoniec  pomôžeme aj sami sebe, pretože samotná produkcia CO2 pri slamenej stavbe je o 43% nižšia ako pri komerčných stavbách .

 

Ukážem vám pár obrázkov ako vyzerajú panely zo slamy, aby ste mali predstavu ako sa dá rýchlo, krásne a prírodne bývať:

http://www.slamene-domy.eu/fotogaleria/ # a201108041008-jpg1

 

Kam presne pôjde Vaša finančná pomoc?!

Vaša finančná podpora pôjde na zdokonalenie  výrobného procesu slamených panelov. Tento proces sa  zjednoduší, výroba sa urýchli a znížia sa náklady na výrobu, tým pádom bude nižšia aj konečná cena. Vytvoríme nový ekologický  výrobok, vďaka ktorému vznikne lacné , ale zdravé a vkusné bývanie.

 

  1. Investícia do výrobných procesov - 4.000,- Dolárov
  2. Prenájom nových, väčších úložných priestorov na slamené balíky a výrobené slamené panely min.na tri mesiace v okolí mesta Trebišov - 3.500, - Dolárov
  3. Nákup materiálov pre výrobu prefabrikátov (slamené baly, drevo, skrutky ...) - 3.250, - Dolars
  4. Reklama na našej ponuky na Slovensku i v zahraničí - 1.500, - dolárov
  5. Výplata zamestnancov po dobu troch mesiacov - 3.500, - dolárov
  6. Poplatky za elektrinu, teplo a palivo po dobu troch mesiacov 1,000,-dolárov

    Výsledný súčet 16.750, - dolárov

 

Výhody a vlastnosti slamených panelov

 

Zdravotná nezávadnosť:
Slamené panely nemajú negatívny vplyv na životné prostredie a ľudské zdravie. K ich výrobe sú použité čisto prírodné materiály - presné drevené rámy a lisovaná slama, ktorá je tu použitá ako tepelne izolačný materiál


Konštrukcia:
Technológia ukladania slamy v paneli je úplne unikátna. Slamené steblá sa pri lisovaní do panela ukladajú vo všesmernej orientácii pri zachovaní hustoty 100 kg/m3. Týmto dosahuje slama hodnoty súčiniteľa tepelnej vodivosti = 0,057 W (m2K). Panely majú drevenú rámovú konštrukciu. Ide o nosné konštrukčné prvky, ktoré zodpovedajú požiadavkám na únosnosť, tuhosť a trvanlivosť. Z týchto panelov je možné postaviť prízemné aj poschodové stavby.


Rýchlosť montáže:
K hlavným výhodám tohto systému patrí rýchlosť montáže. Múry o ploche 100 m2 je možné v štyroch ľuďoch postaviť za 1-2 dni. Na spájanie panelov nie je potrebné žiadne špeciálne nástroje, používajú sa len ručne skrutkované skrutky.


Vysoká miera izolácie:
Systém panelov vylučuje tepelné mosty. Svojimi tepelnoizolačnými vlastnosťami a vysokou vzduchotesnosťou spĺňa štandardy pre pasívne domy.


Skladba steny:
Zo strany exteriéru sú slamené panely pokryté drevovláknitou doskou hr. 60 mm. Toto opatrenie zvyšuje tepelnú odolnosť steny, a pôsobí tu ako záveterná, no difúzne otvorená vrstva. Finálna úprava môže byť vykonaná tenkostenou omietkou alebo ako prevetrávaná fasáda s obkladom.
Z interiéru je na slamený panel aplikovaná trojvrstvová hlinená omietka alebo sa dajú použiť iné prírodné materiály: dosky na báze dreva, Ekopanely apod Trieda reakcie na oheň je u takto opláštených panelov B-s1, d0.


Filozofia zdravého domu
S panelmi získavate zdravý dom s vynikajúcimi vlastnosťami vnútorného prostredia. Prirodzené vlastnosti prírodných materiálov vám poskytnú stabilnú klímu interiéru: "teplo v zime, chladno v lete". Ušetríte náklady za inštaláciu chladenia a výkonných vykurovacích systémov, navyše prispejete k ochrane životného prostredia a podpore ekologických aktivít.


Filozofia návrhov a projektovanie domov
Vďaka universalite systému nie sú domy ponúkané katalógovo, ale podľa individuálnych projektov pre konkrétnych klientov a na konkrétne stavebné parcely a ich lokalitu. Vlastný návrh a spracovanie projektu prebieha až v prípade nadviazania spolupráce. Až veľkosť, štýl, štandard prevedenia a individuálne dopracovanie určí cenu Vášho domu. Presvedčili sme sa, že kvalitné premyslený projekt dokáže ušetriť najviac peňazí a jeho používatelia sú oveľa spokojnejší.

Skúsenosti s podobným projektom.

Tento projekt je unikátny svojím rozsahom a jedinečnosťou na Slovensku a možno aj na svete čiže je to pre mňa niečo úplne nové. Budem rád ak sa cieľ vyzbierať 16.750,- dolárov naplní už len kvôli výrobku,ktorý z tejto Vašej pomoci vznikne. Mal som individuálne projekty, ktoré zlepšujú bývanie sociálne slabým a mladým rodinám na Slovenskú na ktorých spolupráca ešte trvá.

 

Iné spôsoby, ako môžete pomôcť


Prispejte prosím na tento projekt či už finančne,alebo to doslava vykričte do sveta, že sa niečo také na Slovensku deje. Čím viac ľudí o tom hovorí tým je to lepšie pre celý svet...

AKo prispieť?

Stači ak kliknete na ružový obdĺžnik, kde píše contribute now, vyberiete si sumu ktorou by ste chceli prispieť. Stlačíte ružový obdĺžnik ,kde píše continue/pokračovať. Zadáte či chcete platiť cez PAYPAL alebo bankomatovou kartou. Ak si zvolíte bankomatovú kartu musíte mať aktivovanú platbu cez internet potom stačí vyplniť údaje first name/krstne meno, Last name/Priezvisko, card number/číslo karty, security code/bezpečnostný kód ( je na zadnej časti vašej karty (troj alebo štvormiestné číslo) a vyplniť dátum expirácie Vašej karty potvrdiť a tým je Váš príspevok odovzdaný.

Okrem toho, našu kampaň môžete zdieľať aj na Facebooku a propagáciou stránky Indiegogo.com pomôžete tak splniť túto náročnú úlohu a urobíte dobrý skutok.

Všetkým prispievateľom a šíriteľom tejto vznešenej myšlienky zo srdca

Ďakujem :-)

S pozdravom a želaním krásneho dňa Anton Gajdoš

 

English version

A few words about me ...

For a long time I was looking into a low-cost housing, but conventional methods of construction to allow it. Accordingly, I started looking for alternative and cheaper methods of construction ... and I finally found a solution to the "house of straw". Natural engineering I started in 2009 I visited a variety of workshops and seminars in the Czech Republic and Slovakia. Based on my skills and knowledge I have decided to dedicate this work professionally. In 2010, I along with my family and friends built his first straw house, which now serves as a studio sample house and cottage for recreation while ... ;-) more information about me and my work, you can find on my web www.slamene-domy.eu

For what purpose will use your financial contributions ...

I had a dream .. that will change the world for the better ... That's why I started environmental engineering and natural materials. Helping socially weaker people and young families with children to fulfill their dream of a healthy and beautiful home. Thanks to you and your financial aid I create organic production in straw panels. At this point we're assembled straw panels, which meet the highest quality and safety standards of the European Union. From such prefabricated panels are pure natural green houses are built very quickly and easily, saving the cost of construction of houses and of course the natural environment. Collected money will use to develop the production of organic panels of pressed straw and storage spaces that are already currently insufficient. I'll show you a few images to give you an idea how these look straw panels and how quickly they build beautiful natural homes:http://www.slamene-domy.eu/fotogaleria/#a201108041008-jpg1If I can help and contribute, just not helping me! Help people, which I can thanks to your financial support to employ (in our region is 19.30% unemployment)! Help socially weak people for whom these straw panels are made, and so they live in a healthy and eco-house, which can be easily recycled. And help each other, because through ecological construction reduces CO2 in the air by 43%.

 

If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me on the email agajdos@centrum.sk

 

Your financial contributions will go exactly...

I need your financial support so that the manufacturing process of straw panels could simplify, speed up and reduce the cost of production hence the final price. Then provide greater assistance to the socially weaker families and young families with children in the construction of cheap, but healthy and tasteful living.

  • Start-up and expansion of manufacturing straw panels - 4.000,-Dollars
  • Renting a new, bigger storage space for three months around Trebisov in Eastern Slovakia - 3.500,- Dollars
  • Purchase of materials for the production of prefabricated panels (straw bales, wood, screws ...) - 3.250,- Dolars
  • Advertising on our offer visibility in Slovakia and abroad - 1.500,- Dollars
  • Payment to two employees for three months for three months 3.500,- Dollars
  • Charges for electricity, heat and fuel for three months 1.000,-Dollars

The resulting sum 16.750,- Dollars

 

Benefits of building with straw panels:

Health safety:
Straw panels have no negative impact on the environment and human health. Their uses only pure natural materials - wood frames and precision molded straw, which is used as a thermal insulation material

construction:
Storage Technology straw panel is completely unique. Straw straws when pressing the panel stored in directional orientation while maintaining the density of 100 kg/m3. This straw reaches thermal conductivity = 0.057 W (m 2 K). The panels are wood frame construction. It is a structural design features that meet the requirements for strength, rigidity and durability. From these panels can be built and ground-story building.


Speed of assembly:
The main advantages of this system include speed assembly. Wall with an area of 100 m2 in four people can stand up for 1-2 days. For connecting panels is not no need for special tools, are used only manually screwed screws.


High level of insulation:
Panel system eliminates thermal bridges. Its thermal insulation properties and high.

Wall Construction:
From the exterior side panels are covered with straw fibreboard plate thickness. 60 mm. This measure increases the thermal resistance of the wall, and there are as leeward, but diffusion layer. The final adjustment can be made tenkostěnou plaster or ventilated facade cladding.
The interior is on straw panel applied three layers of clay or plaster can use other natural materials: wood-based panels, etc. Ekopanely Reaction to fire with such a sheathed panels B-s1, d0.

To be collected the entire amount ...?!

The collected money to invest in new material for the production of straw panels and particularly in accelerating the production of panels straw ... and remained in the old and small areas where we have worked well so far even though it will not be so effective ...

Your contribution helps globally, but also locally ...

  • contribute to reducing air emissions worldwide
  • Your contribution will help people who need housing quickly and cheaply
  • help develop the region thanks to new job opportunities, because we have all the materials from local sources.
  • Contribute to the new construction industry: natural architecture, which is friendly to nature and the people of this planet.

 

Philosophy healthy house

The panels get healthy house with outstanding features indoor environment. Natural properties of natural materials will provide a stable interior climate, "warm in winter, cool in the summer." Save the cost of installing cooling and powerful heating systems, also help to protect the environment and promote environmental activities.

experience with similar projects

I've had many individual projects that improve housing underprivileged and young families in Slovakia, but I feel that thanks to your financial support, we can help more people who are in material need more than we ...For each social cooperation projects and future residents of your house that you appreciate what they have been given.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute to this project, financial assistance, but would like to help people who are in need of further talk to your family, friends and colleagues, that this idea could spread further ...

In addition, our speech to campaign Indiegogo.com site, you can share all the social networks and so much help meet this mission.

All contributors spread this noble thoughts from the heart Thank you :-)

Best regards and wishes of a beautiful day Anton Gajdos

Finálna úprava môže byť vykonaná tenkostenou omietkou alebo ako prevetrávaná fasáda s obkladom.Z interiéru je na slamený panel aplikovaná trojvrstvová hlinená omietka alebo sa dajú použiť iné prírodné materiály: dosky na báze dreva, Ekopanely apod Trieda reakcie na oheň je u takto opláštených panelov B-s1, d0.
Filozofia zdravého domuS panelmi získavate zdravý dom s vynikajúcimi vlastnosťami vnútorného prostredia. Prirodzené vlastnosti prírodných materiálov vám poskytnú stabilnú klímu interiéru: "teplo v zime, chladno v lete". Ušetríte náklady za inštaláciu chladenia a výkonných vykurovacích systémov, navyše prispejete k ochrane životného prostredia a podpore ekologických aktivít.
Filozofia návrhov a projektovanie domovVďaka universalite systému nie sú domy ponúkané katalógovo, ale podľa individuálnych projektov pre konkrétnych klientov a na konkrétne stavebné parcely a ich lokalitu. Vlastný návrh a spracovanie projektu prebieha až v prípade nadviazania spolupráce. Až veľkosť, štýl, štandard prevedenia a individuálne dopracovanie určí cenu Vášho domu. Presvedčili sme sa, že kvalitné premyslený projekt dokáže ušetriť najviac peňazí a jeho používatelia sú oveľa spokojnejší.
Skúsenosti s podobným projektom.
Tento projekt je unikátny svojím rozsahom a jedinečnosťou na Slovensku a možno aj na svete čiže je to pre mňa niečo úplne nové. Budem rád ak sa cieľ vyzbierať 16.750,- dolárov naplní už len kvôli výrobku,ktorý z tejto Vašej pomoci vznikne. Mal som individuálne projekty, ktoré zlepšujú bývanie sociálne slabým a mladým rodinám na Slovenskú na ktorých spolupráca ešte trvá.
 
Iné spôsoby, ako môžete pomôcť
 Prispejte prosím na tento projekt či už finančne,alebo to doslava vykričte do sveta, že sa niečo také na Slovensku deje. Čím viac ľudí o tom hovorí tým je to lepšie pre celý svet...
AKo prispieť?
Stači ak kliknete na ružový obdĺžnik, kde píše contribute now, vyberiete si sumu ktorou by ste chceli prispieť. Stlačíte ružový obdĺžnik ,kde píše continue/pokračovať. Zadáte či chcete platiť cez PAYPAL alebo bankomatovou kartou. Ak si zvolíte bankomatovú kartu musíte mať aktivovanú platbu cez internet potom stačí vyplniť údaje first name/krstne meno, Last name/Priezvisko, card number/číslo karty, security code/bezpečnostný kód ( je na zadnej časti vašej karty (troj alebo štvormiestné číslo) a vyplniť dátum expirácie Vašej karty potvrdiť a tým je Váš príspevok odovzdaný. Okrem toho, našu kampaň môžete zdieľať aj na Facebooku a propagáciou stránky Indiegogo.com pomôžete tak splniť túto náročnú úlohu a urobíte dobrý skutok. Všetkým prispievateľom a šíriteľom tejto vznešenej myšlienky zo srdca
Ďakujem :-) S pozdravom a želaním krásneho dňa Anton Gajdoš
 
English version
A few words about me ...
For a long time I was looking into a low-cost housing, but conventional methods of construction to allow it. Accordingly, I started looking for alternative and cheaper methods of construction ... and I finally found a solution to the "house of straw". Natural engineering I started in 2009 I visited a variety of workshops and seminars in the Czech Republic and Slovakia. Based on my skills and knowledge I have decided to dedicate this work professionally. In 2010, I along with my family and friends built his first straw house, which now serves as a studio sample house and cottage for recreation while ... ;-) more information about me and my work, you can find on my web www.slamene-domy.eu
For what purpose will use your financial contributions ...
I had a dream .. that will change the world for the better ... That's why I started environmental engineering and natural materials. Helping socially weaker people and young families with children to fulfill their dream of a healthy and beautiful home. Thanks to you and your financial aid I create organic production in straw panels. At this point we're assembled straw panels, which meet the highest quality and safety standards of the European Union. From such prefabricated panels are pure natural green houses are built very quickly and easily, saving the cost of construction of houses and of course the natural environment. Collected money will use to develop the production of organic panels of pressed straw and storage spaces that are already currently insufficient. I'll show you a few images to give you an idea how these look straw panels and how quickly they build beautiful natural homes:http://www.slamene-domy.eu/fotogaleria/#a201108041008-jpg1If I can help and contribute, just not helping me! Help people, which I can thanks to your financial support to employ (in our region is 19.30% unemployment)! Help socially weak people for whom these straw panels are made, and so they live in a healthy and eco-house, which can be easily recycled. And help each other, because through ecological construction reduces CO2 in the air by 43%.
 
If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me on the email agajdos@centrum.sk
 
Your financial contributions will go exactly...
I need your financial support so that the manufacturing process of straw panels could simplify, speed up and reduce the cost of production hence the final price. Then provide greater assistance to the socially weaker families and young families with children in the construction of cheap, but healthy and tasteful living.

Start-up and expansion of manufacturing straw panels - 4.000,-Dollars 
Renting a new, bigger storage space for three months around Trebisov in Eastern Slovakia - 3.500,- Dollars
Purchase of materials for the production of prefabricated panels (straw bales, wood, screws ...) - 3.250,- Dolars
Advertising on our offer visibility in Slovakia and abroad - 1.500,- Dollars
Payment to two employees for three months for three months 3.500,- Dollars
Charges for electricity, heat and fuel for three months 1.000,-Dollars
The resulting sum 16.750,- Dollars
 
Benefits of building with straw panels:
Health safety:Straw panels have no negative impact on the environment and human health. Their uses only pure natural materials - wood frames and precision molded straw, which is used as a thermal insulation material
construction:Storage Technology straw panel is completely unique. Straw straws when pressing the panel stored in directional orientation while maintaining the density of 100 kg/m3. This straw reaches thermal conductivity = 0.057 W (m 2 K). The panels are wood frame construction. It is a structural design features that meet the requirements for strength, rigidity and durability. From these panels can be built and ground-story building.
Speed of assembly:The main advantages of this system include speed assembly. Wall with an area of 100 m2 in four people can stand up for 1-2 days. For connecting panels is not no need for special tools, are used only manually screwed screws.
High level of insulation:Panel system eliminates thermal bridges. Its thermal insulation properties and high.
Wall Construction:From the exterior side panels are covered with straw fibreboard plate thickness. 60 mm. This measure increases the thermal resistance of the wall, and there are as leeward, but diffusion layer. The final adjustment can be made tenkostěnou plaster or ventilated facade cladding.The interior is on straw panel applied three layers of clay or plaster can use other natural materials: wood-based panels, etc. Ekopanely Reaction to fire with such a sheathed panels B-s1, d0.

To be collected the entire amount ...?!
The collected money to invest in new material for the production of straw panels and particularly in accelerating the production of panels straw ... and remained in the old and small areas where we have worked well so far even though it will not be so effective ...
Your contribution helps globally, but also locally ...

contribute to reducing air emissions worldwide
Your contribution will help people who need housing quickly and cheaply
help develop the region thanks to new job opportunities, because we have all the materials from local sources.
Contribute to the new construction industry: natural architecture, which is friendly to nature and the people of this planet.

 

Philosophy healthy house

The panels get healthy house with outstanding features indoor environment. Natural properties of natural materials will provide a stable interior climate, "warm in winter, cool in the summer." Save the cost of installing cooling and powerful heating systems, also help to protect the environment and promote environmental activities.
experience with similar projects
I've had many individual projects that improve housing underprivileged and young families in Slovakia, but I feel that thanks to your financial support, we can help more people who are in material need more than we ...For each social cooperation projects and future residents of your house that you appreciate what they have been given.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can contribute to this project, financial assistance, but would like to help people who are in need of further talk to your family, friends and colleagues, that this idea could spread further ...In addition, our speech to campaign Indiegogo.com site, you can share all the social networks and so much help meet this mission.All contributors spread this noble thoughts from the heart Thank you :-)Best regards and wishes of a beautiful day Anton Gajdos

story:
WATCH THE VIDEO ABOVE TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THE WORK OF HYBRID SOCIAL SOLUTIONS AND STIFTUNG SOLARENERGIE! 

THE PROBLEM?

One in four Filipinos lack access to electricity. Without access, rural Filipinos are forced to turn to unsafe, inefficient, and expensive energy sources for essential needs. Hybrid Social Solutions (HSSi) and Stiftung Solarenergie (StS), solar energy companies that serve the rural poor, are in the early stages of incubating the Philippines' first solar access center in the rural province of El Nido, Palawan. The center will be a self-sustainable, revenue-generating community space powered by independent off-grid photovoltaic panels. I have been offered the opportunity to to lead the project development and implementation of the solar center on behalf of HSSi and StS should I raise funds for my work this summer. 

I am passionate about international economic development and entrepreneurship in emerging markets. This summer I want to join this top-notch team to help alleviate energy poverty in the Philippines!

THE OPPORTUNITY?

The approximate 37,000 residents of the municipality of El Nido are a case study on the issue of electrical indigence in the Philippines. The region consists of 45 small, mountainous islands, and communities are rural and remote. The average household income in El Nido is approximately PhP7,000 (USD $170) per month and a mere 29% are electrified. The majority of the 18 villages in the region are too remote to be reached by a decrepit power plant’s electrical grid. Government plans for full electrification of the region by 2014 seem infeasible. To provide basic light, families use kerosene or battery powered lamps, but kerosene lamps provide inadequate lighting, are fire hazard risks and pose serious threats to health; they cause respiratory infections, poisoning and cancers. Batteries are a safer alternative, but they cost El Nido residents 4,000 times more than the average American spends on electricity per unit. It is not uncommon for a family to spend the majority of its meager income to buy batteries or kerosene. In El Nido, as elsewhere, energy poverty is a huge barrier to development – it impedes the education system, increases susceptibility to disease, and handicaps small business. This project is an opportunity to have a significant impact on one of these rural communities, and will lay the groundwork for future solar center installations. 

This summer experience also offers me a hands-on educational opportunity on a subject for which I am passionate. I hope to use the lessons I learn this summer in future international development work.

WHAT WILL I DO?

 

As the project manager for the launch of the solar center, my role will entail a varied set of responsibilities. Over the course of 9 weeks, our team will determine: site location, a revenue model that will cover the operating expenses of the center, educational content for learning tablet devices, capacity-building workshops for employees, among other responsibilities. Interviews and surveys conducted in El Nido villages will be critical to determine the site of the solar center. We will leverage information about finances, health, education, quality of life and other factors related to the availability of clean, solar energy, to determine the particular components of the solar center such as internet accessible electronic tablets for educational purposes, water purification pumps, a small store, an industrial refrigerator for ice production and medicine storage, and mobile banking services. The exact combination of such facilities will be determined by our site visits and interviews.

In early August, this work will culminate in the launch of the first independently sustainable solar access center in the Philippines. With careful due diligence, backed by the support of noted organizations such as HSSi and StS, our project will have a lasting impact.    

THE COSTS?

Below is a breakdown of my costs while in the Philippines:

- 1 roundtrip ticket from Tokyo to Manila: $537.50

- 3 roundtrip tickets from Manila to El Nido: $825

- 9 weeks rent in Manila: $900

- 3 weeks varied lodging in El Nido: $250

- Food: $750

- Immunizations (Hepatitus A&B, Typhoid, Japanese Encephalitus, Rabies): $240

- Public transportation to work while in Manila: $95.50

- Philippine mult-entry visa: $60

- Incidentals: $200

Total: $3,858

I need a total of $3,858 to cover my expenses this summer! These funds go towards basic lodging, transportation, food, and incidentals like immunizations. Any additional funds will go directly towards other rural electrification projects that will be detailed on my website.

HOW YOU CAN HELP?

I need a total of $3,858 to cover my expenses this summer! If you could help fund my work by contributing to this initiative, you will help change lives, build a better community, and lay a sustainable foundation for energy poverty alleviation in the Philippines. Every dollar counts, and will go a long way!

If you are interested in learning more about my project this summer, I'd love to fill you in on more details. Please shoot me a note at miles.t.bird @ gmail .com

story:
Who is The Well 

The Well Victoria society is a new not for profit organization that has deep roots in the Canadian arts community. With a successful second year, The Well has some new and exciting expansions to announce for 2013. 

  • The Nobel Laureate Festival of the Arts (June 30 to July 6) will contribute to our city’s place in the world as a great destination.

  • The Sacred Gospel Musical Festival (August 1-4) will contribute to the spiritual heath of our community.

  • The Annual Symposium of Health & Wellness (September 1-6) by bringing leading health and wellness practitioners together will place wellness at the forefront of the sustainability movement. Without our health; mental, physical and spiritual keeping our world green will have very little significance. 

  • and the return of the Spirit of Canada Poetry, Spoken Word, and Singer/Songwriter Contest becoming a national event that will engender a true national appreciation for the talent and culture of Canada, as it becomes more diverse and inclusive.  (May 22 to July 1)

 

What We Need & What You Get

All donations will go towards the preparation of the events, including: purchasing permits and booking space, hiring trained events staff, creating national advertisement to promote the arts community in Victoria and build excitement in many other ways.

The Impact

With the addition of these events the culturual arts scene in Victoria is bound to flourish and bring attention to the local artist as well as attracting other Canadian and international artists to the city.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to a financial donation, The Well Victoria has a number of other ways to be involved. Please contact info@thewellvictoria.com for more information.

story:
Our Story

The love for chocolate is a guilty pleasure. Chocolate lovers alike struggle with the chronic pain of temptation on a daily basis. Now you can enjoy chocolate guilt free!!


A dynamic duo of health nuts in San Diego have created a new way to enjoy the benefits of the superfood cacao bean (raw chocolate) and infuse all natural ingredients to create a perfect balance of sustainable energy. Our RAu (pronunced raw) Chocolate is a chilled beverage containing no sugar, which means its soothing energy effect has no crash. Without damaging nutrients through heat when cooked, we have allowed chocolate's natural properties to shine and support a healthy lifestyle. Replacing your morning coffee or energy drinks with a RAu chocolate beverage is a much healthier alternative as it is loaded with antioxidants and bliss chemicalsâ€¦ a solution to a â€œpick me up and feel goodâ€ without the hype and jitters. Our RAu Chocolate beverage is 100% all natural without preservatives or fillers with enough chocolate to curb the craziest of cravings. Chocolate lovers can finally embrace cravings of all levels while actively supporting a healthy lifestyle. 


At RAu we combined the worlds most naturally stimulating nutrients under one cap to jump start your mojo.Together lets change the world one drink at a time.


The Impact

Directly supporting RAu means your contributions are developing a completely green company. We have devised a model to allow our company to contribute negative carbon emissions. What this means is with all the resources and material we use to develop RAu Chocolate (creating carbon emissions), we will have an even higher output of replacement and planting of these resources (eliminating carbon emissions). Our direct existence will support our environment and communities. Through your contributions we can help support our environment while developing our delicious product. Together we can change the world one drink at a time!

Without support, RAu will be non existent and chocolate lovers around the world will suffer severe hardships. Furthermore, our environment and communities will continue to struggle and have little to no chance against the ever growing carbon emissions in our world. Don't be that guy....join the RAuvolution!!


What We Need

RAu has been generating a buzz around San Diego and we need the funding to package and market our product in a professional manner. Currently we have been using funding from our own pockets for research, development and branding. We are at the final phase in our production that allows us to bring RAu Chocolate to shelf. This is where you come in! We are looking to raise $5,000 to purchase raw material, bottles, custom labels and future smiles for all. We are opening 5 retailer accounts in San Diego starting in April and this money will be used to facilitate and support these accounts. This figure has been calculated to guarantee we are able to provide quality assurance and exceptional service for these local retailers.

If we raise extra capital, such as $10,000, we can scale up on our production and equipment to meet the need of at least 5 additional accounts. What this means is RAu Chocolate will be in your hands a lot sooner. Ideally we could use $10,000 in order to further establish ourselves in the beverage industry and get more RAu to more people. Any and all donations are greatly appreciated!!

Join the Pack

Join the RAuvolution and spread the love. Support us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/drinkRAu and invite all chocolate lovers too! Together we can change the world one drink at a time.

story:
No need to remember all those usernames and passwords.
The MPV does it for you!

Features:

  • A single push of a button logs you into your web account.
  • The MPV can store up to 50 usernames and 50 passwords.
  • It uses advanced encryption technology to protect your login info from hackers.
  • You don’t need to worry about losing your MPV.  All your data can be securely backed up and encrypted on your PC.
  • Small enough to fit on a keychain.
  • Free easy to use APP can be downloaded from our website @ w2devices.com
  • The APP is user friendly and completely customizable.
  • The MPV password generator creates hacker resistant passwords.
  • Capable of holding your credit card information.


Here’s how it works:

1- Navigate to the website you want to log into.
2- Click on the username field.
3- Push the button and you are logged in!
   It's that easy!

 

APP user interface:




The software is easily accessible from you Windows Icon area!

 

How can you help?

We use our working prototype every day.  It’s secure and we love it! 
With your help, we will receive the funding to go into full production!
The MPV has made our lives easier, and we are sure it will make yours easier as well.

story:
Our Story

The Inca Rally is a throwback to old exploration days, a rejection of overly safe tours and a search for genuine local experiences. It’s a unique challenge and opportunity to have a positive impact on others. It’s a real adventure; with a purpose.

 

The result is an unsupported and untested charity race across South America’s most challenging terrains; taking racers from Peru to Guyana through Ecuador, Colombia and Venezuela in 3 weeks.

 

These are the countries once fabled to be home to the mythical golden city of El Dorado, believed for centuries to be hidden deep in the South American jungle. Along the way, racers will climb vertiginousAndean peaks, cruise through vast plains, bask in the Caribbean sun and plunge into the Amazonian basin. There is no official route - just parties organised in each capital for the drivers who make it that far.

 

This is the first and only rally to cross this challenging section of South America, from the Pacific coast to the Caribbean beaches.

 

Do you want to help us make it a success?

 

Our Vision: Helping others by going where very few dare to

The Inca Rally’s vision is simple: we are giving people an opportunity to break away from the safety of their daily routine and taking them to places that few dare to.  We seek to challenge ourselves and play our part in helping others.

 

Fundamentally, we are all about creating memorable experiences for people.

 

The Impact

As a social enterprise, we are highly committed to our charitable causes. Each year drivers vote for one of three chosen charities to receive funds they’ve raised for the rally. 2012 nominees are Incawasi, a Peruvian charity trying to break the cycle of family poverty; EveryChild, working to prevent children from growing up vulnerable and alone; and Survival International, campaigning for tribal people’s rights worldwide.  All three charities operate in countries along our route.

 

Before embarking on their adventure, participants will raise money for the chosen charity and will have the opportunity to visit projects along the way, giving them a unique insight under the skin of each country. At the end of the rally, the surviving vehicles will be donated to doctors, teachers and other key members of the community, to benefit the local population.

 

Creative Projects

We couldn’t possibly embark on a journey like The Inca Rally without documenting it and exploring some of the musical and cultural wonders of each country. For this first year, your help and support will enable us to:

 

Film a series of travel episodes

A number of production companies have been interested in documenting our racers’ amazing journey and highlighting the work done by the charities that we stop at en route.

 

Since this is the race’s first year; we want to focus on the route’s logistics before tackling the coordination of a full production crew. Therefore, we are going for quality, not quantity, this year and grouping a number of local camera men in each country to film mini episodes to show online.

 

Your support will allow us to get the documentary’s proof of concept together and show what a great documentary we could make.

 

Music Festival in Guyana

There’s no question about it - Guyanese definitely know how to party! Their unique mix of Afro-Caribbean, Latin and South East Asian cultures make it the perfect melting pot to organise a local musical festival at the end of the race.

 

This not only will give us the perfect opportunity to highlight the cultural and musical wonders of the country, but it will also benefit the domestic economy by working with local businesses throughout the event.

 

We are already in touch with a number of local musicians and artists that are raring to go and your support will allow us to bring it all together into a banging event!

 

Where did the idea come from?

Not content with accepting that every inch of the world has already been mapped, we wanted to find the few places still untouched by mass tourism. The ones that most GPS struggle to pin point, the countries that the average traveller hasn’t gone to; the few corners still relatively unexplored.

 

We also wanted to enrich our lives by helping others. Tired from the city rate race, where we didn’t have a direct beneficial impact on anybody’s wellbeing; we sought to go back to basics and focus on what matters most - your connection with others.

 

Along the way, we found that many people shared our same beliefs and desires for ethical, adventurous travel experiences. And that’s how The Inca Rally was born!

 

How does the future look for The Inca Rally?

The future is looking...exciting! This is only the first race of many others to come in the following years. And, as the rally’s popularity continues to grow, we’ll expand both the charity partnerships, documentaries and event organisation.

 

As we become more involved with local initiatives and community projects, we will increase our lobbying efforts to help their campaigns, and will make a number of documentaries to raise their profile and highlight their causes.

 

We will also continue to make our en route events bigger and bolder. One of our immediate goals is to grow the final musical event in Guyana into a full-on eco-friendly festival that can also attract many of the local artists from surrounding countries.

 

What We Need & What You Get

From its colourful beginnings, The Inca Rally has been funded solely by its founder; who has been sleeping very little and working a number of projects to pay for it all. Although this will continue to be the case in order to ensure the rally goes ahead no matter what; we could really do with your support to cover some of the costs in the long list of things we’ll need to buy along the way.

 

Costs include hiring camera equipment, camera crew transportation, satellite router to upload content in the most remote areas, car mounted cameras, 101 car parts (to be able to complete the rally and document it all), promotional content…the list goes on.

 

Even if we do not achieve our full funding goal, the race will definitely still take place. However, without your help and support, we may not be able to film it all and organise a big musical event at the end. Thus, reducing the positive impact we could have on local charities and businesses. So your help will allow us to help them!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot afford to help us out financially, you could still be an invaluable help by spreading the word and sharing our project with your friends. You also give our Facebook page a quick like and stay up to date with the latest developments through our Twitter page.

 

Also, you could really help us out by providing (or introducing us to somebody that could) some of the kit below.

 

Kit for Coverage!

An adventure such as The Inca Rally involves a remarkable amount of equipment and logistics. While we are looking for financial sponsors, we could also do with individual sponsors who can either provide or pay for specific required equipment. The list of potential equipment sponsorship opportunities is enormous, ranging from branded clothing and mechanical parts to GPS trackers, walkie-talkies and camera equipment. If you think you could help us with any of those, we’d love to hear from you!

story:
Description
Concept: 

Bread for Change is a social business currently in the conceptual phase and is quickly gaining both community and national recognition. The concept is an artisan bakery to be located in an economically blighted area of Philadelphia PA known as Point Breeze. The mission of the project is to be a catalyst for economic revitalization through holistic community development, job creation, education and job training, community outreach, micro business and various other projects impacting the community as well as global issues of hunger and water accessibility.

The Need:

The scope of hunger both at home and abroad has reached all time highs:

• 915 million severely malnourished persons globally
• 25 Million severely malnourished persons in the United States
• According to U.S. Census data released in September 2010, more than 30 percent of residents in Philadelphia’s 1st Congressional District —just a few miles from the historic Liberty Bell — live in poverty. Overall census data found Philadelphia to be the poorest among the country’s 10 largest cities, and the 1st District one of the hungriest, second only to the Bronx, N.Y.


Scope of Impact:

Locally:

Bread for Change will employ under employed individuals from the community served, going a step further Bread 4 Change will provide employees with on job training and education in culinary arts as well as business management and various job related skills. In addition to the training and financial benefits, employees will have access to on site child care, professional development services, opportunity for micro business loans as well as international service opportunities at partner locations.

Internationally: 

One of our driving beliefs is that an underlying need of every human is to live for a purpose, within a story bigger than them selves. As a result we strive to provide avenues for connection with that story, initially through providing basic hope and education and meeting in our employees’ community. We take that belief a step farther though our international operations where we will intentionally plant an operation in an area where families are truly living day to day without basic staples, initially partnering with existing organizations in those areas. The scope of our international mission will be a 1 for 1 model where for every loaf of bread we sell domestically we will give a meal to a family internationally who otherwise would go without. From that platform we plan to perpetuate the same model of holistic community development through education, job training, water access as well as micro business loans and other development and crisis response projects as necessitated. 

What is a Social Business?

A social business is a non-loss, non-dividend company designed to address a social objective within the highly regulated marketplace of today. It is distinct from a non-profit because the business should seek to generate a modest profit that will be used to expand the company’s reach, improve the product or service or in other ways to subsidies the social mission.

Why we choose Social Entrepreneurship

While there are many virtues to non-profit incorporation we truly believe that our role is to maximize social impact through creating a good business which not only provides a catalyst for individual life enrichment but also widespread economic revitalization. We call it “Profits with a Purpose,” where the profits derived from our product will be used to expand the social mission of the organization opposed to our bank accounts. While it is similar it ensures that the mission is self sustaining and not as limited by an annual budget or fundraising.

Our Principals of Social Business:

Business objective is to overcome poverty, or one or more problems (such as education, health, technology access, and environment) which threaten people and society; not profit maximization
Financial and economic sustainability
Investors get back their investment amount plus 25%; no dividend is given beyond 25% investment money
When investment amount is paid back, company profit stays with the company for expansion and improvement
Environmentally conscious
Workforce gets market wage with better working conditions
Do it with joy

story: Campaign on hold
story_txt: Campaign on hold

story:
Our Story

NOMU Restaurant LLC is an idea that was born by Chef Mark Scharaga. The concept is based on the idea that a restaurant can offer impeccable menus with innovative cuisine, but still be responsible to the environment. Chef Mark envisions a dining experience that features only sustainable seafood, local and regional ingredients, and is eco friendly in many other aspects. The menu will feature a wide array of options from ceviche, poke, sashimi, sushi, and tartare. All of our herbs will be grown in hydroponic environments. We will offer a fruit infused sweet tea, a healthier alternative to traditional sweet tea. The goal is to show creativity while offering something back to our planet.

The Impact

Chef Mark's goal is to seek harmony with nature and our natural resources by using recycled plastics, woods, metals, and etc to form an interesting aesthics for the restaurant. So not only are you eating cuisine that is good for our resources, but the whole restaurant is focused on minimizing its environmental impact. I know this model can be successful and show other restaurant owners the value in respecting our resources. WE need YOUR help in raising the money to launch the concept.


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $5,000 on Indie GOGO to go along with another $49,000 ($28,500 is coming from a recently approved loan and the remainder is a lease for equipment) we are raising. So where does this all lead? Well, your money is going for some of our immediate costs. This money will fund restaurant start up costs as follows:

1- Permits/Business License ($500)

2- Deposit on space ($2500)

3- New Flooring ($1300)

4- Deposit for electicity ($700)

We are finalizing a lease agreement with a location in downtown Wilmington. What you get is the following (aside from helping our environment and actually doing a good thing and you can contribute less or more than any of these $):

1- For $25 you get to sign our "Sushi Revolutionaries" wall and a free appetizer when we open.

2- For $100 you get to sign our wall and our founding fathers t-shirt "NOMU, its a lifestyle" and free appetizer when we open.

3- For $300 you get to come to our VIP omakase pre-opening dinner, sign our wall, a t-shirt, and you get one of our special rolls named after you.

4- $10 you get to sign your name on our wall and a free glass of our fruit infused sweet tea.


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't be afraid to ask your friends, family, politicians, cats, dogs, and etc to help us out in raising our money. Please share this with others. Remember, revolutions start small, but can have a BIG impact.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jill Van Gyn. I’m a graduate student, a first aid instructor and a medic. As part of my graduate program I am heading to Gulu in northern Uganda to conduct research into community engagement in the oil sector. The primary purpose of this funding initiative is to acquire vital medical supplies to bring with me to local clinics. The majority will go to St. Jude’s Health Centre, a non-profit society serving the overall health of the entire community. Included in these costs will be expenses for shipping, baggage fees and taxes. The clinic is in dire need of the supplies I have listed below, which you can purchase as a way to contribute.

http://stjudechildrenshome.com/departments/health-centre/

My Contribution: 

I plan on engaging in this community beyond my own research. I am a licensed emergency medical responder and will be volunteering as a medic in Gulu and the surrounding areas. Further, I plan to adapt a volunteer program I run here in Victoria. This program aims to teach high-risk individuals basic life saving skills so that first aid can be carried out on a peer-to-peer basis until medical attention can be made available. This area of Uganda has very limited emergency response and as such creating a stop-gap in the case of injury could prove vital to enhancing the security of the community. Finally, the delivery of the vital medical supplies, which is the focus of this funding, will help to enhance emergency medical care.

My Research:

The Acholi people of this region are recovering from a 15-year conflict with Joseph Kony’s Lords Resistance Army. Many of these people are Internally Displaced Persons, have lost family members to the brutal raids carried out by the LRA and are fighting to return home to live out their lives in peace. Uganda’s emerging oil sector has displaced many of the people returning home and left them without their traditional livelihoods. Engaging the community in ethical inclusion in the oil sector and mitigating land rights and potential conflict will be an important issue in guaranteeing the rights and security of this valued community.



What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal- funding allotment will be two-fold:

I am able to purchase all of the listed medical supplies through my employer, Alert First Aid. I will be getting it at cost. However, I will be asking you to purchase them at the retail price. The remaining balance after cost plus shipping, baggage fees and taxes will go towards my research. The very people who will benefit from the medical supplies will also benefit from my research. These surplus funds will go towards hiring translators, guides, and research assistants all of whom will be drawn from the same community.  Anything beyond this will go to other costs such as permits, transportation and research supplies. In this manner I can carry out my research while immediately contributing to the community in a meaningful and tangible way. I will also be volunteering my services as a medic at local emergency hospitals and hope to teach a community-based first aid course once I am on the ground and established.

The Impact

Uganda as a whole is considered a relatively stable African country. However, the northern region is largely cut off from the south and is in a geographically precarious area, bordering South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Service delivery, medical among them, is very unreliable and the transport of supplies to this region lacking. Further, the region is slowly recovering from 15 years of prolonged conflict with the LRA. The Acholi were routinely targeted for murder and mutilation, with many of their children kidnapped and turned into child soldiers and sex slaves. The Acholi were moved into IDP camps that at one point exceeded 1.8 million and were known to have some of the world's highest rates of mortality. Today, the north is trying to achieve stability. However, with high rates of unemployment, devastated traditional livelihoods, and land rights hanging in the balance, many are living in the deepest of poverty. The oil industry, which if managed correctly, could mean an economic resurgence for the north. 

I will be spending six months in Acholiland, researching existing data and interviewing community members, key stakeholders and government and industry officials. I have been tackling this issue for the past 7 months through my MA program, independent desk research and maintain a strong connection with my advisor who has close ties to the community. This will not be my sole source for funding but will provide vital resources that are needed in order to complete this research successfully. I am confident that through my research, which will focus directly on the needs of this community, I can make a meaningful contribution in encouraging the effective, safe and ethical inclusion of the Acholi in this vital sector.

Lists of Medical Supplies for Purchase

*your contributions will go to the collection of items based on need

*you can contribute any amount - this will just give you an idea what your contribution will go towards

*if I am unable to bring all of the supplies with me some will be shipped and some will be brought by my mother who is coming to Gulu later in the year.

Emergency airways (infant, child, adult) 

Bag of 24 - $12 

Box of 100 - $39

Wound Dressing Supplies

Case of soaker pads (for blood) - $60

Case of non-adherant pads - $80

Case of gauze pads - $70

Case of gauze roller bandage - $40

10 boxes alcohol prep pads - $40

Obstetrics

Obstetrics kits - $12 each

10 Disposable vaginal spectrometers - $10

Catheters

10 per case - $20

Intermittent catheters (50 per case)- $35

Other supplies may be added based on evolving demands. WOUND DRESSING AND CLEANSING SOLUTIONS ARE THE MOST IN NEED.
