I will be getting it at cost. However, I will be asking you to purchase them at the retail price. The remaining balance after cost plus shipping, baggage fees and taxes will go towards my research. The very people who will benefit from the medical supplies will also benefit from my research. These surplus funds will go towards hiring translators, guides, and research assistants all of whom will be drawn from the same community.  Anything beyond this will go to other costs such as permits, transportation and research supplies. In this manner I can carry out my research while immediately contributing to the community in a meaningful and tangible way. I will also be volunteering my services as a medic at local emergency hospitals and hope to teach a community-based first aid course once I am on the ground and established.The ImpactUganda as a whole is considered a relatively stable African country. However, the northern region is largely cut off from the south and is in a geographically precarious area, bordering South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Service delivery, medical among them, is very unreliable and the transport of supplies to this region lacking. Further, the region is slowly recovering from 15 years of prolonged conflict with the LRA. The Acholi were routinely targeted for murder and mutilation, with many of their children kidnapped and turned into child soldiers and sex slaves. The Acholi were moved into IDP camps that at one point exceeded 1.8 million and were known to have some of the world's highest rates of mortality. Today, the north is trying to achieve stability. However, with high rates of unemployment, devastated traditional livelihoods, and land rights hanging in the balance, many are living in the deepest of poverty. The oil industry, which if managed correctly, could mean an economic resurgence for the north. I will be spending six months in Acholiland, researching existing data and interviewing community members, key stakeholders and government and industry officials. I have been tackling this issue for the past 7 months through my MA program, independent desk research and maintain a strong connection with my advisor who has close ties to the community. This will not be my sole source for funding but will provide vital resources that are needed in order to complete this research successfully. I am confident that through my research, which will focus directly on the needs of this community, I can make a meaningful contribution in encouraging the effective, safe and ethical inclusion of the Acholi in this vital sector.Lists of Medical Supplies for Purchase*your contributions will go to the collection of items based on need*you can contribute any amount - this will just give you an idea what your contribution will go towards*if I am unable to bring all of the supplies with me some will be shipped and some will be brought by my mother who is coming to Gulu later in the year.Emergency airways (infant, child, adult) Bag of 24 - $12 Box of 100 - $39Wound Dressing SuppliesCase of soaker pads (for blood) - $60Case of non-adherant pads - $80Case of gauze pads - $70Case of gauze roller bandage - $4010 boxes alcohol prep pads - $40ObstetricsObstetrics kits - $12 each10 Disposable vaginal spectrometers - $10Catheters10 per case - $20Intermittent catheters (50 per case)- $35Other supplies may be added based on evolving demands. WOUND DRESSING AND CLEANSING SOLUTIONS ARE THE MOST IN NEED.

story:
Update Video #4


FEATURED PERK: Name that Chicken! When you donate $60, you can choose one of the four poor nameless chickens and one rooster below and give them an identity. We'll mail you a thank you with a photo of your chicken, and you can come visit him or her on the farm!


Update Video 3:  July 18

 

Update Video 2: June 2nd

Update Video 1: June 19th

Our Story

Hi there, we're Kern Family Farm. We're small farmers in North Fork, the exact center of California. For the past fourteen years we've been focusing on Farming and giving back to our community. We run our town's school garden, donating one day a week there, and we also help hand out food once a month to the less fortunate. In addition, we run a year round internship program where we teach up to eight people from all over the world farming and homesteading skills.

Our little town needs a lot more TLC. Most of the buildings in our town are vacant, and there are very few options for healthy food. Most people drive out of town to grocery shop, sending money out of our local economy.

That's why we're opening a new, local, healthy market. We want our community to have access to (mostly) organic food, and we want to have an outlet for other local farmers and artisans to sell their produce and products. This will keep more money circulating in our town, and build our sense of community.

We want to move to main street so we can have a better connection to our community, and so we can start including them in events and workshops we hope to host at our store and on our farm.  Right now we have a shop in a basement downtown, but most people don't know it exists. We don't have a shop keeper, so it's run on the honor system. Because of this, we restrict access to members who have to unlock the shop, fill out their own receipts, and lock up afterwards.

Our new store will be much larger, so we can carry more products, have seating, and maybe even a smoothie bar, and yes, a shopkeeper! The building we're moving into is actually no longer an entire building. We're in the process of remodeling the entire structure. Where we need your help is fixing up the interior to create a welcoming environment.

We'll need to buy:

Paint: $250
Shelving: $4,000
Refrigeration and Freezing units: $12,000
Bulk Bins: $4,500
Certified Sinks: $2,500
Display Cases: $4,000
Packaging: $2,000
Seating: $500

The store we have now is bringing in funds, but it's not enough to accomplish the whole task. We love our lifestyle, but it's not a huge money maker. We're constantly competing with the mega corporations that control our food system. They're able to keep food prices low through subsidies and their sheer size. People are continuing to pay less for less nutritional foods full of GMOs, pesticides and other chemicals,. That's why we're so excited about our new store!

We want our community to benefit from healthy, local food, and have another place for them to visit downtown. this is soarly needed in our community. we can't wait to get up and running!

Thank you so much for anything you can contribute.

We hope to see you when we open our doors

With love and respect,
The Kerns

story:
Levo (pronounced Lev-O)  comes from the Latin word meaning "to raise or lift up."

This organization was created by two men who felt the pressing need to uplift the minds, motivate the wills and enhance the way of life of individuals in our communities. The foundation will achieve these goals through unique programs such as Interactive Discussions (Hurt Beyond Words, Understanding and Conquering Bullying),  Mentorship Programs (Step Up) Leadership Development Program and community service initiatives. 

Event Date: Sunday October 20, 2013

Event Time: 8:00 AM

Event Location: Lincoln Park (Broad Street and Lincoln Park, Newark, NJ)


What We Need & What You Get

  • We don't ask for much and anything that you provide would be greatly appreciated. All funds go to one of our community projects that's currently active
  • We currently have a limited supply of shirts and any donation received for $20 via this team page will receive one. We are also providing wristbands for any donation of just $5 (ETA 10/14)
  • You can also visit our website www.levofoundation.org or visit our team page to donate. Making Strides with The Levo Foundation


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • You can follow us on twitter/instagram @LevoFoundation to figure out what other events we have.
  • Also every Friday in the month of October we are wearing pink for Breast Cancer. Take a picture showing your support and use the hashtags #LevoFoundation #iSupport #PinkFridaysForBreastCancer . We will post your pics on our website, instagram, twitter and facebook page.
  • You don't have to donate to participate and be great with us. Make sure you share the word so we can raise awareness.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hey, this September I'm going to be heading to the Monduli District in Tanzania, for one month, in support of the Cwlwm-Monduli charity. It is a small charity, founded in 1985 and aims to help the local people with day to day living and small community projects. It would be lovely if you could donate a small amount of money towards this cause, the money won't simply be given to the people, it will be put towards sustainable projects such as the construction of girls dormitories in order to ensure their safety and building an irrigation system to guarantee clean, fresh water all year round! I will be teaching English out there so a small amount of money will go towards text books and school uniform.

In total I am aiming to raising £800. I will do this in a variety of ways, this is my first option however, I am also going to plan a sponsored event such as a run or something physical to raise even more money. I am running stands at Coventry University once a month to help out a little bit more. Everyone who is joining me in Tanzania, on this project, will aim to raise a similar amount so that we have enough to fund each of the small projects. The money we all raise together is going towards community projects as listed above. The majority of the money is going to be put towards constructing the girls dormitories, the rest will be distributed around by purchasing the materials for building a netball pitch, a volleyball pitch and a playground. We need to come up with plans for preserving the farmers banana crops without using electricity so that all which don't get sold aren't just thrown away. 

One of the schools we're visiting needs a new classroom so we hope we can raise enough money to fund that as this means it will be able to accommodate a greater number of pupils. All the projects are aimed to be sustainable, by providing fresh water, we will enable the locals to use this for farming and improve the areas health. If 4 people donate £20 each, there will be enough to provide school uniforms to one of the schools. If 20 people donate £10 each, you will all have raised enough money to build one netball pitch.

However, if we don't reach the goal we have aimed for we won't be able to help the Monduli district as much as we would have liked, we will be unable to have such a large impact meaning the local population may miss out on the irrigation system or a way of preserving the crops. Hopefully this won't happen!

I'd like to highlight that the irrigation project will provide water to 4,000 people. The farming projects (developing a tree seeding nursery and replanting trees) will help another 4,000 people so by donating you're helping another 8,000 people!

This project is valuable to me and the world, many like this are taking place within the less developed countries and we are slowly making a difference. Please get the word out and let everyone know of my charity! You can use the Indiegogo share tools or just email the link to everyone you know.

Thank you and please donate!! :)

story:
A Short Summary

Hi everyone. We're the Western Carolina Fencing club. We are a recently revitalized club in North Carolina and we are in serious need of proper equipment. Our club was established in 2007, but was not competitive and did not fundraise enough for new equipment. As a result, our new officers have been rebuilding the club from the ground up, and are making fantastic progress. We have our first tournaments slated for this semester, and are very much looking forward to them.

Unfortunately, our club does not currently have the equipment or funding that we need to send all of our fencers to competitions. As a result, we are limited to only three competitive fencers, and even then we are lacking in equipment.

In the past two years that we have taken to turn the club around, we have made a lot of progress, and many of our members are very passionate about the club. We meet twice a week and there is a lot of enthusiasm. As a whole, we would be incredibly grateful for any amount of funds that were donated to help us succeed.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we have only been allotted 650 dollars from our campus club sports committee. While that seems like a fair amount, we have to use that money to pay for new equipment (which at maximum may cost up to $1,000), gas money, tournament fees per athlete, and uniforms.

We do offer perks to donors, which includes a signed thank you from the entire team, updates and pictures from our practices and tournaments, and a fencing glove signed by the entire WCU Fencing team. Sounds pretty cool, right?

If we don't reach our goal, then whatever funds we acquire will be used to enhance the equipment of the fencing club and/or pay for upkeep costs such as tournament fees and new equipment.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute or don't feel as if this is a worthy investment, please share with other people who might be interested. Indiegogo has sharing tools, and you can post the link on facebook, tumblr, or twitter. Thank you very much for having the mental fortitude to reach the bottom of the page, and regardless of whether or not you decide to donate, thank you very much for taking the time to read.

story:
About the Goji Recipes Campaign

Hello all!

Welcome to the Goji Recipes campaign funding page! We are going to launch an online store in the near future to sell organic goji berries and other health food products. Within the site, we will also share our collection of nutritious goji berry recipes for all to enjoy. What are goji berries?

Goji berry is considered as the "Super Fruit" because studies show that it is packed with vitamins and high levels of antioxidants. Benefits of consuming goji berry regularly include:

  • help delay premature aging
  • boost the immune system
  • lower cancer risks
  • maintain cardiovascular health
  • reduce blood glucose, cholesterol and obesity
  • good for our eyesight

We recommend goji berries because we have been adding them in our diets and we experienced many of the benefits towards enjoying a healthier lifestyle. Goji berries blend well with other ingredients because of their pleasant, tangy taste. They make valuable additions to soups, salads, meals and beverage. 


Our website will feature a collection of functional recipes that are simple and quick to make. With our free e-newsletters, you will never miss out on the great deals offering the best-valued goji berries and other health food products.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to help health conscious and busy individuals achieve maximum health and to experience relaxing benefits with minimum expenses. We need your support so we can launch our online store. We are asking for $7,500 for the initial online store startup cost. This includes things like marketing, inventory, etc.

We are also offering some special perks for you just for helping us out!

Starting at $30 (Tier I Seedling Perk), you will receive an 8 oz. sample of organic goji berries and 5 green tea teabags, perfect for a few quick snack breaks. At $50 (Tier II Sprout Perk), you will receive 8 oz. of organic goji berries 10 green tea teabags and 10 jasmine tea teabags.

With a contribution of $100 (Tier III Berry Perk), you will receive 16 oz. of organic goji berries, 20 green tea teabags, 20 jasmine tea teabags AND 10 ginseng teabags! In addition, we will also include 2 boxes of organic tofu and 8 oz. of shitake mushrooms.

Ideally, we will reach our funded goal! In the event that we don't, have no fear! We will still honor the perks and we will use the received funds towards opening the online store. We will continue to determine what options are available to us in order to open this store to serve you a reality!

Other Ways to Help

Please help us spread the word on this campaign! Tell your friends and family, share this with social media and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. Together, we can make this happen!

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign and more importantly, thank you for your support!

story: My name is Dale Williams. I am desperately trying to save my house.I lost my job about 3 years ago and also went through a divorce. I am 30000 behind in my payments.I have since started working and are making payments since last year. However my mortgage company is giving me the run around and keeping me on a string with the promise of a  loan modification . I am sent a letter every month asking for a cure of my loan of 30000 or I may face foreclosure.  I have filled out the paperwork for a modification over 20 times and they always seems to lose a page and make me start over again. This time they said that they had all paper work but denied me the modification based on my ex husbands credit score since his name is still on the loan...but not the deed. I was told that a modification wasn't based on credit but on hardship. SO now they are saying I have to start the process all over again.  I don't want to lose my house but they are trying to break my spirit. If I can pay them the back pay I will be able to save my house without the modification. Please help me stop the mortgage company from continuing to accept my mortgage and yet still take my house from me.

story:
Short Summary

  • I am a Chinese Freelance Translator, started  Chinese Global Language Service since 2004.  In the past 10 years, I have worked as court interpreter and translated business and technology documents from English to Chinese & vice versa.
  •  This boutique translation business  is in now in  dire need of a well designed website to generate business from  high quality clients in the world of technology and global business. We need to raise at least $1500 to build a quality website to reach out to technology and engineering clients.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Most of our team members are retired engineers, scholars and single parents with a need to work from home, therefore a well designed Website is crucial to the survival and success of the freelance translators;
  • Our capacity in translation is top of the notch and very competitive in quality and pricing; we cover all grounds from science research to literature, from engineering to agriculture, from medicine to law; from Chinese to German, Japanese to English, Russian to Korean.
  • The funds will go to pay for the time and talents of a well qualified Web Designer.

The Impact

     With this website, we will  be able to generate 2 to 3 times more traffic than what we are doing now

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not afford to contribute money, your skills of Web Design will be greatly appreciate.

  • Please give your words out about us and our service;
  • Don't forget  to use the Indiegogo share tools!

  What We Need & What You Get 
Most of our team members are retired engineers, scholars and single parents with a need to work from home, therefore a well designed Website is crucial to the survival and success of the freelance translators; Our capacity in translation is top of the notch and very competitive in quality and pricing; we cover all grounds from science research to literature, from engineering to agriculture, from medicine to law; from Chinese to German, Japanese to English, Russian to Korean. The funds will go to pay for the time and talents of a well qualified Web Designer. 
  The Impact
     With this website, we will  be able to generate 2 to 3 times more traffic than what we are doing now
  
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can not afford to contribute money, your skills of Web Design will be greatly appreciate. 
Please give your words out about us and our service; Don't forget  to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I am Reverend Osee Ntavuka a Legal-Representative of Rwanda-Legacy of Hope a registered Christian community association based in Rwanda.

It has been 20 years since Rwanda was bathed in blood from history’s most effective killing spree. The brutal murder of nearly 1 million people in 100 days by machetes and clubs was one of the most horrific and tragic episodes in the 20th Century.

Rwanda is currently a country where 60 percent of the population lives below the poverty line, life expectancy is 49 years, literacy is 70 percent, and 400,000 children (60 percent of those under 20 years old) are orphans, often living on the streets or being cared for by extended families in deprived conditions. Many women are living with the traumatic consequences of rape and violence and HIV/Aids infection which is often passed to their children through breast milk.

The people of Rwanda have made much progress towards overcoming their traumatic past and are looking forward to a brighter future. As a country, Rwanda has a growing economy, still heavily based on agriculture and tourism. and a population looking to further Rwanda's growth in all areas of commerce, medicine and education. However, despite such  encouraging signs of recovery in recent years many problems remain within the spheres of health care and education.

One of the main objectives of our association is to contribute towards improving the physical, mental, and social well being of the Rwandan population. We work to alleviate poverty and suffering through the provision of our social welfare, health and education programmes. Our work also helps to spread the love of God through care and compassion for all humankind and impact the moral well being of the population.

To achieve these aims, Rwanda Legacy of Hope is currently recruiting volunteers! As part of our continuous programme of developing health care and educational support  planned for  2015-2017, we need skilled volunteers in the following areas:

- Consultant surgeons in plastic surgery, ENT and orthopaedics

- Nurses, physiotherapists,

- IT professionals and Teachers 

For further information  on how you can help, please visit our website:www.rwandalegacyofhope.com  and send us your details and area of expertise via contactus@rwandalegacyofhope.com 

(Future plans) you can also help us by donating towards the costs of building a new hospital and technical school.  

What We Need and What You Get


Every penny received goes to support our work in hospitals and schools Rwanda - Legacy of Hope does not use funds received to support administration, staff or travel costs.
Breakdown of costs
Health insurance for 400 people @ £10 per month per capita for 1 year = £4,000
Purchase of 1 pick up vehicle for essential transport for materials and equipment for hospitals, schools and general work for organisation  = £10,000
Food, and accommodation, transport for medical and educational volunteers = £5000
Administration £3000
HIV/Aids Awareness and Prevention programme for 50 women = £3,000
 Welfare of patients after operation £5000
Total-£30,000
Rwanda - Legacy of Hope is unique because it works with  people at grass roots level such as directors of hospitals, schools and community and church leaders. The Rwandan Ministry of Health and Education both endorse our work within the country. 
As a volunteer, you can use your skills and expertise to make a real and lasting difference to the some of the most disadvantaged people in a short space of time through engaging in a focused programme of delivery.
Participation in the work of Legacy of Hope provides an exhiliarating and exciting opportunity to experience at first hand the spectacular beauty of Rwanda, the Land of the Thousand Hills and the warm and generous hospitality of its people.

    The Impact

    Annual Report for 2012-2014

    Health care achievements

     260 patients operated on for Hernia repair surgery using mesh techniques

     52 patients received physiotherapy treatment

    80 patients received plastic surgery 

    48 local doctors received training 

    Donations made of medical kit and vital equipment including diathermy machines

    400 people received basic health insurance 

    Education achievements in local schools

    54 computers donated 
    450 Sports kits donated
    5 boxes of English learning materials donated
    420 School uniforms donated

    The work of Rwanda - Legacy of Hope helps to strengthen communities by empowering them through the provision of vital health care such as plastic surgery where there is a crucial shortage. Rwanda currently has 1 plastic surgeon  to serve the whole country and ENT and Orthopaedic surgery is equally a priority need.   With your help this good work will carry on and yes we can certainly achieve more.

      Risks and Challenges

      The cost of meeting ongoing care and support to those patients requiring medication and post-operative treatment is a real challenge,  but we can overcome them that's why we are appealing to you to help us see this through smoothly.

        Other Ways You Can Help


        Rwanda -Legacy of Hope welcomes word of mouth publicity of our work. You can help us by telling your friends, work colleagues, class mates, hospitals and schools to see if they want to volunteer their skills towards expanding our work. You can fund raise for us by holding various fun events such as sponsored walks, garage sales, quiz evenings, dinner dances - the possibilities are endless!
        Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools available.

story:
We hope to build a parklet in North Berkeley between Rose and Vine. All you need to do to make it happen is pre-buy pastrami sandwiches for you and your friends.

What we're giving you

The cost of a parklet like this is about $50,000.

The parklet will be public space for all to enjoy.

Saul's Restaurant & Delicatessen is selling gift cards at discounts we've never offered before and won't be able to again.

You can pitch in by scooping up deals on Saul's gift cards, and letting all your friends know about this chance to build a parklet.

Impact of bringing Deli to the park

What do we do best in North Berkeley? Eat. Talk. Read. Shop. Stroll. Run into friends. Take a moment out, solo or with family or friends.

But our streets simply aren't designed for that culture - the people-watching, picnicking, out-and-about socializing, lazing the day away. American streetscapes lack the amenities of many other countries. So we just work with what we've got.

Let's turn back the clock! We can still make our streets better for the community and culture we want.

With your participation, we'll transform our humble stretch of pavement into a nice place for enjoying the day, warm nights and neighborhood, for eating outdoors and watching the world go by. We'll make peaceful sidewalk dining and snacking abundant. We can build a place to enjoy our love of place; to reflect on the neighborhood's character - to create a spot to be for awhile.

Other ways you can help

Let your friends know: Pastrami for a Parklet. Get the word out about our campaign!

story:
If anyone is feeling like they have a little too much cash in their pockets, or want some positive karma in their life please help me fund a trip to bring that crazy gal driving the motorbike to Canada for a couple weeks!!

Sud is from Bali, Indonesia. She spent 3 months in Canada on the same 6 month Canada World Youth program as I back in 2011-2012. She has been dreaming of coming back to Canada since she left but now more than ever since our good friend Stacy is getting married this summer in Merritt, BC. However, the combination of super expensive flights and visa costs, along with super low Indonesian wages make it impossible. 

If you could, donate a couple bucks to help make her dream a reality! You may get to meet this amazing, inspirational lady :)
Trust me, if you knew this women you would know she deserves it!

Thank you all for your support!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, our names are Tiffany Hakim & Lawrence Da Silva and we are a young, ambitious couple. Our favorite thing to do is EAT! Unfortunately, that's an expensive "hobby." We've decided it's time to quit our 9-5 jobs and start adding REAL value to peoples lives! We want to help people save money on food as well as help the restaurants. Everyone in this situation wins! We've decided we can't invent the wheel, so we are just reinventing it. Our wheel is coupons. We took a unique approach to the general coupon market and invented The BOGO Card. The way it works is really quite simple (for everyone except for us of course) all the consumer has to do is present their BOGO Card to the cashier and receive their discount! We are in the process of creating a generic software that will go into the restaurants POS system so when the number or barcode is scanned it will automatically give the customer the discount. Couldn't be any more simple! We are dealing with the difficult (and expensive) part now so when The BOGO Card is launched it's as easy as 1,2,3!

What We Need & What You Get

The BOGO Card will be a monthly subscription to discounts. We will have three different types of discount cards available. The different options are: The Food Junkie, which will be $10 and you will receive 10 BOGO discounts a month, The Food Hero, which will be $20 and you will receive 20 BOGO discounts a month, and The Food Coma, which will be $30 and you will receive 30 BOGO discounts a month. 

Right now we are in the position of having to receive funds for our company. We are asking for $10,000 to contribute to the development of the software.

The Impact

On average we spend around $40-$50 a week on food alone! Our goal is to help everyone save money while bringing business into restaurants! We want The BOGO Card to be NATIONWIDE! Everyone who eats should own a BOGO Card!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge we are facing is the software because we are definitely not software engineers or programmers! We have very little knowledge when it comes to POS Systems and the software used for them. We've got quotes from many programmers and we know who to go to for help and the creation of the software. It is very expensive and that is why we need to raise money.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't donate money, it's okay we completely understand! We would greatly appreciate it if you help spread the word about us and help by posting our link for people to donate to us. We thank you in advance for all your time, contributions, and efforts of helping us make our dream a reality! We look forward to helping you save money!

story:
THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY IF YOU PLAN TO VISIT MIAMI AT ANY TIME IN YOUR LIFE

THIS IS NOT TIMESHARE - NO EXTRA FEES OR ANY ORIENTATION

 This is Easy As Checking IN and OUT of a Hotel - No String attached.

My Name is Ed Blaze and I LOVE Miami! I travel to Miami Beach at least twice a year. With that many visits, I'm always searching for Best Hotel Deals, but not at just any hotel.

I only stay at 4 - 5 Star Hotels!

At least, that’s where I want to stay, but it NEVER happens because of the outrageous prices charged by 5-star hotels!

Then I started thinking about this for some time and I figured:

  • I can't be the only one who wants a nice place to stay when they come to Miami
  • Everyone deserves the chance to stay at a 5-star luxury condo for a weekend
  • Everyone deserves the chance to impress their date, wife, girlfriend, boyfriend, husband… you get the idea

SO…

Why not crowdfund it?

Use your pledge for the date it is more convenient for yourself.

STARTING IN JULY 2015

These condos will come complete with all the amenities of 4- 5 Star Hotel offer
to make this happen...
We need to raise enough money to put as down payment for buying 20 luxury condos.


Condo candidates we are currently assessing include:

  • Fontainebleau Miami Beach 
  • The Ritz Carlton Residence
  • Mondrian South Beach Hotel
  • Hilton Bentley Miami/South Beach
  • Yacht Club at Portofino 
  • Trump International Beach Resort

Stay in Miami where celebrities hang out!

  • Free airport pick up/drop off
  • Pledge now and start booking as soon as JULY 1ST 2015 
  • Condos include all the amenities of a luxury hotel
  • Comes with many perks
  • Let us know if you need another perk that will fit your ideal vacation better
BEDROOM

LIVINGROOM



Just visit 10 Reasons to visit Miami

Miami is the place to go for a laid-back time that’s fun on any occasion, whether you go with your boyfriend, best friends, or family. Are you interested in making the trip to the sunshine state? Have you ever been there? What do you think of Miami?

JUST IMAGINE WAKING UP TO THIS VIEW

IN THE NEWS

  • NEWSWIRE PR

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

We believe everyone can be a part of this campaign. Here are some ways you can help:

1. BECOME A SUPPORTER:

Pick one of the exciting levels of rewards options and become a supporter using your credit card. Big or small, all funding make a huge difference. 

2. GIVE AS A GIFT TO A FRIEND:

You can give your perk as a gift to another recipient. If you would like to give in memory of a family member or friend we have special reward incentives just for you.

3. SHARE THE CAMPAIGN ON TWITTER & FACEBOOK:

Support this campaign in Social Media, even if you can't pledge, take 2 seconds of your day and show this to a friend that may like it.

A quick tweet or status update with a link to our Indiegogo page is super important. Make use of your online influence and let people know why you're supporting us. Make sure to tag it #MiamiPrivacy

Thank you so much for your support!

Still have questions? Email:  MiamiPrivacy@gmail.com

FAQ

1. Is this a timeshare? - No this is not a timeshare, you pick a perk and that's all you spend or stay at the condo/no surprises of any kind. Basically you are paying your stay in advance and because of that you will have a huge discount and will become member of a group with discounts in multiple areas, such as transportation and similar luxury condos.
2. How can we trust you with our money?  - I know you might worry about your money. To reassure you that I'm not gonna disappear with the funds consider this - I can't hide anywhere because I'm a traveling comedian! My schedule is posted on my website, www.edblaze.com, all the time. If anything happens, all you have to do is show up at one of my shows, beat the shat at me, and ask for your money back.
3. Do you have a website? - Yes www.miamiprivacy.com still under-construction, but will start taking reservations as soon we get closer to the goal

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

We at Shalom of Oakland have been working in East Oakland for four years.  We have mentored and taught.  We have hosted After School Programs and basketball teams.  We have reimagined our lives in light of Jesus and His teachings about a particular way of life.

We are finally renting our own humble, simple storefront, and we believe that it is important to allow our young people to design a beautiful, safe and inspiring space.  The physical space around us does affect us, and we want to make this space special.

What We Need & What You Get

The money will be spent on two general categories:
  1. Supplies & Furniture (Toilet, Sink, Paint, Couches, Chairs, Video Projector, Rugs, Stereo System, Curtains/Blinds, Art Prints & Frames)
  2. Paying Professionals (Electrical, Drywall, Plumbing, Muralist)

The Impact

Beyond a safe place to be, which is incredibly important in East Oakland, this interior will help us have a clear and creative perspective as we seek to gain new life perspectives and skills.  We teach peacemaking, reconciliation, generosity, love, service and prayer.  This space will help us form our own community and identity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! We hope this campaign will introduce our work to more people.

You may want to donate specific items (toilet, couch, art piece, etc.)  See our website for more details... http://www.shalomofoakland.com/Things-We-Need

story:
Short Summary

50 Shades of Blue is a new dog toy company that was inspired by the vision of my dog's vision.

I am Nathan Higdon, and I started 50 Shades of Blue Dog Toys because my dog, Sam, had trouble playing fetch with yellow tennis balls. I did some research, and I realized that dogs see similar to color blind humans (Deuteranopia). After a search for Blue Balls, go ahead and laugh, I found that he could see the color Blue on his toys.

This campaign is important to me because I think that many dog owners are missing a way to visually stimulate their furry friends.

Contributors will be helping me take the business to the next level, which is a nationwide product launch online via Groupon.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I need funding to trademark the name and logo, order additional product and raw materials. We source the Blue Balls, but the rope toys are handmade from US materials and natural dyes (right here in my kitchen).

You may be wondering what you'll get in return. You will be getting some of the product for your dog. (Remember to keep your dog's chewing habits and preferences in mind. Always supervise their playtime!)

If the goal isn't reached, the funds will go toward completing as much as possible, and I'll continue to personally fund the rest. The immediate goals are to incorporate the business and trademark the products, then order more products (we're stockpiling for the product launch).

The Impact

 

The value behind this product and your contribution is that dogs will have an opportunity to play with toys they can actually see. Keep in mind, you can see a Magenta car, but you may not want to play with it. This is to say that color can't always change a dog's preference in toys, and toys are are not suited for your dog's particular personality may be ignored or distructed just like the others.

We also want to support local humane societies through monthly drawings out of our customer base. Buying our toys can impact your local pet community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Aroostook Hops is a small family farm in northern Maine, founded in 2009 by a husband and wife team of Jason Johnston & Krista Delahunty.  At the time we started growing organic hops commercially, we were one of only three hops growers in the state of Maine.  We started out small, and now have 4 acres of hops (with 5 varieties to offer).  Some of our mature hops plants are 5-years old.  

We have both worked hard at our venture, and are proud of what we have accomplished up to now.  We have been recipients of two separate USDA Sustainable Agriculture Research and Education grants, been invited to present at the 2013 annual UVM Hops Conference, been featured in magazine and newspaper articles, and have been a part of a Maine state agriculture legislative tour of our northern-most Maine county, Aroostook county.

We were excited recently to have our hops featured in the “Crown Breaker Artisan Ale”, the 2013 Beer Advocate Extreme Beer Fest brew in collaboration with Dogfish Head Brewery, where all ingredients were sourced from small “mom and pop” operations like ours.

We have managed to pick by hand the last four seasons, but can’t sustain that kind of labor-intensive method with our increasing hops plant acreage and plant maturity.  We are launching an Indiegogo campaign to fund a small-scale commercial hops harvester and a tow-behind sprayer, which we need in order to continue to manage well what we grow.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Despite all the sweat and hard work we’ve put in the last five years, we are now at a point where we need help to move to the next level.  With four acres of hops to harvest in the coming years, it is imperative that we acquire a mechanical harvester to accomplish this.  Hand picking is just not feasible at this level!  

There are plans available through the UVM Hops team that we will use in collaboration with local experts to build.  The UVM-designed machine has been built initially for $35K, but we think we can tweak the design to be finished for under that – around $25-27K.   This will be the first commercial hops harvester in the state of Maine, and will represent a leap forward for the industry.  We also have plans to cooperate with other small hops growers for them to utilize the machinery and help them to grow. 

We also need to purchase a bigger sprayer than what we currently use to combat the biggest threat to our organic crop: downy mildew.  We use organic growing methods, and will use the sprayer for OMRI certified products that will produce the best quality hops cones for our brewing customers.  This will cost about $3600 to purchase.

As a contributor to our fundraising campaign, you will receive unique perks that will allow you to publicly show your support.  Our logo will be added to some very stylish t-shirts, caps, pint glasses, and keychains, and handmade hops soap.  Depending on the reward level you choose, you can select the merchandise that most interests you. 

Also, some reward levels provide you with a unique opportunity to experience the best of times at Aroostook Hops – how does an evening steak dinner for two with samplings of fresh hoppy beer sound?  Or are you interested in a personal tour of the hopyard?  How about an engraved brass plate mounted on an end pole that permanently names a full row of hops after you or someone special?

Your support will help us to accomplish our goals and further the hop growing effort in Maine, and we hope that the reward we offer will be meaningful and worthwhile to you, in turn.  Check out our Indiegogo campaign now, and join in this exciting venture as we “grow” together!

 

The Impact

There is an increasing interest in local and organically produced hops in the Northeast, as well as in craft brewing.  With our experience and knowledge, we are positioned as leaders in the field and are happy to share with others what we have learned. 

We have a successful track record of receiving grants, publishing scientific papers, and delivering talks on in our field.  We will approach a successfully-funded Indiegogo campaign in the same way we have approached every other project we have taken on together – with responsibility, hard work, and true integrity. 

Your contribution to our campaign will have a huge impact… we have worked so hard and called on every generous volunteer to get the fall harvest in the last couple of years, but without mechanized harvesting, we cannot continue to keep up to the amount of vines to be picked.  We need you to help – and every contribution will be greatly appreciated!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially to a campaign.  However, your greatest value may be your voice – you can make a huge difference if you get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Use the Indiegogo “share” tools, use Facebook and email, whatever gets more people involved.  Encourage your contacts to also share with their contacts – we only have 50 days to make this happen, and every person reached helps.  Thanks for your support in revitalizing the hops industry in the Northeast!

story:
Please Be Joe's Hero!

Welcome to the crowd funding page that will hopefully help us give Joe the best bachelor party any human has ever had. As you probably know, Las Vegas can be quite an expensive and exhausting trip, so what we are trying to do is raise enough money to make it slightly less expensive and even more exhausting.

Yes, we could do Vegas the cheap way, but why do the $29 room, fly in the cargo hull of the plane and eat at the $.99 buffet when you have GREAT friends and family that will help pay for the penthouse suites, first class flight and the best restaurants in the world!!!! Don't you think Joe deserves to sit back in his big leather first class seat, sip on a delicious Zima, and enjoy the flight? So do we! 

What this mess is gonna cost us?

Now of course, with all my Las Vegas expertise (trust me, I'm a professional), I would like to give you a little taste of what this place costs...

Limo to airport - $60 (each way)

Airfare - $400 and rising!

Hotel -   $400 (Nice room, no penthouse....sigh)

Food - $300 (no $.99 buffets for this kid!)

Adult beverages - $301+(yes, the booze is always more than the food and this is a low estimate when drinks are $18 each. That's less than five drinks a day. Very respectable, Mom.)

Water - $50 (Do you have any idea how hungover he'll be after all that booze?)

Gambling - $25,000 (Gambling losses are a write-off)

Bail Monday - depending on the level of severity... $5000?

Ok, OK so without the $25k in tax write-offs and bail momey, we are already over $1500!!! You get the point, this isn't your standard trip to the Tailgate Tavern. 

 

What's in it for you?

Fine, if you're going to be selfish about it....

Check out the pretty sick options on the right hand side of this screen. Yea, I know, PRETTY SICK. 

 

Essentially....

We need you more than you need us, but who doesn't love Joey B? I know everyone wants this kid to have the time of his life! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone has the extra money to send our way (hell, that's how I got here in the first place), but we would really appreciate it if you could share this with all of your extremely famous, wealthy and media mogul friends.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  My name is Wade Marrs and I am a 22 year old dog sled racer.  This project is to help me fund my dreams of winning the Copper Basin Race, The Sheep Mountain, and the Iditarod.  In case you are unsure what these races are...they are dog sled races, or some would call it mushing. I have been competing since 2007 and have won a few smaller races as well as the Junior Iditarod.    I love all of my dogs and I feel this year will be a great year competitively for me and my team.   

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for help to raise about $5500 dollars. The funds collected will go to my entry fees as well as dog booties (dog socks), and food for the dogs and myself.  I am more than grateful for any amount you can give.  The main raceis the Iditarod.  This is the longest race of the season which begins in Wasilla, AK and rides all the way to the west coast to Nome, AK.  The  prizes in the race range from an ounce of gold for the first person to selected towns, a new truck, and the final person to cross the finish line gets the lantern which means the race is over.  So I ask you to please help me in getting some of these prizes. 

The perks that you will recieve are: A personal thank you e-mail, a personal thank you video, your name on my website under the contributors list, your name on my website as well as the Iditarod.com website as contributors for me, and last I will give 2013 Iditarod Race autographed picture of me from the beginning of the race.  The autographed picture will get to you in mid march since that is when the race will be held.  

Please share this page to everyone you can.  I thank you sincerely, Wade

story: With the recent record breaking cold nights we've had here in Los Angeles I got to thinking about the ones less fortunate that don't have a warm bed to curl up in or nice blanket to block the cold.  I want to give blankets and sweaters to those less fortunate, and with your help I can.

story:
USE YOUR IMAGINATION

Imagine a woman of your dreams, your object of desire. Her charm, her sensuality, her passion… Try her taste, feel her smell, hear her voice… Imagine her massaging you passionately and whispering into your ear everything you want. Now free your fantasies and imagine that with a magic wand you can close it in one bottle of beer. The golden drink brewed with her lure, grace and flavored with instincts. Imagine the beer of which every sip is a randez-vous with this hot woman of your dreams… she hugs you and kiss you gently, looking straight into your eyes… How much would you give for that beer?

Explore femininity in its purest form

We, The Order of Yoni, have prepared technology making creation of such unique beer possible. The beer containing a quintessence of femininity. The technology enabling materializing her loveliness, gracefulness and character, giving you the possibility of conversion of a tasty beer into a date with real goddess.

Help us to spread femininity all over the world

The secret of the beer lies in her vagina. Using hi-tech of microbiology, we isolate, examine and prepare lactic acid bacteria from vagina of an unique woman. The bacteria, lactobacillus, transfers woman’s features, allure, grace, glamour, and her instincts into beers and other products, turning them into a dance with lovely angel.

Beautiful Czech model Alexandra Brendlova, our source of Yoni

The crucial part of the project is to ensure the safety of the product. The procedures of isolation and preparation prevent other bacteria and viruses from surviving, providing the final product clean and healthy. In addition, we examine the final product on presence of other viruses and bacteria, the findings will be published on our website to make you completely sure it’s healthy.

FINANCIAL GOAL

Our financial goal is 150,000 EUR. It will enable us brewing 6 batches of ca. 16600 beers each. It includes the brewing itself, ingredients, bottles’ decorations, model’s reward, budget for the perks and the safety limit in case of change of the EUR/PLN exchange rate.

PERKS

We have prepared many of great perks, including beers and gadgets. Beers are only for the EU contributors. We would also like to offer beers to the donors from other countries, but it depends on potential cooperation with importers from those countries. That’s why we highly encourage importers and distributors from other lands to write us on distribution@orderyoni.com. When we find an importer in such countries like USA or Japan, we will inform you immediately that you can choose the beer in a safe way. We would be very glad if you could put a positive pressure on importers by asking them (or distributors, beer stores / restaurants /clubs owners, etc.) to import our beer or even contribute us. 

These are the perks we have prepared for you:

Beers will be delivered in the EU within 2-3 months after achieving the goal and brewing the beer. Within other countries the beer delivery can take 6 months more – it depends on the response of the importers. Beer perks do not have shipping fees because beers are to be picked up in the pick up location. If you prefer the courier option, write us after the contribution on indiegogo@orderyoni.com.

Besides beers, we have many of gadgets, like glass, beer-opener, posters, polo shirts, lighters or mobile phone wooden cases, etc. The gadgets we will deliver in the whole world within 2-3 months after the end of the campaign. You can find more information about the gadgets (for example colours of the wooden cases) on our website. If you choose a color of your gadget, inform us by writing an e-mail on indiegogo@orderyoni.com.

We have also prepared a lot of elegant gadgets for you

The delivery of beer will take place via collection points that will be enlisted on our website, and – within the EU – via courier services. We encourage stores, online stores, restaurants and clubs to take part in this action, we can guarantee it will be financially profitable, we will also provide some promotion of your business. Feel free to contact us on cooperation@orderyoni.com. If you would like to have such collection point in your city, in your beloved beer or alcohol store, ask the store owner, maybe he will be interested in taking part. 

The delivery of the gadgets, glasses, etc., will take place via collection points and courier services.

Courier services are conducted in the whole world.

VISION OF THE FUTURE: NEXT PRODUCTS

"Bottled Instinct" is just a beginning...

It’s not about one beer, but the wider idea. The surplus will help us in creation of future products. Our next beers, with a different model’s yoni each, include:

1)  BDSM ale – sour ale made with smoked plums and vaginal lactic acid bacteria of red-head or brunette model,

2)  Blond ale made with wheat malt, saffron and edible gold, with vaginal lactic acid bacteria of a blond-haired model or celebrity,

3)  Aphrodisia / Dionysia – wheat ale made with ancient strains of wheat, grape juice,

4)  Mona Lisa – brown sour ale with wooden chips, the tribute to the famous piece of art,

5)  Isis – Sour ancient wheat ale with roses,

6)  Cleopatra – Milk stout regarding to Cleopatra’s milk baths,

7)  Lady Godiva – sour ale with English hops.

And many, many of other great beers, based on Anime, history, modern culture, etc., with other beautiful models…

Production of that beers highly depends on your current contributions and making whole action viral. Also, we would like to produce other yoni products, drinks, libido drinks, kefirs, yogurts.

We count on you!

You can also visit our website in the following languages:

  • German
  • French
  • Japanese
  • Spanish

bacteria and viruses from surviving, providing the final product clean and
healthy. In addition, we examine the final product on presence of other viruses
and bacteria, the findings will be published on our website to make you completely sure it’s healthy.
FINANCIAL GOAL
Our financial goal is 150,000
EUR. It will enable us brewing 6 batches of ca. 16600 beers each. It includes
the brewing itself, ingredients, bottles’ decorations, model’s reward, budget for the
perks and the safety limit in case of change of the EUR/PLN exchange rate.PERKS
We have prepared many of great
perks, including beers
and gadgets. Beers are only for the EU contributors. We would also like to
offer beers to the donors from other countries, but it depends on potential cooperation
with importers from those countries. That’s why we highly encourage importers
and distributors from other lands to write us on distribution@orderyoni.com. When we find an importer in such countries like USA or Japan, we
will inform you immediately that you can choose the beer in a safe way. We would
be very glad if you could put a positive pressure on importers by asking them
(or distributors, beer stores / restaurants /clubs owners, etc.) to import our
beer or even contribute us.  These are the perks we have prepared for you:Beers will be delivered in the EU within 2-3 months after achieving the goal and brewing the beer.
Within other countries the beer delivery can take 6 months more – it depends on
the response of the importers. Beer perks do not have shipping fees because
beers are to be picked up in the pick up location. If you prefer the courier option, write us after the contribution
on indiegogo@orderyoni.com.Besides beers, we have many of
gadgets, like glass,
beer-opener, posters, polo shirts, lighters or mobile phone wooden cases, etc.
The gadgets we will deliver in the whole world within 2-3 months after the end
of the campaign. You can find more information about the gadgets (for example
colours of the wooden cases) on our website. If you choose a color of your gadget, inform us by writing an e-mail on indiegogo@orderyoni.com.We have also prepared a lot of elegant gadgets for you
The delivery of beer will take
place via collection points that will be enlisted on our website, and – within the EU – via
courier services. We encourage stores, online stores, restaurants and clubs to
take part in this action, we can guarantee it will be financially profitable, we will also provide
some promotion of your business. Feel free to contact us on cooperation@orderyoni.com. If you
would like to have such collection point in your city, in your beloved beer or
alcohol store, ask the store owner, maybe he will be interested in taking
part.  
The delivery of the gadgets,
glasses, etc., will take place via collection points and courier services.
Courier services are conducted
in the whole world. 
VISION OF THE FUTURE: NEXT PRODUCTS"Bottled Instinct" is just a beginning...

It’s not about one beer, but
the wider idea. The surplus will help us in creation of future products. Our
next beers, with a different model’s yoni each, include:
1)  BDSM ale – sour ale
made with smoked plums and vaginal lactic acid bacteria of red-head or brunette
model, 
2)  Blond ale made with
wheat malt, saffron and edible gold, with vaginal lactic acid bacteria of a
blond-haired model or celebrity,
3)  Aphrodisia / Dionysia
– wheat ale made with ancient strains of wheat, grape juice,
4)  Mona Lisa – brown
sour ale with wooden chips, the tribute to the famous piece of art,
5)  Isis – Sour ancient
wheat ale with roses,
6)  Cleopatra – Milk
stout regarding to Cleopatra’s milk baths,
7)  Lady Godiva – sour
ale with English hops.
And many, many of other great
beers, based on Anime, history, modern culture, etc., with other beautiful
models… 
Production of that beers
highly depends on your current contributions and making whole action viral.
Also, we would like to produce other yoni products, drinks, libido drinks,
kefirs, yogurts. We count on you!You can also visit our website in the following languages:
German
French

Japanese 


Spanish

story:
fuel unpredictably vegetarian. unequivocally community driven. fuel for the body. fuel for the soul. fuel for the community

 

Our Story: So what is fuel? 

Another hole-in-the-wall restaurant?

Not exactly.

Only a restaurant? 

Not exactly.

You want a thick greasy burger and a super-sized candy-water? But that's not who we are; it's not on our map. We can't even tell you how to get there. Not in good conscience.

Suppose you try this instead? 

fuel is ....

Whatever we can think of. Whatever makes sense. And big sense of fun.

An alternative to bottom-line, bottom-dollar, business-as-usual capitalism.

You've seen restauranteurs who believe the quality of food is more important than the quality of the life of a community. That's not what we believe. That philosophy would never get us to our destination.

We offer the finest and freshest in Plant-based, Grain-based, Eco-focused cuisine.

We are Kalamazoo's only completely vegetarian and vegan-friendly restaurant and a deliberate rip in the fabric of the all too-typical, modern American food-ways. 


Our Food: Unpredictably vegetarian



Soups
vegan pot licker soup
vegan gumbo
soup of the day (raw or vegetarian)


Salads

Root vegetable salad with balsamic reduction
Arugula salad
Caesar salad
Cobb

dressing choices include: brown mustard dressing, various fresh vinagrettes and herbed olive oils, creamy garlic, herbed yogurt. 

other additions or options: you can add any protein of your choice and/or a vegan or conventional cheese option to the salads above or take anything away


appetizers

fired tofu skewers with your choice of sauce (peanut, spicy thai coconut, barbeque)
tostones

mains
raw plate of the day
mofongo plate – a deconstructed interpretation of a puerto rican classic. Mashed green plantains, vegan chickenish and baconish, black beans and ajillo (garlic pepper sauce). Just bean option available. Or a southern plate – whole grain malted waffles, cream of wheat crusted & southern fried vegan chickenish, mixed potato and red cabbage cake, with bourbon maple syrup and a mustard green compound butter. Or head to the other south with a creole plate – shrimpish remoulade with crusty baguette, blackened green beans and red onion jam. If you feel far from home, try the comfort plate – meatish loaf, smashed potatoes, scratch made biscuit, seasonal vegetable, butter of the day. You could even create your own spread – choose any protein and two sides. Don't worry, we have pasta and sandwiches too. And again, we let you choose. So try our day pasta with made to order sauce options or our chicago dog kalamazoo style, or a sloppy joe or burgerish stuffed with feta or vegan pepper jack cheese and dressed with arugula, whole grain mustard and capers on Multi-Grain local and toasted Artisan Bread. You can also fill out your plate with any three sides below:



sides
collard & mustard greens mix
raw garlic mustard greens
roasted potato spears
day beans (can be pinto, black, red)
black-eyed peas
vegan mac and cheese
traditional mac and cheese
green rice
fried green tomatoes
french or polenta fries
tostones


brunch
sausage biscuits & gravy
poached egg, toast & burre blanc
eggs benedict
chicken and waffles
tofu scramble
pancakes
eggs any style
granola
raw plate of the day



desserts
truffles
beignets
honey mango banana sundae
monkey bread
raw chocolate mousse
sorbets
raw fruit torte

 

Our philosophy: Unequivocally Community Driven
With each bite of fuel's food, you are supporting space that offers culinary arts classes and on the job training to traditionally marginalized young people. fuel builds on Fire Historical and Cultural Arts Collaborative’s holistic workforce training and youth development programs which provide life skills, culinary training, grant writing, arts training and work experience for youth from traditionally marginalized communities. With fuel's training and kitchen space for Bites, Fire’s culinary arts program, fuel will help Fire continue to serve as a model for economic and youth development in the Edison neighborhood and the Kalamazoo community.  By providing a permanent and licensed kitchen home for Bites, fuel addresses the deeply ingrained social cycle of poverty, violence, and neglect that effects people ages 16 to 24. fuel staff understands that restaurant training and mentoring provides experience in a thriving hospitality sector and allows young people to identify their passion while supporting themselves and their families. At fuel, our attempt is to take it a few steps further.   After young adults are trained through and cater for Bites for a minimum of six months, fuel intends to provide at least one youth with a job in the restaurant. As the business grows, fuel will continue to hire more Bite's trained staff.


What We Need & What You Get

Start-up Equipment

griddle/grill

300

refrigerated prep table

800

chest freezer

150


stock pots x4 |60ea

240

sauce pans x4|30ea

120

saute pans x8 |20ea

160


shelving x6 |40ea

240


waste cans x2|35ea

70

cutting boards x4 8ea

32


brooms x2|8ea

16

dustbin x2 |14ea

28

mop

18

mop bucket & wringer

45



ounce scale

40

pound scale

40

timer

8

thermometers x6 |8ea

48

measuring cups |various

24

measuring spoons

6

utensils |various (spoons, tongs, etc)

120

plates, bowls, cups

500

sheet pans x12 |9ea

108

hot & cold holding pans |various

260

flatware

500

tables

600

chairs

400

food storage squares |various

220


licensing and fees

500

cash register


salaries, training materials & uniforms for 3 at-risk youth to become apprentice chefs

800


4000

total



What You Get

beverage - $10 - $50 - free beverage,  your name printed on the opening night menu & 10% off at fuel for 1 full year & %10 of your donation will also go to help local non-profits.

take out - $ 51 - 100  -  all of the above & free take-out meal for one & a  ticket to our grand opening soiree (live music, good beverages, great food ...).

side dish - $101 - 200 - all of the above & 2 free side dishes

appetizer - $201 - 300 - all of the above, 2 free appetizers and 10% off at fuel for 3 years.

dessert - $301 -  400 - all of the above, 2 free desserts after dinner, 6 of fuel's hand made truffles and 10% off at fuel for 3 years.

foodie's buffet - $401 - 1000 - all of the above and you and 5 friends get to enjoy a two hour cooking class with the chefs of fuel and 10% off at fuel for 5 years.

entree -  $1001 - 2000 - all of the above and you and 5 friends get to enjoy a dinner party catered by the chef's at fuel (we will travel up to 150 miles) and 10% off at fuel for life.

full course meal - $2001 and up - all of the above and for one night that we are not open, the restaurant is yours and 10% off at fuel for life.

Like fuel and the perks? Wanna support our journey? Choose your perk to the right!

Thanks for listening. Hope to see you at fuel in September!

10,393

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out: we are looking for people who may want to help paint, pass out menus & coupons, plant flowers and herbs, tack up fliers or donate kitchen equipment. Also, share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter too!





























































3

story:
UPDATE: Stretch Goal

Since we met our goal so fast, we’re adding a stretch goal to raise an additional $1,200 to launch a Safe Transportation Fund. We love the new space, but unfortunately its location is less convenient for many of our members. Our neighborhood is mostly commercial & industrial, so there's not a lot going on at night, and walking to nearby public transportation can feel uncomfortable or unsafe. Some of our members use Lyft or Uber to get home, but not all of our members can afford to. In order to keep our space accessible, it’s critical that our members are able to access the space safely without a large financial burden. Our goal is to create a shared Lyft account that members may use to travel short distances to or from the space when they don't have another option they feel comfortable with. We've estimated this cost at $100/mo and would like to raise enough money for a year of safe transportation.

------------------------------------------------------

Who We Are

Double Union is a San Francisco-based hacker + maker space for women to work on their projects, whether they’re coding, sewing, soldering, making zines, screenprinting or using power tools. We’re supporting a culture where we don’t just make awesome stuff—we also ask questions, break things and feel confused sometimes. We are intersectional feminists, women-centered, and queer- and trans-inclusive. As women fight for equality in the tech sector, the sciences, and the arts, spaces like Double Union are especially important—but, unfortunately, are rare.

Double Union was founded in 2013 to provide a safe community workshop for women. We’ve grown a lot in the past two years, with now over 180 members and more tools, supplies and events than ever. Members use the space every day and host workshops & events multiple times a week. The demand for a space like Double Union in San Francisco is huge.

Why We Need Your Help

Many, many creative spaces have been pushed out of San Francisco. After two years operating in the heart of the city’s Mission District, Double Union was almost one those casualties. Last month, we and the other non-profit tenants of the historic Fog Building on Valencia St. were evicted so the new landlord could renovate the building. We weren't planning to move anytime soon and we had to act fast to save our beloved hackerspace.

We were lucky enough to find a new location in the Portero Hill neighborhood, not far from San Francisco’s growing Dogpatch. It’s much larger, fully ADA compliant, and its industrial location will allow us to work on bigger, noisier projects. The downside is that the rent is much more expensive. At $3,500 per month, it's more than double what we were paying before the move. Although we have plans to stabilize our finances, we need short-term help!

Double Union is primarily supported by member dues, which are on a sliding scale from $10 to $50 a month, with current average dues per paying member at $20/mo. We also offer scholarships to members who cannot afford to pay. We are not considering raising the dues requirements for our members—it’s critical to our mission to stay accessible to people with low or no income. With any size donation, you will help keep a safe space open in San Francisco for women to learn, collaborate, and work on their projects.

Our first Members Meeting at the new space!

The Budget

Moving expenses & security deposit ($11,500):

As a fairly young non-profit, we were required to pay a security deposit equal to three months’ rent. We also spent about $1,000 on moving supplies and assistance. We were able to pull the money together to move in, but now we need your help. We currently make a total of $3,000/mo from member dues, which isn’t enough to cover rent and other expenses. We are preparing to open up membership applications soon, but until we add new members we can’t afford to keep the space running without your support.

Building out our new home ($1,500):

We brought over everything from the old location, including our couches, tables, shelving and workbenches, but we need a few additions to make the place safe, accessible, and welcoming:

  • One of our biggest needs right now is bike parking so members can keep their bikes safe while they’re visiting. We have our own parking spot in the garage and our landlord is allowing us to install a bike rack in it!

  • We’re eager to add outdoor lighting to make our patio usable at night, and some patio furniture!

  • One of the most common member complaints at the old space was that it required too many keys to get inside. We’re setting up an August Smart Lock and Keypad for our door so members can access the building anytime they want, no keys required!

  • We need supplies for outreach and public events for recruiting new members.

Together, our budget totals $13,000. In the last month our amazing community has pulled together to raise $5,000 already so our goal is to raise $8,000 during this campaign.

Double Union members painting together at Art Night.

What You'll Get

Obviously, you'll get an awesome, bigger hackerspace! But perks are fun, too, so:

We designed the "Feminist Sticker Pack" to connect us—we all know the shiver of excitement from spotting a kindred spirit across a coffeeshop or conference by their laptop sticker of secret allegiance. We’re also offering new Double Union t-shirts so you can wear your feminist makerspace mojo with pride, and some amazing items handmade by our members!

In addition to the fun items we can send you, many of our extremely talented members have offered their time to teach and consult with donors on a variety of subjects. We can help you with your business, research or project—or teach you a new skill!

Last but not least, we're offering tickets to a donors-only Holiday Party so you can come see the new Double Union, meet our members and learn what we're all up to! Details TBA but get your tickets now before we run out!

Note: our in-person perks require a light background check to help keep our members safe.

Feminist Sticker Pack, Meritocracy is a Joke Shirts Coptic Bound Circuitboard Book, Mini Watercolor Set Fused Glass Plate (These are examples of Kathy's work. Each plate is unique and you will get to pick the colors for yours!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Any size of donation will be greatly appreciated, but if you don't have the funds to donate, you can still help us out!

  • Tweet about why you are excited about the campaign!
  • Email your friends who might be interested and ask them to donate!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
You can learn more about becoming a member on our website or blog, by following us on Twitter at @doubleunionsf, and/or by joining our general interest mailing list.

We designed the "Feminist Sticker Pack" to connect us—we all know the shiver of excitement from spotting a kindred spirit across a coffeeshop or conference by their laptop sticker of secret allegiance. We’re also offering new Double Union t-shirts so you can wear your feminist makerspace mojo with pride, and some amazing items handmade by our members!
In addition to the fun items we can send you, many of our extremely talented members have offered their time to teach and consult with donors on a variety of subjects. We can help you with your business, research or project—or teach you a new skill!
Last but not least, we're offering tickets to a donors-only Holiday Party so you can come see the new Double Union, meet our members and learn what we're all up to! Details TBA but get your tickets now before we run out!
Note: our in-person perks require a light background check to help keep our members safe.

 
Feminist Sticker Pack, Meritocracy is a Joke Shirts
 
Coptic Bound Circuitboard Book, Mini Watercolor Set
 
Fused Glass Plate (These are examples of Kathy's work. Each plate is unique and you will get to pick the colors for yours!)


    Other Ways You Can Help Any size of donation will be greatly appreciated, but if you don't have the funds to donate, you can still help us out!  Tweet about why you are excited about the campaign!
Email your friends who might be interested and ask them to donate! Use the Indiegogo share tools!


You can learn more about becoming a member on our website or blog, by following us on Twitter at @doubleunionsf, and/or by joining our general interest mailing list.

story:
Hi!  My name is Kristi Shepherd.  I am a 61-year-old woman in a high stress profession.  And just like most women, I have a lot going on.  Work, home, spouse, children, grandchildren, parents, extended family, friends.  There really isn't time to take care of me.

And then, there is the issue of aging and your skin changing.  And suddenly, how you've cared for your skin in the past just isn't working anymore.

That is what happened to me this year.  Once I hit 60, I started having acne like I never had in high school.  No amount of make-up could cover it.  And I never felt pretty.

So, I invested in a high cost acne treatment that got rid of the pimples, but my "beautiful skin" became dry and wrinkled, and looked tired and stressed.  I tried, but couldn't find a moisturizer that could bring back the skin I had before.

That is how Reprise Skincare got started.  After a lot of research, trial and error, I developed a facial cleansing oil, and skin scrub that helped me to recapture the skin I was born with.  And yes, I did it in my kitchen!  All of the products are made with 100% pure, natural ingredients - you don't need to refer to your old chemistry book to know what you are putting on your skin!

The products are simple to use.  And unless you feel you need it, no additional moisturizing is needed.  That saves time and money.

I want you to know that this is so much more than just a business idea for me.  As is the case in almost all of the projects we work on, Reprise Skincare will do well by doing good.  These are the underlying values that will drive our business development and growth:

NUMBER 1 – We will only use 100% pure and natural ingredients in our products, and will source ingredients that are produced locally whenever possible.  We believe in in supporting local farmers and other small businesses.

NUMBER 2 – We will partner with nonprofits that work to empower immigrants and young women to hire our workers, and mentor and teach them business development and management while paying them a decent wage to produce our products.

AND NUMBER 3 – We are committed to making our high quality products affordable and accessible to all.   High quality beauty products are expensive, and when researching the cost of similar oil facial cleansers, prices ranged from $50 to $125 for a 2 ounce bottle.  Our 4 ounce bottles of facial cleanser will be priced at $22.50.  All of our products will be priced at $25 or less, making them affordable because all women deserve to feel beautiful.

I have a goal of reaching $50,000 from this campaign.  This will allow me to more fully and formally set up the business entity, further source and purchase the 100% pure, natural ingredients, design and produce packaging, set up a small manufacturing facility, hire employees to produce the product and develop and execute comprehensive marketing and public relations plans.  We plan to market and sell the products primarily using social media and online sales platforms, with a limited amount of product carried in small boutiques in Minnesota. 

To reach my goal, I am asking YOU to pre-purchase $135 worth of Reprise Skincare products and accessories at $100.  For just $100, you will receive:  One 4 ounce bottle of grapeseed oil based Daily Facial Cleanser for morning; one 4 ounce bottle of sunflower oil based Extra Moisturizing Facial Cleanser for evening; one 6 ounce container of each Facial Cleanser for refills; one 16 ounce container of Salt Skin Scrub; a Reprise 100% cotton washcloth to use with the facial cleanser; and a turban/headband to use when you wash your face.

This is a $135 value for just $100!  And your package will arrive in time for the holidays.

In addition to financial support, I also ask for your feedback after you've tried the products and your willingness to forward this opportunity on to others you know who want to be part of something that makes women feel beautiful and helps someone do well and do good. 

Help me get this business started!  Please join me in bringing pure and natural skincare products to the marketplace and help all women recapture the skin they were born with.  You personally will benefit from our products and be part of something that does good for the broader community.

THANK YOU!
