story:
The year was 2007. And Rebecca Andersson was noticing something: She could not afford to feed her family the kind of food she wanted to -- local, organic and healthy fruits, vegetables and meats. She wanted food she could trust, at a price she could afford.

From that, Know Thy Food began. It started as a food-buying club where families would buy produce, eggs, milk, and meat in bulk from local farmers and ranchers. They would meet in Rebecca’s driveway to split the bounty. It grew quickly, and four years later they needed a larger location.

Know Thy Food moved in 2012 to the Brooklyn neighborhood in SE Portland. It is the only source of high-quality, local food in that neighborhood. And by merging the food-buying club with a café and market, Know Thy Food is serving as a model for how other food co-ops can become vibrant, food-based cornerstones for their communities. By connecting with farmers directly, we shorten the food chain, therefore ensuring more of each dollar we spend goes directly into farmers’ hands. We are helping ensure a sustainable food system now and into the future.

Success, right? Almost. Business has increased. We’ve added new members. And we’ve added new farmers and producers to our ranks. What we need now is to improve our storefront and infrastructure to support this growth, and reach our next goals.

We need your help, because if we have learned anything in these nine years, it is that we are nothing without community. We want to grow and continue to feed the community with vital, healthy food. We want to support and expand our local sustainable food system. And we want to serve as a model for other food co-ops. To do that, Know Thy Food needs:

·  A better point-of-sale system to track inventory, increase accuracy of sales, increase speed of transactions, and increase sale transparency with itemized receipts.

·  An improved storefront to attract more customers and improve the experience of existing customers.

·  Brighter and more efficient lighting.

·  New coolers! (That loud buzzing? That’s the sound of our outdated produce coolers that also freeze our produce and contribute to food waste). 

Because Portland’s Brooklyn neighborhood is one of Metro’s (regional governing body) areas of development, we have an opportunity to double our investment capital through a matching grant program of up to 50,000 dollars. This is an amazing opportunity for a small business like Know Thy Food Cooperative. We are partnering with our landlord and two neighboring businesses to raise the funds needed to match this Metro grant. Every dollar we raise will help us secure this Metro business development grant.

We are seeking the funds from the neighborhood AND those who care about locally sourced, farm-to-table, environmentally friendly food and products at reasonable prices. We are seeking support from anyone who values food cooperatives and sustainable local food systems. 

More About the Money: 

We started this campaign with the goal to raise $30,000. Since Metro can match up to $50,000 we hope to reach that maximum of $50,000, but our most essential needs will be met for $30,000.

Because of the requirements of the grant, the first $10,000 we raise will be dedicated to storefront improvements: new lighting, signage, replacing the crumbling façade, and partnering with a local artist to create an eye-catching mural that celebrates both Brooklyn neighborhood and our core values.

If we reach $20,000, we will have enough capital to work with developers to create a point-of-sale system that best suits the needs of this unique, multi-faceted business. This is of utmost importance to our fiscal sustainability. We desperately need a system that allows us to accurately track inventory, report sales across market, café and buying club, and track membership patronage. A better system will also save staff time, helping our managers to spend more time researching products and farms, providing excellent customer service, and supporting staff development.

With $25,000 raised, we hope to leverage some tax incentives through Energy Trust of Oregon to improve our produce coolers and reduce our energy costs (our second biggest cost after payroll). New coolers will also help us better display our products and offer more products from local producers.

If we meet our first goal of $30,000, we can accomplish all of the previous goals AND replace and add shelving to the main market area!

These four areas -- storefront, sales software, cooling infrastructure, and market expansion -- are all essential to Know Thy Food Cooperative's growth and therefore also our survival. For this reason, we set our fundraising goal at $30,000.

Our highest goal of $50,000 will allow us to reach further with expansions, energy improvements and most importantly to start to offer Health Savings Plan contributions for our employees – in a first step toward providing Health Care, a basic human right.

Note from the president: 

Know Thy Food Cooperative is like no other business I know in Portland. I learned of it when I moved to Brooklyn neighborhood 5 years ago. I saw the sign in the back of the building which stated Know Thy Food Community Supported Pantry. As a believer in community supported agriculture and local food systems I was intrigued. Now five years later I am a member, customer and volunteer, and I am not sure what my family would do without it.

Our café consistently ranks among the top five most family-friendly cafés in Portland. And it is the only place, in all of Portland, that allows you to go online after your kids go to bed, and put in an order for the region’s finest produce, meat, dairy and eggs to be delivered at the café the next week. It is also the only food cooperative I know that houses local performers to entertain your child(ren) while you shop or enjoy a stellar cappuccino. We have members who drive in from the suburbs -- Beaverton, Vancouver, Lake Oswego and Hillsboro -- because we are the only cooperative in the Metro region that offers access to raw milk collectives, good pricing on bones and organ meats from pastured animals, and the ability to order spices, dried goods, household products and more wholesale. Know thy Food has completely revolutionized my family’s grocery shopping experience without having compromised any of our values. This is a business that is worth supporting and a business model that depends on community support.

Our goals are ambitious. And your investment, perhaps, seems risky. The staff and board of the cooperative are aware of these risks, and one of the reasons we are looking to a crowd-sourcing campaign rather than a traditional business loan is that as a cooperative, we believe in shared, collective risk. We believe that when a community comes together, each taking on a bit of risk, we all become invested in helping the business thrive.

Join me, the rest of our volunteer board, our staff, and our many dedicated members and partners in helping see this food cooperative grow and become a thriving business that can support a thriving local food system, and can serve as a model for food cooperatives nationwide.

story:
Resumen 

Somos una finca familiar de flores en Naguabo. Queremos construir un u-pick. Un modelo de mercadeo directo donde nos visita y cosecha sus propias flores.
También ofreceremos semillas y plantas en tiestos. 

¿Quiénes Somos?

De Rustica, del latín para “del campo” es una pequeña finca familiar ubicada a las faldas del Yunque, en el barrio Mariana Naguabo. Nuestra finca es un pequeño pedazo del valle de Mariana. Ella se encuentra rodeada de colinas habitadas por árboles de roble, que, para eso del mes de mayo, se cubren de flores y pintan el paisaje color rosa. Fue en uno de estos mayos, en el 2012, cuando nos mudamos a nuestra finca y le empezamos a limpiar.


Ese primer año fue uno de eliminar escombros y cortar malezas. Siempre supimos que la finca sería bella, pero de verla ese primer año no nos hubiera creído. Era un basurero clandestino, lleno de todo tipo de despojos. Ya para eso del 2015, la finca estaba lo suficientemente lista para lanzar de experimento un U-pick piloto. Un U-pick es un modelo de mercadeo directo donde el cliente se presenta en la finca y escoge el producto de preferencia. Tendran la

oportunidad de tomarse fotos, cortar su propia flor, comprar semillas y mas. El resultado fue increíble, cientos de personas se dieron visita y quedaron encantadas con el evento. La magnitud fue tal que llamó mucha atención de parte de los medios. Como el Primera Hora Cosechan su negocio en un mar de girasoles, Joven biólogo encontró en la floricultura un modo de sustento y de vida, Indice Toman auge las fincas de girasoles en Puerto Rico, entre otros como el programa de Puertorriqueñisimo. 


Desde entonces, hemos tenido un vasto número de solicitudes para visitarnos y queremos complacerles. No deseamos presentarles solamente una siembra de girasoles, sino proveerles toda una experiencia única, con múltiples variedades de flores, con comida y bebida, con plantas en tiestos y semillas.

Con esta campaña buscamos establecer un U-pick permanente en nuestra finca, en la cual ustedes nos podrán visitar y quedar encantados con nuestro trabajo.


 ¿Qué requerimos?

Para lograr un u-pick permanente en nuestra finca requerimos de 20,000 dolares.


Este dinero será utilizado para instalar un sistema de riego, construir caminos en gravilla, construir el quiosco de entrada, comprar materiales, pagar mano de obra y para la compra de semillas y tiestos.

Recompensas

Para los que aporten con nuestro proyecto, le tendremos un sistema de 6 recompensas, donde se incluye el costo de entrada más girasoles, cuyo precio se va descontando mientras más grande sea su contribución.
La entrada se cobrará por vehículo, de manera que podrás traer a toda tu familia.


El Upick

El modelo de u-pick es uno sumamente popular en Estados Unidos y Europa, pero no es común en Puerto Rico. La razón para esto la desconocemos. Lo que sí sabemos es que la demanda existe. Ya hemos abierto las puertas de nuestra finca en dos ocasiones y se ha llenado a capacidad de visitantes que quedaron fascinados con el evento.


Nuestro plan, por el momento, es un u-pick que abarque dos cuerdas de terreno, partiendo de ahí se extendería poco a poco hasta convertir la finca entera en un U-pick. Tal vez, dependiendo del éxito, en un futuro construiremos un restaurante donde se cocinen alimentos crecidos en fincas aledañas a la nuestra.

Desafíos

¡El clima! Este año aparentamos estar libres de sequía, pero a cambio hemos tenido mucha lluvia. Semanas de mucha lluvia atrasarían las labores pero no las detienen. Seguiremos hacia adelante; lo peor que puede ocurrir es que nos atrasemos substancialmente, pero, de una o de otra, lo lograremos hacer.

nos atrasemos substancialmente, pero, de una o de otra, lo lograremos
hacer.

story:
FÜR ALLE DEUTSCHEN FANS: HIER findest du unseren RELAXFAIR Online Shop. Dort findest du alle RELAXFAIR Lounges, weitere nachhaltige Produkte sowie Markenleuchtmittel "made in Germany". 

 

INTRODUCING

 

 

RELAXFAIR INDOOR: COZY & STYLISH

The Indoor version uses a fabric made of recycled cotton and polyester. It therefore suits the style of your living room, winter garden or your children's room. The material is very comfortable and cozy for the best relaxation experience ever.

 

RELAXFAIR OUTDOOR: BEST RELAXATION

The outdoor version of the RELAXFAIR Lounge uses a recycled nylon. Because nylon is very tear proof, dirt and water repellent, the RELAXFAIR Lounge is the perfect furniture to use outdoor in your garden or on your terrace. You can even leave it in the rain.

 

RELAXFAIR FILLINGS: EASY TO CARE

 

All RELAXFAIR Lounges have an innovative two-chamber-filling-system for a better seating position. They are filled with recycled polystyrene and sustainable foam flakes.

 

If your RELAXFAIR is dirty – you can simply wipe it away or separate the shell and the filling chambers and wash it in the washing machine.

 

 

 

RELAXFAIR IS SUSTAINABLE

We at RELAXFAIR use recycled and sustainable fabrics for our products believing that it is possible to enjoy great designed furniture and to protect the environment.

 

RELAXFAIR IS FAIR

All RELAXFAIRs are produced under fair working conditions. The Lounge is handmade by qualified and well paid seamstresses in Germany. It guarantees the highest quality and the ultimate comfort.

 

RELAXFAIR IS SOCIAL

In addition, we want to be socially responsible. We believe that living together is better than working against each other. Therefore, RELAXFAIR donates 20% of its profits to social and green organizations - reinvesting in the society that believes in our vision.

 

 

 

The Indoor version uses a fabric made of recycled cotton and polyester. It also comes in grey and beige.

RELAXFAIR INDOOR OTTOMAN

RELAXFAIR INDOOR LOUNGE

The material is very comfortable and cozy for the best relaxation experience ever. The indoor lounge can be used in several ways:

 

 

The outdoor version of the RELAXFAIR LOUNGE uses a recycled nylon fabric and is available in anthracite and aqua. 

RELAXFAIR OUTDOOR OTTOMAN

RELAXFAIR OUTDOOR LOUNGE

Recycled nylon is very tear proof, dirt and water repellent.

 

The RELAXFAIR Outdoor Lounge has several possible application fields. Here you can see examples where to relax with the outdoor lounge:

 

 

 

 

All RELAXFAIR lounges have an innovative two-chamber-filling-system for a better seating position. They are filled with recycled polystyrene and sustainable foam flakes.

If your RELAXFAIR is dirty – you can simply wipe it away or separate the shell and the filling chambers and wash it in the washing machine.

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

Georg and Felix liked to start a company, that has a sustainable, fair and social vision. They love nature, the earth we live on and the green lifestyle. They noticed that you can wear ecofriendly clothes, eat Fairtrade-food and live in an energy efficient home. But ecofriendly, fair produced furniture can rarely be found in the warehouses. That's why they started to create a crowdfunding campaign to find supporters for green and sustainable furniture. Because the RELAXFAIR Lounge is just the beginning.

 

 

 

 

 

We have finished the prototypes and are ready for the production. With your help RELAXFAIR wants to change the furniture industry. We are a small and brand new company and only have the capacity to finance a small production volume. As a startup we can’t order a large amount of products.

Now all we need is you.

This is why we need you: You can help us to bring the idea of sustainability and fairness in the world of furniture. RELAXFAIR wants to an example to other furniture companies. Thank you for your support!

 

 

Help us by spreading the word via email and social media. As a community we are strong and can change the world of furniture. We will reward you with a credit for every recommendation. For our german supporters: HIER ist unser Empfehlungsprogramm auch nochmal auf deutsch zusammengefasst.

You can earn: 

  • $40 for every Relaxfair Lounge or
  • $50 for every Relaxfair Lounge + Ottoman

in credit towards our campaign, if one of your referral purchases one of these products. The best: The amount of credits is limitless!

We will apply this credit to your account once the campaign is over. We will then give you a refund on your purchase or credit the purchase of a new RELAXFAIR product.

Our conditions:

  • You only receive credits if your referral purchases a RELAXFAIR Lounge or a RELAXFAIR Lounge + Ottoman. No credits for all other perks and large orders (more than one).
  • If you want to purchase a new product with your campaign credit you can buy every RELAXFAIR product.
  • Contributors cannot receive referral credit for referring themselves.
  • Of 2 contributors, only 1 can be the 'referrer' and receive campaign credit for the other's contribution.

 

HOW TO START

1. Sign in / Log in to your Indiegogo account.

2. Click on that button above the perk list (this is your individual referral link)

3. SHARE SHARE SHARE!

 

 

Want to sell the RELAXFAIR products in your store?

Great! Please write us an email.

 

 

You want to write about us?

Awesome! Click here and you will come to our press page.

 

 

We are constantly adding more RELAXFAIR FAQs to our website here, please check the site for the latest information or questions. 

 

1. THE PRODUCT

2. THE PURCHASING

3. THE SHIPPING

4. THE RELAXFAIR SERVICE

 

1. THE PRODUCT

What is the RELAXFAIR Lounge?

The Relaxfair Lounge is the World’s fairest and greenest Lounge. All materials and fillings are recycled, the Lounges are handmade in Germany and 20% of all profits will be donated to social and green organizations. The Lounge is also very comfortable and cozy. Perfect for your lifestyle!

What kind of materials does RELAXFAIR use?

You can choose between water- and dirt repellent nylon for the outdoor usage or the comfortable and stylish cotton-polyester for your living room. All materials are 100% recycled.

Which colors are available?

At the start of the campaign these colors are available:

  • Indoor version: Grey & beige
  • Outdoor version: Anthracite & aqua

You want your RELAXFAIR in another color? We have stretch goals and if we reach the goals, you can choose between more colors:

  1. Goal: 3,000$: New indoor color: red
  2. Goal: 6,000$: New indoor color: anthracite
  3. Goal: 50.000$: New outdoor color: lemon

Can the RELAXFAIR be used on water? 
No, the RELAXFAIR Outdoor Version is water-repellent, but not waterproof. In our test we left a nylon RELAXFAIR outside during the whole winter and the RELAXFAIR was still perfect.

What's the maximum weight capacity of the RELAXFAIR Lounge?

The RELAXFAIR Lounge can easily withstand the weight of three adults, which is around 250 kg (551 Lbs.).  But sitting alone is more convenient ;-)

How much does the RELAXFAIR products weigh and what is the size?

Can I wash the RELAXFAIR products?

Yes, if the RELAXFAIR is dirty, you can take off the shell and wash it in the washing machine. your lounge will look brand new!

 

2. PURCHASING

When can I choose the color and material of my RELAXFAIR?

We will send out a survey during and at the end of the campaign in which you can select your color & material. If you've purchased more than one RELAXFAIR product, you can choose different colors & materials!

How do I choose more than one perk?

Unfortunately, the Indiegogo system is not set up to choose more than one perk. If you would like to choose more, you need to order the next perk in a separate process. If you need help please write us: info@relaxfair.com.

I preordered a RELAXFAIR, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?

Here do you find more information. If you have further questions, please contact support@indiegogo.com.

There was an error with my contribution. What happened?

Please check out this Indiegogo article. There you can find helpful solutions.

Why am I checking out through Indiegogo?

Crowdfunding is a great way to finance a project. The supporter community decides which projects are good for all of us. Our founders Felix and Georg also supported other projects and loved the community, the updates and perks. Crowdfunding is very transparent with all information about stats, product & company information. We hope to get the full support of the community!

I can't get my payment to work in Paypal, what should I do?

Email Indiegogo at support@indiegogo.com. They'll be able to track your transaction and help with any issues.

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT?

The backer is responsible, please check your country's import duties before purchasing. You can check this duty calculator to get started.

I accidentally ordered the wrong color/ put in the wrong address/ want to upgrade my perk. What can I do?

Please email us: With your full name, address, Indiegogo account name, and the details of your issue. We will help you quickly.

 

3. SHIPPING

When will I receive my RELAXFAIR?

We are doing our best to start shipping to you as soon as possible. We are a small company and right now we only have materials for 150 RELAXFAIR Indoor Lounges & Ottomans. After the campaign we plan on purchasing new materials, so the other customers should receive their RELAXFAIRs until the end of February 2017.

Where do you ship to? Is shipping included?

We do ship RELAXFAIR worldwide and shipping is free within the EU.

Shipping Worldwide:

  • RELAXFAIR Set of 2 Chairpads: $19
  • RELAXFAIR Ottoman: $39
  • RELAXFAIR Lounge: $49
  • RELAXFAIR Lounge + Ottoman: $49
  • 2x RELAXFAIR Lounge: $98
  • 5x RELAXFAIR Lounge: $245

 

4. THE RELAXFAIR SERVICE

Is there a warranty for the RELAXFAIR products?  

Yes, the RELAXFAIR products have a 2-year warranty.

What is your returns-policy?

We know that our products have a high quality. That's why we offer a 14 days’ money back guarantee after you have received it, if you are not satisfied. RELAXFAIR must be in new and resalable condition and you have to pay the return shipment cost.

Can it be picked up locally in US? 
At this point in time we are not able to offer local pick up. Sorry!

Can I test a RELAXFAIR?

You can visit our company in Heidelberg, Germany. There you can test a RELAXFAIR. Please contact us by email if you are planning to visit us.

Is RELAXFAIR hiring? 
We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team in Germany. If you think your background and goals are aligned with ours, please write us.

What if my question isn’t answered here?

We are constantly adding more RELAXFAIR FAQs to our website www.relaxfair.com/FAQ

If your question isn’t answered on this website, we’re happy to respond to any other queries you might have about the RELAXFAIR, the Indiegogo campaign, and our company as a whole. Email us at info@relaxfair.com.

 

RELAXING FOR A BETTER WORLD

story:
♥ ♥ ♥ UPDATE: Yayyyy! We made it to our goal!! With 9 days left to go and a bunch of perks still available - and we still need to raise about $5,000 more to meet our full project budget so any additional donations are welcome and every little bit helps!  ♥ ♥ ♥

Our Story

Work Hard / Stay Hard is a week-long work party created to support a queer arts community in the woods of Middle Tennessee. We are orga­niz­ing for the second year to sup­port our dear Idyll Dandy Arts (IDA) with resources, ren­o­va­tions, and rad­i­cal love. There will be about 100 folks show­ing up to work on crews includ­ing Roofing, Garden, Grounds, Plumb­ing, Archiving, Kitchen, Health & Well­ness, Trash and Recycling, Party Patrol and much more. We’re rais­ing the money to make this a fully-funded project that gives to IDA with­out drain­ing the resources they need for ongo­ing sustainability.

IDA is an inten­tional queer com­mu­nity in the hol­lows of mid­dle Ten­nessee. IDA’s 200 acres pro­vide space for ten res­i­dents as well as guests, interns, musi­cians, expan­sive gar­dens, and lots of projects. It is impor­tant to the residents of IDA to pro­vide a safer space for queer and trans peo­ple to learn rural liv­ing skills and con­nect with a nat­ural space. They work to cre­ate an envi­ron­ment that is open to queer peo­ple of dif­fer­ent back­grounds, iden­ti­ties, and abil­i­ties. IDA is host to the annual Ida­palooza Fruit Jam, a week-long music fes­ti­val and gath­er­ing held every summer.


The Impact

At IDA, for over 17 years, we have had the chance to be our dressed-up, stripped-down selves and to feel seen and cel­e­brated.  So many of us have had our lives sig­nif­i­cantly changed by our time there.  When we see the “Wel­come HOMO” sign, we really do feel a rare homecoming.

Now the land has been pur­chased and we can give back in a new way.  One of our foundling moth­ers, Ha, called it “pride of place”.  We can show our love and really cul­ti­vate that sense of stew­ard­ship.  We can put in the time and love and trust and funds to build the value of this incred­i­ble place. This is the part where you are invited to come show that love; to make that investment.

Our com­mu­nity has got­ten together to orga­nize an immense gift to IDA called Work Hard//Stay Hard.  This effort will make life a lit­tle eas­ier on the full-time res­i­dents, and insure the vital­ity of this place we love as home.


What We Need & What You Get

It will take $21,000 to pull off the work we have planned, including a massive and crucial project of re-roofing the front barn so that it can withstand more years of rocking all night long full of sweaty queers. We can coordinate up to 100 participants, so we're asking all participants to raise $200 each in order to fund this work as a gift to IDA. But IDA's community tends towards the very low-income, and many participants have tons of love and energy to give but are able not able to raise the money to travel to IDA, miss a week of work, and contribute to the cost of materials. We are holding benefit events in Philadelphia, NYC, the Bay Area, Pittsburgh, Denver, Providence, and beyond... and we still need your help. To raise this money, we need to meet or exceed this goal of $2,500 in donations from friends and allies that can't make it to the work gathering, or don't live in a city with a benefit party, but have some funds to kick down for strengthening and sustaining IDA. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word through your networks! Tell your friends how much IDA has meant to you and ask them to support this project. Every year, IDA has over 500 visitors -- we know that there is enough support to raise the funds we need, and more, if our community gives what they can. No gift is too small or too big! 


PS: Thanks to the folks at American reCycled for use of footage from their gorgeous video documentary. Check out the full length version here. Thanks also to Lex Young for editing the shorter version for fundraising purposes.

It will take $21,000 to pull off the work we have planned, including a massive and crucial project of re-roofing the front barn so that it can withstand more years of rocking all night long full of sweaty queers. We can coordinate up to 100 participants, so we're asking all participants to raise $200 each in order to fund this work as a gift to IDA. But IDA's community tends towards the very low-income, and many participants have tons of love and energy to give but are able not able to raise the money to travel to IDA, miss a week of work, and contribute to the cost of materials. We are holding benefit events in Philadelphia, NYC, the Bay Area, Pittsburgh, Denver, Providence, and beyond... and we still need your help. To raise this money, we need to meet or exceed this goal of $2,500 in donations from friends and allies that can't make it to the work gathering, or don't live in a city with a benefit party, but have some funds to kick down for strengthening and sustaining IDA. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word through your networks! Tell your friends how much IDA has meant to you and ask them to support this project. Every year, IDA has over 500 visitors -- we know that there is enough support to raise the funds we need, and more, if our community gives what they can. No gift is too small or too big! 

PS: Thanks to the folks at American reCycled for use of footage from their gorgeous video documentary. Check out the full length version here. Thanks also to Lex Young for editing the shorter version for fundraising purposes.

story:
Our Story

Dear Friends,


For those of you who don’t know, I am in Kenya for 5 months to try to help build a Children's Home (or at least help it get rolling) and I'd like to  tell you about it. A year ago, I took a month leave to visit the Belwop Children’s Home in Nyeri, Kenya. I stayed on-site with the kids and with the director, a widow and fellow believer named Veronica Mumbi, whom I am blessed to call friend.This trip ruined me, in the best way, and now I feel called to help make a difference here, and would invite you to join the cause.

Basically, the verse in James that states that TRUE Religion, the kind that that God accepts as pure and faultless-- HOLY-- is just this: To take care of widows and orphans in their distress... that's it. Then I met a widow who takes care of orphans, whose faith is unlike anything I've ever witnessed, and realized maybe this wasn't an accident? Here was  a opportunity for religion to be put into action, for me, and anyone who wants to join. A need for a real home.

Our "True Religion" efforts began 4 years ago, and today, we have partnerships starting all over the place to make this dream a reality. Together, through making coffee, and playing music, selling T-shirts and bracelets, word-of-mouth, Indiegogo, and dinners we have helped them come out of debt, purchase land, and now we want to move forward. No longer will these amazing kids have to sleep in a rented facility or worry about their next meal. Soon, they will have a place to sleep with colorful walls and comfortable beds and a kitchen full of food.

But we have a ways to go.....


SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN
 REMOVE FAVORITE

 


THE IMPACT

 SO far, through giving of funds from the last Indiegogo site, True Religion Concert series and other fundraisers, we have raised enough to:

1.) buy 1 square acre of Land!

2.) Buy an 8 passenger van!!!!

3.) sponsor the kids and send them to private school

4.) feed them

...and MORE explained in a letter from Veronica (the awesome Widow who runs the Belwop orphanage, my inspiration and friend):



Dear ones,

Because of you, the children can now enjoy an after-school snack, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Because of you, they can eat meat at least two days every week.

Because of you, they can eat fruits as frequently as possible.

Because of you, the children can have butter on their bread.

Because of you, the children can have sausage at least twice a week.

Because of you, they can have ice cream once in a while.

Because of you, the children are always clean and smart, for bathing and washing soaps and detergents are no longer a problem.

Because of you, the children can praise their God with much joy.


HOW TO HELP

 

We have found a home, and it may be "the One," and as we talk to the bank about a loan to purchase it, and churches and organizations to give, I have committed to using my time here at max capacity. This time, I am setting up this Indiegogo thing to raise support to start up the new "Shamba," or income FARM, to help cover costs of food at Belwop!!  As we wait, 2 things we know for certain:


1. We still own this land. 

2. We want to be good stewards, and USE IT in the meantime!


 While I am here, and with the help of Biointensive Growers from G-BIACK (a nearby agriculture school), we can set up a 1-5 acre farm that will provide healthy, mostly organically grown food and cash for the home. A representative will be visiting in two weeks to help us plan it out, and we are digging the trenches to set up the water.

I already bought my ticket, and have saved up enough to sustain myself, but some of you have expressed a desire to help me financially, and so all the money you give here goes directly to breaking ground on the new Belwop Farm site... By the time I return in December I would like to see the farm flourishing! (As we are now headed into spring and summer) and the Home is being purchased:


1.) Water line (dug and placed in the ground, connected to the well up the hill) ($1,200)

2.) Fence built ($1,500 for 5 acres)

3.) Treeline planted (Free by the Green Belt Movement!) ($0)

4.) Flourishing beds of corn, beans, cale, cabbage, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and more! ($1,000 for upkeep)

 5.) A full-time biointensively trained farmer, hired locally at $3/ day ($1,095/ year)


Once I leave, there are others coming after me to continue the building of Belwop 2.0. This will lead to the completion of the new home and Veronica's WISH LIST:

Full indoor kitchen

10 Bedrooms (10 kids, 5 bunkbeds per room= 100 kids!)

Washer and Dryer

4 bathrooms

Living room

Study

Staff

a slide!!/ playground

Two 15-passenger vans

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

1.) Prayer. As Veronica would say, "God will do it." Not us....We need all the voices to the Big Guy we can get! Shoot one up right now? :)

2.) Spread the Word. Tell the story, come to the next event!

3.) Project Belwop 2.0: Join a team to help build the new children's home or donate to the building fund (so far we have raised $25k of $137k needed!!) www.ExtremeResponse.Org

 4.) Child Sponsorship: Friends of Belwop, Inc. is pleased to announce that our organization has been approved as a 501(c)(3) non-profit charity by the IRS.  All contributions made are fully tax-deductible.  www.friendsofbelwop.org

 

Thank you once again for your generous support of me and this project! I look forward to seeing God do amazing things this year and getting this home built!!

Living room

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help
1.) Prayer. As Veronica would say, "God will do it." Not us....We need all the voices to the Big Guy we can get! Shoot one up right now? :)
2.) Spread the Word. Tell the story, come to the next event!
3.) Project Belwop 2.0: Join a team to help build the new children's home or donate to the building fund (so far we have raised $25k of $137k needed!!) www.ExtremeResponse.Org
 4.) Child Sponsorship: Friends of Belwop, Inc. is pleased to announce that our organization has been approved as a 501(c)(3) non-profit charity by the IRS.  All contributions made are fully tax-deductible.  www.friendsofbelwop.org

story:
Welcome, to the Indiegogo Campaign page of‘Rota Systems’. The budding premier Automated Employee Management System.

 

WHAT IS IT:

Rota Systems’ aim is to be the Premier Online Automated Employee Management System.

 

Rota Systems primary function is to allow employers and front-end businesses, to manage and publish their staffs timesheets / work schedules / holiday hours via a secure system on any top-end browser (Internet explorer / Mozilla Firefox / Safari / Chrome). Once uploaded, staff can access their schedule by logging in online, via our smartphone application or any web-enable device.

 

We are currently in full web-coding stages and business development, and hope to have it complete and ready to launch in 2013!

 

WHO WE ARE / HOW THIS ALL BEGAN: Our story began in 2012 when Mariusz and I first met at as colleagues in alternate departments at our respective present employers. Myself (Jarrel) and several of my department colleagues were experiencing a mismanagement of our work schedules.

The main problems were:

  • The work schedule would be published at the last minute on the staff board

  • Staff having to phone-in to find out if the schedule had been published

  • Not knowing if you’d been granted holidays requested days/weeks/months before

  • Missing out on extra available shifts

  • Not being able to manage your work/social/personal life

  • Swapping shifts by email and paper swap forms

ALL STAFF WHO WERE EXPERIENCING THIS, WERE UNHAPPY.

I (Jarrel) began doing some research, specifically on what tools companies/employers were using to schedule their operational staff. I and many of my colleagues at the time, were experiencing a crisis of management, which was directly affecting our relationship with our superiors.


It was at this point I met Mariusz, a floor manager working for a well known restaurant/bar company. He had been scheduling 50 to 60 staff members for a year or so, using a simple PHP website he had written. He had coded and tailored the website for the business’s specific needs, and taught all his fellow managers, how to write and publish the Rota / Roster/ Work-Schedule.


Staff loved it and continue to use it to this day!

 

WHAT?

We are asking for a donation at your affordability,

  • To help us complete the front-end build (Web design + User experience)

  • Ensure our first year’s survival

  • Secure an office space to conduct as a business

 

What will this product do for you?

For businesses and industries:

1. Managing the staff rota simplified through an automated system, totalling staff hours and labour costs in easy steps.

2. A true picture of staff work habits, through export features detailing frequency of requests, shift swaps and platforms employees are using.

3. Resting assured that the calendar can be complete, by superivors depending on privilage level, and being able to request staff at other sites within a larger organisation.

4. Integration into current platforms already served in the business, such as email and other HR Management platforms.   

Employees:

1. Access to your rota instantly on a smart device.

2. Direct communication with other colleagues on trading shifts, as opposed to text,=.

3. Alerts of your Calendar plan, extra shifts, Holiday hours and completing time sheets all within the system.

 

 We know the product is needed, and has the potential to sooth the agony of not knowing how you;’ll manage or be manage staff.

Help us complete the build of Rota Systems and get this platform release to you.


Thanks for Clicking on our Campaign. 

Any questions?

Email us: info@rota-system.com

story:
Hello, I’m Brandon Wiggins, the founder of Crazy Canuck Brewing where I brew "Distinctive Beers for Off Beat Canadians". I fell in love with beer 9 years ago when I brewed my first batch and haven’t looked back since. 

I’ve gone through the steps of getting a business degree, a certificate in brewing, practical hands on brewing experience at a local brew pub and formulating my own recipes at home. I’ve already incorporated the brewery and secured the brewery name. Now all I need is some start up capital to get me brewing.

By donating to this brewery you will help give the people of the Fraser Valley more choice in the beers that they drink. You will also help me succeed in a life long dream of owning a brewery and giving back to the community.

The money that you donate will be used to help buy a 10 barrel brewing system ($55,000) so we can produce about 3000 6pks a week, bottling line ($15,000) to get the product to you, and start up materials ($20,000) ie. malts, hops, cartons, etc. It will also help with the licensing aspects and renting a brewing space. After which you can come into our tasting room and try our delicious beers.

For your generous donations you’ll receive all sorts of stuff. The full list can be seen on the right side of your screen but they go from a simple thank you post card, to pre buying a case of beer, to being invited to a special launch party, to being one of an exclusive group of only 20 people to sample new beers before any are made available to the public, to being able to design your own beer.

Without your help I can’t make this brewery happen and I know that you love craft beer, so please help me out by making a donation and/or tell your friends and family about this project. You and they can be a part of the history of Crazy Canuck Brewing. Come with me on this journey, it will be fun. 

Thank you

 

P.S. If there is a reward that you would like but don't see listed contact us at crazycanuckbrewing@gmail.com and we'll see what we can work out.

story:
ABOUT US

"Celebrating the everyday, and celebrating every day." 

MAKE + MERRY is a creative studio and lifestyle brand based in Singapore dreamed up by two women and good friends, Malvina Tan and Valerie Sim. Malvina is a performance and mixed media artist, and a marketing manager by profession. Valerie is a creative producer by trade with a substantial portfolio. MAKE + MERRY is inspired by our love for food and passion for art. We create unique dining experiences that celebrate local collaboration. A collaboration between a chef and an artist, designer, or a maker, every dining experience is a specially curated ticketed event or an experience delivered to your door. And, we also pledge to always give back a portion of our profits to a special cause close to our hearts! Stay tuned for updates via this campaign and our socials.

 

OUR DREAM

MAKE + MERRY is a mission to celebrate women entrepreneurs, support the hospitality industry and creative makers. Especially in this unprecedented season of a global pandemic, MAKE + MERRY wants to be a business that champions niche industries and local brands that have been hit hard. MAKE + MERRY is a startup fresh out of the oven and we need your support and all the help we can get. We are calling out for the dreamers, the believers, the #bossbabes, the movers, the shakers, the ones who believe in this little dream of ours as much as we do. We want and need you to be part of our journey in transforming MAKE + MERRY into a reality.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We need to raise SGD $10,000 to run and kickstart this business. Any amount contributed to this campaign will go a very long way in helping us launch our brand and our pilot project - MAKE + MERRY MAGIC kit 1.0. The pilot edition of MAKE + MERRY MAGIC kit is created in collaboration with two makers - Singaporean chef Dylan Ong of The Masses and Singaporean artist Soh Ee Shaun. The kit includes a functional art piece made of 80% sustainable materials that you can use in the kitchen or when you dine, and delicious artisanal food produce. Should this campaign exceed our goal of SGD $10,000, we pledge to donate the additional amount to our makers' choice of charity.

 

WHAT YOU CAN GET

Depending on your contribution, our perks include:

  • Exclusive early bird discount up to 35% off RRP on our products 
  • The MAKE + MERRY MAGIC kit protoype (includes exclusive The Masses' Butter & Jam produce and Fabric Wrap designed by artist Soh Ee Shaun, applicable for local Singapore orders only) 
  • For this campaign only, we release not one but two Fabric Wrap designs in extremely limited quantities for our funders. Choose your print, or get both!
  • Complimentary local shipping, yay!
  • Flat shipping fee of SGD $10 for international orders on our Fabric Wraps (estimated shipping late October - Mid November 2020, dependent on each country's COVID-19 pandemic measures and border restrictions)

 

WHY MAKE + MERRY, WHY SUPPORT US

MAKE + MERRY believes in collaborative success, you directly support local brands, creative businesses, the hospitality industry and the maker communities. MAKE + MERRY wants to create partnerships and to build on collective strength - this is the future of business.

 

RISK & CHALLENGES

We understand that many of us are struggling due to COVID-19, and MAKE + MERRY is a leap of faith for us! Starting a brand new business is never easy; especially in the midst of a global pandemic. We are two women trying to start a business while living in two different countries - Singapore and Australia, and it has taken longer than expected because of restrictions due to COVID-19. Some forecasted challenges include limited resources, travel restrictions, border restrictions for shipment, COVID-19 dining restrictions and production delays due to closure of businesses. Thanks to technology and strategic planning, we have worked hard to still make MAKE + MERRY a possibility and it is definitely underway. We are natural problem solvers and always prepared to think on our feet. We fret not, we dream big, work hard and take action. Giving this campaign a go is already a small win for us!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US

If you cannot contribute right now, that's okay and we completely understand. Sharing this campaign far and wide will help us a lot! Share this campaign on your socials or with anyone you think would want to be part of this merrymaking situation. Show us some love by liking @makemerrystudio on Instagram and Facebook while you’re at it too! 

For any other form of contribution, please contact us directly.

You may also wish to assist us by offering your complimentary services for a day (applicable for local hire only). We are seeking help from part time administrators, packers to freelance illustrators! Some incentives can be provided, write to us at hello@makemerrystudio.com for more information.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP US
If you cannot contribute right now, that's okay and we completely understand. Sharing this campaign far and wide will help us a lot! Share this campaign on your socials or with anyone you think would want to be part of this merrymaking situation. Show us some love by liking @makemerrystudio on Instagram and Facebook while you’re at it too! 
For any other form of contribution, please contact us directly.
You may also wish to assist us by offering your complimentary services for a day (applicable for local hire only). We are seeking help from part time administrators, packers to freelance illustrators! Some incentives can be provided, write to us at hello@makemerrystudio.com for more information.

story:
Short Summary

As many of you know, The S'Cream Truck has managed to make quite an entrance in our 9 short months of business.

Started in early 2012 by two single moms who unexpectedly had to make mid-life changes, we worked hard and opened the truck on our own (with the financial help of friends and family) and within these short months have catered some of the top TV shows, celebrity private parties, food truck events, and gained a lot of press (Zagat's Food Truck of the Week, Eater LA, Curbed LA and the cover of Frontiers Magazine).

It is now time to move into merchandising. People love our branding and our tagline, "We Have Balls" so much, that we reached into our own small pockets and did a run of 100 women's tees. We have sold out and have a demand for more.

Now we are trying to raise the money to do a larger order, raise our online presence with some marketing help (our new website launches in the next week or two) and be able to fill and ship orders as needed.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $6,000 to hire a pr/marketing firm short term to increase our online presence so we can move our merchandising in a big way, not just locally. Our branding has been visible and making a name for itself, including our line "We Have Balls", which refers to our trademarked product, The S'Cream Ball.

You get to enjoy the perks listed below, but also be in on the beginning of what we think will be a knowable and desired brand on the market.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but it sure would help for you to spread the word! Share our link, tell others how cool our shirts are and how awesome our ice cream and truck is. And how fantastic it would be to help two single moms make their dreams come true! (i.e., college for their kids :) )

It's easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
End to End 2012

The Journey

On the 10th July we begin our attempt to cycle from Lands End (the southwest corner of England) to John o’ Groats (the northeast corner of Scotland) - the end to end. According to Google maps, this is an 838 mile journey, but we didn’t think that was enough; our route will be approximately one thousand miles, which will be covered over 10 days.  While we're cycling, we're hoping you'll partner with us.  We're looking for people to sponsor us by raising funds for some very worthwhile causes.

The Causes

So, we would love for you to help us by helping others through donating to charities below. We have hand-picked these charities as each one means something to us, as their work has affected and continues to affect our lives. 

  1. MS Society – Multiple Sclerosis is a chronic, typically progressive disease involving damage to the sheaths of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord. This charity funds research, gives grants, campaigns for change, provides information and support, invests in MS specialists and lends a listening ear to anyone affected by MS. - http://www.mssociety.org.uk/ 
  2. FOP Action/ University of Oxford - FOP is a rare and distressing medical condition where bone forms in muscles and other soft tissues, considerably restricting movement. It is a progressive disease and there is no cure. £120,000 needs to be raised to ensure research continues at the University of Oxford to find a cure. -http://www.fopaction.co.uk/
  3. Meserani Snake Park - The Snake Park supports the local community in Meserani, Tanzania in many ways: providing a free medical clinic and an orphanage, building new classrooms at a local school and overseeing the running of an adult education centre to name a few. - http://www.meseranisnakepark.com/

Some Details

  1. Note: attendance is not required. This event is just to raise money for some very worthwhile causes! 
  2. It is important to emphasise that this is not one of those ‘pay for our holiday’ trips. We are paying for the cycling trip. EVERY PENNY YOU DONATE GOES STRAIGHT TO THE CHARITIES.
  3. Since all of these charities are based outside of the US, you can make your donations in US dollars through this IndieGoGo website and thereafter I'll take care of the hassle of converting the money and making sure it gets to the right place.
  4. You can follow us along here, on Virgin Money (www.virginmoneygiving.com/team/e2e), on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/events/404782816232374/), or on Twitter (https://twitter.com/E2Ecycle)

Thank you,

Ben, Jason, Jon, Jonny, Kwab and Owen

story:
Our Story

We Were Started in 1956 , By Margret Dillihay on then a one lane dirt road ( Minnesota Hwy 1 ) that lead to Ely,MN and to the Road less area we now call The Boundary Waters Wilderness Area,@ one time Hwy 1 was the only road to Ely, Now only one of a few ! Now with the reduced Traffic .And the Resulting loss of sales We can barely cover the Electric needed to keep the Minnow's Alive! So We Need To Switch Our Power To Solar !!


The Impact

Now it May Not Seem Like much that another
Small Bait & Tackle shop May fold but it is almost 70 miles to the nearest Wal-Mart ,Gander Mountain.

In order to remain in Business we are going to have to switch our power over to solar, wind , WE Need to Switch our well and lighting over to DC,To run Solar, the total cost for the change ( if prices remain the same until implantation ) is presently $7,249.00   , We Do sell , Bait & L.P. during the winter but the sales are so slow ,,most times in the winter , the sales do not cover expenses and in the Summer we play catch up,so we never really get ahead enough to Switch over 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help!

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hello, my name is Curtis Hopkins an Entrepreneur, Father and Inventor of the "

STAIR SLIDE

". My wife Shaundell and I have three kids. Our youngest son cannot play outside in extreme heat or cold because of a blood disorder that weakens his immune system.

            


 Even in the Hospital..............He still has his joy.

                   


But if you ever had an energetic two year old STUCK in the house you know how that can be. So, with the only option being to play inside, there were many slides down our stairs that resulted in lots of burns and bruises to our backsides. Lets face it, kids have been playing on stairs probably since they were invented.

My wife said to me "There has to be a way to let our children play on the stairs that was fun and without the bumps to our rumps. " Of course there wasn't. So we started designing our idea almost immediately. Our brain storm resulted in the "STAIR SLIDE"


                       HOW DOES IT WORK??

The "STAIR SLIDE" is an inflatable slide that fits the shape of a typical flight of staris with a soft landing at the bottom. Not only do they have a lot of fun but the climb to the top of the slide is great exercise. It's ready to go as fast as:







               





   




VIDEOS

story:
Hint

Never again wonder what might have been...

Hintlife.com



Check Out Hint (Beta) For iPhone!

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/hint/id757474894?mt=8


How It Started

Toward the end of my senior year in college, I met an amazing girl with whom I am still in a relationship.  The interesting (and somewhat disappointing) part is that we now both realize that there was a mutual attraction well before either of us actually did anything about it!  Both of us were too scared of getting denied by the other.  If only we could have sent each other some kind of "hint" (pun intended)...That's when I realized there must be an easier way (other than copious amounts Jack Daniels) to find out if someone you see is also attracted to you, anywhere at anytime in our daily lives. What if you missed out on the girl or guy of your dreams?


Product Description

Never again will you leave the coffee shop, gym, bar, laundromat, beach, train, 3rd period history class, or anywhere wondering what might have been and kicking yourself for not mustering up enough courage to approach the potential man or woman of your dreams. Hint allows you to know for sure that the cute girl or guy across the room also finds you attractive, making the approach a lot easier and giving you the confidence to do so!  No profile stalking, no strange messages, just a fun and flirty way to break the ice with those around you.


How It Works



1. Check-in to any place or venue

2. Take a selfie & describe something you're wearing

3.  See someone you're diggin'


4.  Find him or her on Hint 

5.  Make a mutual connection by sending a "Flirt" or anonymous "Hint"

6.  Approach him or her with confidence!


Hint at the bar


Hint at school



How It's Different

Hint is not a "mobile dating" application. It does not reinvent the process of two people meeting by chance. Instead, Hint simply gives people at the same location a little help getting the ball rolling.  Hint does not alter fate; rather it gives people the ability to control their own. 

Unlike other popular "dating apps", Hint does not involve "creeping" photos of girls or guys.  Existing apps start with browsing photos (stalking) until a connection is made and then a real-life meeting is up to the two users.  Hint, on the other hand, begins with physically seeing a guy or girl and then using the app to make a connection.  Instead of arranging a meeting with a stranger whom you have only seen pictures of, you meet right then and there. 


CTO Faisal Rahman Fields Questions



Funding Goal

$50,000

Give everyone the opportunity to use Hint-  We are seeking a minimum of $50K to develop Hint for Android devices. The larger the user base, the better the Hint user experience will be. Therefore, Android development is our top priority and crucial to the growth and success of Hint.


Funding Stretch Goal

$100,000

Tell everyone about Hint-  Developing Hint for Android is only the first step toward reaching our goal.  If we  raise $100K  we will be able to develop Hint across all platforms and market Hint on a much broader scale.  We will be able to host Hint events at colleges and social venues as well as attend conferences, trade shows, and explore many other marketing opportunities.  


The Hint Team


From Me To You

Indiegogo Community, Friends, Family,

It has been my dream for the last two years to make Hint a reality.  Faisal and I have spent countless hours on the development of Hint for iPhone.  It is amazing to think that two years ago I sat down with some paper and a pen and sketched out my vision of Hint, at which time I didn't even own a smartphone.  It is extremely rewarding to wake up every day and work on something I am passionate about and truly believe in.  We have overcome so many obstacles to get this far, and have now reached the next major challenge- raising money. 

By donating to our project you are not only helping us, you are helping all the single men and women out there who wish to never again leave anywhere in life wondering what might have been...

Thank you for taking the time to view our project and thank you so much for your support!

Sincerely,

Pat McAuley

Co-founder, CEO
