story:
PLEASE NOTE: I AM CURRENTLY WALKING 1200 MILES/2000KM FROM ENGLAND TO THE VATICAN IN ROME TO SHOW HOW MUCH I CARE ABOUT THIS PROJECT SO PLEASE BARE THAT IN MIND WHEN SCANNING THROUGH!

*Other videos are to follow over the coming week, but time and internet restrictions are hindering the process.*

(Please feel free to suggest perks.)


'Short' Summary:

In essence, I feel the main reason behind many of the problems in today's society is the crumbling community structure. We are Human Beings, we thrive in communities and we are happiest when we are spending time together, sharing experiences and helping each other to have better lives.

Unfortunately, we have no real infrastructure in place to allow anyone to be able to help anyone else easily. Anyone who wants to help others has to go through the old fashioned 'volunteering' processes, which while still achieving a lot, don't even come close to reaching the potential we have as a society to help and support each other, and has a ridiculous amount of limitations.


The most valuable thing we have is our time, and then some of us, especially the professionals, have specific skills and attributes too. Volunteering is a very tricky business most of the time, and it only works if your local council are particularly proactive, or of there is a specific company running projects in your community that you can get involved in. Well, what if there was a site where the infrastructure was in place to allow anyone to form their own projects and essentially 'crowd fund' for local people's time and resources?



Imagine your local community centre is closed because there is 'no money' from the local council to keep it open. Perhaps it has fallen in to disrepair and needs some electrical work and carpentry and cleaning out and painting. Then there needs to be extra equipment in place such as computers and seating and refreshments. Why do we need to wait for the politicians or the rich to decide that it's worth the money to get it done?

What if you, yes you, the very person reading this now, could log on to a site and 'start a project.' You state that it is for the local community centre. Then the local tradesmen donate a few hours each doing the skilled labour, the local bigger businesses donate a computer each and someone provides the wood to build a small kitchen etc. Then, the local residents all donate a few hours each to clean it all out and paint it. 



The local tradesmen and businesses get invaluable 'word of mouth' advertising and would be allowed to display their logos on the building. The local residents get the awesome feelings of pride and achievement that they took the power in to their own hands and fixed the centre themselves, as well as the invaluable bonding that only comes through shared experiences. Your best friends are not the ones you have known the longest, but the ones you have shared the most with...

Also, the local council get a weight lifted off their shoulders and it saves them money and will no doubt raise morale in the local neighbourhood as well as reduce crime, and everyone is a winner.


Think 'Extreme Make Over Home Edition,' or the UK's 'DIY SOS.' If they can demolish and rebuild a much bigger house in 5 days with the whole community helping them, imagine what we could do as a society if every single person had the power to suggest lots of smaller projects?


The old lady down the street is too old to fix up her garden - a quick project by a neighbour, a few others all donate 2/3 hours each one weekend, the garden gets fixed up and the old lady is happy and everyone feels a lot closer and happier.


There's a single parent who is always helping others even though they are snowed under with their own work and looking after their child/children. A quick project and local neighbours throw him or her a party for a few hours and perhaps the local hair dresser spares half an hour to do his or her hair for free!? Imagine how much happier EVERYONE would feel afterwards?


There are literally an untold number of ideas and projects people could think of that only require small efforts by groups of local people. I am so excited to see what kind of things people come up with but for now, I hope you get the idea.


Basically, as social animals we rely firstly on our family and friends, and then secondly on our communities. Unfortunately, the majority of us don't have a good support network through our families and friends, and so we should be able to rely on our communities, but we can't, on the most part. I want to change that. I want to provide an infrastructure that allows those who are willing to donate their time to others, and those who need it, as well as providing a far more effective infrastructure for businesses to connect directly with their local customers.



So, why me? Yes it's a good idea, in fact I think it's the best idea I have ever had because it is a combination of the best of them from the last ten years, but why help me do it? Who am I and why would you think I am capable of building such an awesome infrastructure? Well, I guess the only way I can think of to prove how much I care is to walk 1200 miles! If I had have succeeded doing it barefoot, it would have been a world record too...


Therefore I am walking 1200 miles by foot, the first 250. (ish.) of which I managed to do barefoot, in the name of St. Francis of Assisi, who impoverished himself to be closer to nature and the true meaning of life, as well as really pushing for people to come together and not be so divided. I started from St. Pol de Leon on Frances' northern coast, and am heading to the Vatican in Rome.

(*Update/edit - the barefoot element proved far too painful with untrained feet, and the danger involved, the restrictions and more importantly, the sheer length of time it was taking, all meant that after about 400km, I was defeated and had to buy shoes! At the time of launch of this project, thanks to the shoes, I am back on track to complete by Christmas day...*)


I would like to hopefully meet the Pope and ask for his blessing just as St. Francis did. If the spiritual leader of 2 billion people thinks it's a good idea, I guess that's a pretty big thumbs up! I also have a very important question I'd like to ask him, but more about that later...


I will continue to film it as I go if the demand rises, so I will be able to hopefully show everyone who I really am and how much I really care for 'the people' throughout my journey. If all goes according to plan, by the time I complete the journey and meet the Pope, everyone who has been following me will know that I will totally make this infrastructure site a reality. I will give everything I have to making it easier for communities to help each and help and themselves. It is now my life's ambition and my sole purpose for the last 3 months onwards. I will help the people. I will help us.


The least I need:

It has been very difficult trying to figure out how much I will need to make this happen. I know that to build such a site will need full time coders/designers, which means an office and computers and equipment. It will be a business and will need to be able to grow quickly to stand any chance of working so there needs to be some money there for flexibility. I have studied business and have no worries about how to handle it, I've just never taken on such a big project before so am trying to be conservative in my estimations.


I am guessing at least 2 coders and 2 designers and therefore 4 computers, all the extra equipment that goes with that, and a big enough office. Then all the usual business costs that go in to making something like this work.

There is also obviously the cost of the trip which was budgeted as a 'marketing' cost as opposed to just throwing the money at the video and paying some company to over rate the project. That figure stands at 10% and I have personally stumped up the money myself out of my back up funds for my film making career, so it is reasonable to hope that I fund enough to at least cover the cost, or I will not only have given up 120 days of my life and untold efforts through pain and suffering, but I will also have lost £3000+... However, that being said, the amount I take back will totally depend on how much is raised. If I reach any amount that can cover having at least a basic version built that I can build on, then I will just take the hit. If it is more like the full amount, then I will recover my costs. If however I raise less than £3000, then again, I will recover my costs. As in all investments of this kind, I can't make those decisions until the end but needless to say, if I am investing 120 days, everything I have in the way of physical, emotional and psychological strength, and £3000+ of my back up career funds, then £3-5 from anyone else is not really something to worry about is it!?

Now, please be aware that I am fully aware of how conservative that sounds, to the point of almost sounding naive from a business point of view, but that is for a reason. If I was to go call out all the things that I would possibly need to really make this a success, I would end up with a list longer than everything I have written so far, and a budget of several hundred thousand, but that would be ridiculous.

As a result, what I have done is aim as low as possible so that the only real difference between what I have accounted for and a successful end product, is the hard work in between. The reason being is that I know how capable I am of that hard work. That being said, everyone would choose the best case scenario if asked, and I was to do so, the list and target amount would both increase quite a bit and that is why I really, really hope the project overfunds!

It will probably take, at the absolute least, 3 months to get a beta version ready with only 4 people. That's 5 sets of wages and costs, 2 or three times before the site could even think of going live. Due to the fact that the professionals and local businesses will get all the cheap advertising from it, they will be charged small amounts for having profiles which is how the site will sustain it's self once it's launched.

So, I had to add all that up and come up with a figure. Now obviously, the higher the figure, the far better chance the site has of starting successfully and quickly, but given that the whole point of the site is to provide an infrastructure where people can help each other by donating time, I feel bad enough having to ask for money to get it started as it is, let alone ask for loads.

Therefore, all things taken in to account, I am going with the amount of £30,000. I have chosen the 'take whatever is raised' option because even if it is only £10,000 raised, it's only a website so I'll just have to try to do it with one or two people, which will take a lot, lot longer and will be a lot, lot harder to achieve, but will still be possible, I hope! Basically, the amount of money raised is going to directly effect how quickly, and how well the site can be built and launched and start helping people help each other.

It's a very awkward feeling when you decide to give up 120 days of your life and walk 1200 miles, even trying it barefoot, to prove how much you want to help people, but then you have to actually ask for money to build the site so all I can say is sorry for having to ask and please forgive me if you think what I am asking for is too much! :/


Karma points.
In an attempt to reward people as we go, the site will have 'karma points' which will be displayed in the social media format profiles of each member. People you work with on projects will be able to award you karma points based on how hard working, kind, helpful you were etc. The more you help the community, the more they will reward you with karma points.

Local businesses will then be encouraged to trade karma points with people for small bonuses like 20% off your next shop, or a free cocktail when you go to the bar etc. We, as a site, will also hope to reward those with much bigger amounts of karma points, with much bigger rewards, but obviously it's not a good idea to start saying what they might be right now!

So, even if you want to just be part of a new social media site that allows you to help others and just become a karma farmer for you own personal gain, I don't care, because then everyone's a winner!

Other Ways You Can Help.

I have been thinking long and hard about how best to help 'market' the project, and in the end I came up with the idea of having a Facebook page, but then setting up an 120 day long 'event.' That way I can make it totally open to the public and invite as many people as possible. Anyone will be able to invite anyone to the 'event.'

This way, I will be able to keep constant updates posted to the event and everyone will get notified about them. I will also run a Twitter profile and Instagram for all the awesome pictures I am going to be able to take. I think, all things considered, this is probably the best chance I have of keeping everyone involved from day one. This is a project for the community as a whole, world wide, and so I would love for people to be fully involved from day one, and this is the best way I could think of!

For now I think this should be the end of the massive essay that is my 'project outline' homepage. Thanks for reading if you're still here!
story_txt:
PLEASE NOTE: I AM CURRENTLY WALKING 1200 MILES/2000KM FROM ENGLAND TO THE VATICAN IN ROME TO SHOW HOW MUCH I CARE ABOUT THIS PROJECT SO PLEASE BARE THAT IN MIND WHEN SCANNING THROUGH! *Other videos are to follow over the coming week, but time and internet restrictions are hindering the process.*(Please feel free to suggest perks.)'Short' Summary:In essence, I feel the main reason behind many of the problems in today's society is the crumbling community structure. We are Human Beings, we thrive in communities and we are happiest when we are spending time together, sharing experiences and helping each other to have better lives. Unfortunately, we have no real infrastructure in place to allow anyone to be able to help anyone else easily. Anyone who wants to help others has to go through the old fashioned 'volunteering' processes, which while still achieving a lot, don't even come close to reaching the potential we have as a society to help and support each other, and has a ridiculous amount of limitations.The most valuable thing we have is our time, and then some of us, especially the professionals, have specific skills and attributes too. Volunteering is a very tricky business most of the time, and it only works if your local council are particularly proactive, or of there is a specific company running projects in your community that you can get involved in. Well, what if there was a site where the infrastructure was in place to allow anyone to form their own projects and essentially 'crowd fund' for local people's time and resources?Imagine your local community centre is closed because there is 'no money' from the local council to keep it open. Perhaps it has fallen in to disrepair and needs some electrical work and carpentry and cleaning out and painting. Then there needs to be extra equipment in place such as computers and seating and refreshments. Why do we need to wait for the politicians or the rich to decide that it's worth the money to get it done?What if you, yes you, the very person reading this now, could log on to a site and 'start a project.' You state that it is for the local community centre. Then the local tradesmen donate a few hours each doing the skilled labour, the local bigger businesses donate a computer each and someone provides the wood to build a small kitchen etc. Then, the local residents all donate a few hours each to clean it all out and paint it. The local tradesmen and businesses get invaluable 'word of mouth' advertising and would be allowed to display their logos on the building. The local residents get the awesome feelings of pride and achievement that they took the power in to their own hands and fixed the centre themselves, as well as the invaluable bonding that only comes through shared experiences. Your best friends are not the ones you have known the longest, but the ones you have shared the most with... Also, the local council get a weight lifted off their shoulders and it saves them money and will no doubt raise morale in the local neighbourhood as well as reduce crime, and everyone is a winner.Think 'Extreme Make Over Home Edition,' or the UK's 'DIY SOS.' If they can demolish and rebuild a much bigger house in 5 days with the whole community helping them, imagine what we could do as a society if every single person had the power to suggest lots of smaller projects?The old lady down the street is too old to fix up her garden - a quick project by a neighbour, a few others all donate 2/3 hours each one weekend, the garden gets fixed up and the old lady is happy and everyone feels a lot closer and happier.There's a single parent who is always helping others even though they are snowed under with their own work and looking after their child/children. A quick project and local neighbours throw him or her a party for a few hours and perhaps the local hair dresser spares half an hour to do his or her hair for free!? Imagine how much happier EVERYONE would feel afterwards?There are literally an untold number of ideas and projects people could think of that only require small efforts by groups of local people. I am so excited to see what kind of things people come up with but for now, I hope you get the idea.Basically, as social animals we rely firstly on our family and friends, and then secondly on our communities. Unfortunately, the majority of us don't have a good support network through our families and friends, and so we should be able to rely on our communities, but we can't, on the most part. I want to change that. I want to provide an infrastructure that allows those who are willing to donate their time to others, and those who need it, as well as providing a far more effective infrastructure for businesses to connect directly with their local customers.So, why me? Yes it's a good idea, in fact I think it's the best idea I have ever had because it is a combination of the best of them from the last ten years, but why help me do it? Who am I and why would you think I am capable of building such an awesome infrastructure? Well, I guess the only way I can think of to prove how much I care is to walk 1200 miles! If I had have succeeded doing it barefoot, it would have been a world record too...Therefore I am walking 1200 miles by foot, the first 250. (ish.) of which I managed to do barefoot, in the name of St. Francis of Assisi, who impoverished himself to be closer to nature and the true meaning of life, as well as really pushing for people to come together and not be so divided. I started from St. Pol de Leon on Frances' northern coast, and am heading to the Vatican in Rome. (*Update/edit - the barefoot element proved far too painful with untrained feet, and the danger involved, the restrictions and more importantly, the sheer length of time it was taking, all meant that after about 400km, I was defeated and had to buy shoes! At the time of launch of this project, thanks to the shoes, I am back on track to complete by Christmas day...*)I would like to hopefully meet the Pope and ask for his blessing just as St. Francis did. If the spiritual leader of 2 billion people thinks it's a good idea, I guess that's a pretty big thumbs up! I also have a very important question I'd like to ask him, but more about that later...I will continue to film it as I go if the demand rises, so I will be able to hopefully show everyone who I really am and how much I really care for 'the people' throughout my journey. If all goes according to plan, by the time I complete the journey and meet the Pope, everyone who has been following me will know that I will totally make this infrastructure site a reality. I will give everything I have to making it easier for communities to help each and help and themselves. It is now my life's ambition and my sole purpose for the last 3 months onwards. I will help the people. I will help us.The least I need:
It has been very difficult trying to figure out how much I will need to make this happen. I know that to build such a site will need full time coders/designers, which means an office and computers and equipment. It will be a business and will need to be able to grow quickly to stand any chance of working so there needs to be some money there for flexibility. I have studied business and have no worries about how to handle it, I've just never taken on such a big project before so am trying to be conservative in my estimations.I am guessing at least 2 coders and 2 designers and therefore 4 computers, all the extra equipment that goes with that, and a big enough office. Then all the usual business costs that go in to making something like this work. There is also obviously the cost of the trip which was budgeted as a 'marketing' cost as opposed to just throwing the money at the video and paying some company to over rate the project. That figure stands at 10% and I have personally stumped up the money myself out of my back up funds for my film making career, so it is reasonable to hope that I fund enough to at least cover the cost, or I will not only have given up 120 days of my life and untold efforts through pain and suffering, but I will also have lost £3000+... However, that being said, the amount I take back will totally depend on how much is raised. If I reach any amount that can cover having at least a basic version built that I can build on, then I will just take the hit. If it is more like the full amount, then I will recover my costs. If however I raise less than £3000, then again, I will recover my costs. As in all investments of this kind, I can't make those decisions until the end but needless to say, if I am investing 120 days, everything I have in the way of physical, emotional and psychological strength, and £3000+ of my back up career funds, then £3-5 from anyone else is not really something to worry about is it!?Now, please be aware that I am fully aware of how conservative that sounds, to the point of almost sounding naive from a business point of view, but that is for a reason. If I was to go call out all the things that I would possibly need to really make this a success, I would end up with a list longer than everything I have written so far, and a budget of several hundred thousand, but that would be ridiculous. As a result, what I have done is aim as low as possible so that the only real difference between what I have accounted for and a successful end product, is the hard work in between. The reason being is that I know how capable I am of that hard work. That being said, everyone would choose the best case scenario if asked, and I was to do so, the list and target amount would both increase quite a bit and that is why I really, really hope the project overfunds!It will probably take, at the absolute least, 3 months to get a beta version ready with only 4 people. That's 5 sets of wages and costs, 2 or three times before the site could even think of going live. Due to the fact that the professionals and local businesses will get all the cheap advertising from it, they will be charged small amounts for having profiles which is how the site will sustain it's self once it's launched.So, I had to add all that up and come up with a figure. Now obviously, the higher the figure, the far better chance the site has of starting successfully and quickly, but given that the whole point of the site is to provide an infrastructure where people can help each other by donating time, I feel bad enough having to ask for money to get it started as it is, let alone ask for loads.Therefore, all things taken in to account, I am going with the amount of £30,000. I have chosen the 'take whatever is raised' option because even if it is only £10,000 raised, it's only a website so I'll just have to try to do it with one or two people, which will take a lot, lot longer and will be a lot, lot harder to achieve, but will still be possible, I hope! Basically, the amount of money raised is going to directly effect how quickly, and how well the site can be built and launched and start helping people help each other. It's a very awkward feeling when you decide to give up 120 days of your life and walk 1200 miles, even trying it barefoot, to prove how much you want to help people, but then you have to actually ask for money to build the site so all I can say is sorry for having to ask and please forgive me if you think what I am asking for is too much! :/Karma points.In an attempt to reward people as we go, the site will have 'karma points' which will be displayed in the social media format profiles of each member. People you work with on projects will be able to award you karma points based on how hard working, kind, helpful you were etc. The more you help the community, the more they will reward you with karma points. Local businesses will then be encouraged to trade karma points with people for small bonuses like 20% off your next shop, or a free cocktail when you go to the bar etc. We, as a site, will also hope to reward those with much bigger amounts of karma points, with much bigger rewards, but obviously it's not a good idea to start saying what they might be right now!So, even if you want to just be part of a new social media site that allows you to help others and just become a karma farmer for you own personal gain, I don't care, because then everyone's a winner!Other Ways You Can Help.I have been thinking long and hard about how best to help 'market' the project, and in the end I came up with the idea of having a Facebook page, but then setting up an 120 day long 'event.' That way I can make it totally open to the public and invite as many people as possible. Anyone will be able to invite anyone to the 'event.' This way, I will be able to keep constant updates posted to the event and everyone will get notified about them. I will also run a Twitter profile and Instagram for all the awesome pictures I am going to be able to take. I think, all things considered, this is probably the best chance I have of keeping everyone involved from day one. This is a project for the community as a whole, world wide, and so I would love for people to be fully involved from day one, and this is the best way I could think of!For now I think this should be the end of the massive essay that is my 'project outline' homepage. Thanks for reading if you're still here!

story:
My name is Wendy and I am here to campaign for my oldest sister Barbara Clements. She has recently lost her vision due to Diabetes. My sister has spent a good deal of her life building this business, to help educate the world and those in it. Much of her life has been devoted to teaching and training individuals and companies in Trade Compliance. She has always been a giver and never a taker. She is passionate about what she does and her business is her life. Please keep her from being another statistic.

Her diabetes has taken its toll on her and she has lost her sight. She has had to overcome and adapt to so many things in her life. She has struggled through it all. Some people may believe that Barbara's blindness has greatly inhibited her extraordinary professionalism, vast knowledge, skills and abilities to teach our small-to-medium businesses in Trade Compliance.  They are wrong.  Barbara's brain still works at the same rapid pace.  Barbara has never given up on anything in her life. She is fighting to keep her business going until she has fully adapted to this disability. She will overcome. Her global reputation in Trade Compliance is second-to-none.  Her website is: www.barbclementsassociates.com

In order for her to catch up and keep her business from failing she needs at least $70K.  This will help to cover Barbara’s expenses since her vision began to fail and through many surgeries in the past several months.  It will help with her business overheads so she can continue to run her business of helping small-to-medium businesses in the complex arena of Trade Compliance while learning how to use Braille and work with a Guide Dog.

I and many others have always relied on Barbara, and she has never asked for a thing in return. She has educated so many and asked for little or nothing in return. Her business makes a difference in the world – particularly to our small-to-medium businesses. Her skills are boundless. The contribution she has made to Trade Compliance is phenomenal. Now, she needs help.

Her business is her life, she would be crushed without it. Please help me to help her from becoming another statistic.

Thank you for reading this and for whatever you can do to help. The goal I have set is only for $70K, this is the absolute minimum that she needs to make it. So, once again, thank you for your help and support.

story:
Short Summary

Zucano focuses on making everyday traveling more enjoyable by turning it into a social experience.
Many of us spend long hours sitting in an airplane, riding the subway to work, or taking a ferry to join our favorite vacation destination.
Zucano wants to turn this usually boring and uneventful experience into an opportunity to meet new people, catch up with old friends, and learn something new.
The concept was developed by a group of young entrepreneurs that spent many hours on the road and were looking for a way to make it more entertaining and rewarding.


Zucano is a way of living.
It's about traveling with an open mind.
It's about making new friends.
It's about learning new things.
Zucano is about making your journey more rewarding regardless of the destination.

 

Philosophy

Zucano philosphy perfectly summarized by Snoopy!

 

Kudos to Snoopy and his visionary creator, Charles Schultz, for summarizing things so well for us. Oddly enough, this cartoon was left on a chair during our travels in a subway in Milan... Commuting can really be an inspirational experience!

  

The problem!

Have you ever needed to adopt tricks like this to travel more confortably? 

Lammar Wilson on How to avoid strangers while traveling BEFORE Zucano! (link to Youtube Video) 

 

How does Zucano work?

 

 

What we are looking for

Zucano is a community of people that wants to travel with an open mind. Zucano is for someone looking for more than just choosing between an aisle or window seat. Networking is key!

Spreading the word amongst the friends is not enough to ensure the most satisfactory social travel experience possible; First, travelers need to be able to meet new people, speak about a common friends; then ensure enough contacts in your circle to filter ￼￼￼￼￼￼￼ out bad travel buddies and end up with the best possible crew of friends! Zucano allows you to do this in just seconds, giving you more time to tan on your trip!

This is basically why we are asking you to initiate our marketing effort and make Zucano go viral!

 

 

Adopt a route and be its ambassador!

 

1. HIGH-FIVE SUPPORT
Every dollar counts! You love the project, but don't want to commit more than $5. As a backer, you'll receive all update and you'll contribute to make this project a reality. To show our thanks we will include you in the supporters' page so everyone will know ￼￼￼￼￼￼of your generosity!

 

2. ADOPT A ROUTE (AaR) 
As a reward for those who’ll decide to support our cause for more than $5 and as sign of our extreme gratitude, we will dedicate national or international routes of every transportation means we are able to support. So when people will start looking for NYC - Paris routes, your name will show up as the ambassador or adopter of that route.
You can link your name on the route, to your personal blog or website (non commercial + no social network pages).

Perks: route dedicated to a user

 

In addition, supporting Zucano ensures that we will maintain your route for the next year; normally, if you register a route, you’ll need to introduce 25 travelers or guarantee a certain amount of travels on that route to be sure that it will be maintained for a year.
PLUS, you’ll get to be the first Captain of the route: this is generally a reward for the most frequent traveler of the ruote, but you’ll get for free for the first 3 months! This perk with different amount applies to:

  • Local routes  
  • Regional routes 
  • International routes

 

3. ROUTE OF LOVE

Not yet satisfied!? Why don’t you get a route dedicated to your love!? Everyone traveling from New York to Paris (back and forth) will know that route has a special meaning for you and your love!!
This perk applies to every kind of route.

 

4. ROUTE OF GLORY
Do you feel generous? Dedicate a route to a group or friends (up to 4) in memory of an outstanding holiday to Santa Barbara!! You’ll get names, links PLUS you’ll be able to have a picture for the background of route page!
This perk applies to every kind of route.

 

5. THE SOCIAL TRAVELER
Ok, you're the perfect social traveler!
Get a bundle of 4 dedicated routes (one special for you plus 3 for your friends and relatives) plus, receive the kit of the "perfect social traveler" including a personalized t-shirt, a cap and a mug! Not only this help us advertise but you look supercool in the process!
This perk applies to every kind of routes.

 

6. THE BOSS PERK
Do you work in travel industry? Want a way to get known among social travelers? Want to reinforce your brand and image among a new generation of globetrotters? Get a route dedicated to your company and every Zucanos traveling on “your” route will see your brand as the ambassador of the route! You’ll additionally get 3 personal routes to be dedicated to your best employees and they will also receive a perfect social traveler kit!!

 

Perks_b: route dedicated to a corporate user

  

Join the Zucano community

There are a lot of ways you can support the growth of our social travelers' community!

1. Be a basic supporter
With your $5 basic support contribution you'll be taking an active role in spreading a new way of social travel! 

2. Adopt one or more routes!
With your more committed contribution you'll give significant fuel to the project while getting recognized within your network as a pioneer of the Social Travel industry and a talent scout in the startup community!

3. Give one or more routes as a gift to your loved ones!
Let your friends be proud of you! YOU DESERVE IT! Invest your money to help a cool project take off and give the most important people of your life a rewarded by your generosity!
Are you annoyed by typical presents, too!?

4. Push your company and support the community
Working in travel related industries? Why don't you invest a small amount of bucks to support the first social travel community? Other than direct rewards you'll become a big fish in a small pond. ;)

5. Tell your friends about Zucano!
Even if you cannot help us with our funding campaign, feel free to spread the voice and use our website to book you next trip!

Follow Zucano at these Social Networks:

      

 

Share these status updates to help us increasing visibility on Indiegogo!!

How to get entitled a route – instructions

Once you have paid out your contribution, make sure to give us the data we need to dedicate your route to you!

  • Name, Surname (of the person/ people you want to dedicate the route to)
  • Email, you’ll need to be part of the Zucano family to get a route dedicated
  • Route departure and destination points
  • Transportation means (Flight new york – boston is different from the train!)
  • Link to your personal page (remember no commercial pages or social networks, in case of non compliance any link will be shown)
  • Starting date of your love story!
  • Picture of your love/ or destination of your greatest holiday ever!
  • Gender + t-shirt size (of you or best employees)
  • Corporate logo 

 

Notes

  • Routes will be assigned on a FIFO (first in first out) basis.

 

FAQs 

 

 

THANK YOU!

Thank you for watching the video and reading about this project.We look forward to dedicating to you your route and we truly hope you will join the Zucano community and help us turning travel into a social experience!!

1. Be a basic supporterWith your $5 basic support contribution you'll be taking an active role in spreading a new way of social travel! 
2. Adopt one or more routes!With your more committed contribution you'll give significant fuel to the project while getting recognized within your network as a pioneer of the Social Travel industry and a talent scout in the startup community!
3. Give one or more routes as a gift to your loved ones!Let your friends be proud of you! YOU DESERVE IT! Invest your money to help a cool project take off and give the most important people of your life a rewarded by your generosity!Are you annoyed by typical presents, too!?
4. Push your company and support the communityWorking in travel related industries? Why don't you invest a small amount of bucks to support the first social travel community? Other than direct rewards you'll become a big fish in a small pond. ;)
5. Tell your friends about Zucano!Even if you cannot help us with our funding campaign, feel free to spread the voice and use our website to book you next trip!
Follow Zucano at these Social Networks:
      
 
Share these status updates to help us increasing visibility on Indiegogo!!


How to get entitled a route – instructions
Once you have paid out your contribution, make sure to give us the data we need to dedicate your route to you!

Name, Surname (of the person/ people you want to dedicate the route to)
Email, you’ll need to be part of the Zucano family to get a route dedicated
Route departure and destination points
Transportation means (Flight new york – boston is different from the train!)
Link to your personal page (remember no commercial pages or social networks, in case of non compliance any link will be shown)
Starting date of your love story!
Picture of your love/ or destination of your greatest holiday ever!
Gender + t-shirt size (of you or best employees)
Corporate logo 
 
Notes

Routes will be assigned on a FIFO (first in first out) basis.
 

FAQs 
 
 

THANK YOU!
Thank you for watching the video and reading about this project.We look forward to dedicating to you your route and we truly hope you will join the Zucano community and help us turning travel into a social experience!!

story:
The Wausau community started Robert W. Monk Botanical Gardens which is located on 21 beautiful acres and open for the public during all seasons. This project is ongoing, and plans for the future are looking absolutely phenomenal! This page I’m developing to raise some money for the Wildflower Woods and Memory Garden project --which is the first of multiple gardens in the overall plan.  The Botanical Garden is run by a non-profit organization and is open to the public for free.

 

You can help me with my small contribution that I will add to the growing donation fund of the gardens. The gardens will be a venue for educating students of all ages and public alike about plants, nature and the environment. The gardens will be a great place for family visits, picnics, walking, and other events. The gardens will draw people to the Wausau area, which will in turn be great for the community, the local economy, and be one of the highlights of their visit here.

 

I am a student at UWSP who grew up in central Wisconsin. I created this campaign for my e-commerce class to explore the possibilities of marketing to people beyond my acquaintances, and also to raise money for things that are important to me: the community, art, and the environment! I think it is important to build free parks and places in our communities for ourselves as well as visitors to enjoy. So please share this with friends, coworkers, and beyond because it’s a great cause. :] By simply donating a small sum of money—even one dollar—you can help make a great difference and bring beauty to Central Wisconsin.

 

Thank you all so much for you time and hard-earned money. Myself and the Wausau community appreciate the beauty that is coming forth!

story: Last summer, our friend Michael Ransom was diagnosed with testicular cancer. Although he is now finished with chemotherapy, he and his family are still dealing with the financial burden of the medical bills.
story_txt: Last summer, our friend Michael Ransom was diagnosed with testicular cancer. Although he is now finished with chemotherapy, he and his family are still dealing with the financial burden of the medical bills.

story:
THANK YOU FOR HELPING US REACH OUR GOAL!!!! We are SO excited to soon be developing advanced technology to enable individuals with limited mobility to become the skipper of their own boats!

Community Boating, Inc. (CBI) is a 501(c)3 non-profit. We are the nation's oldest public sailing center located in the heart of Boston's beautiful Back Bay. Our mission is the advancement of #Sailing4All by minimizing economic and physical obstacles to sailing. We currently serve over 2,000 children, 4,000 adults and 300 UAP sailors a year. 

In 2007, we launched our Universal Access Program (UAP), enabling members with disabilities new opportunities to get on the water and experience the joys of sailing. In the UAP, persons with special needs and their guests have use of specialized, accessible sailboats and transfer equipment, dedicated staff assistance, and sailing instruction. Reserved one-on-one sessions are customized to meet individual needs. Here's a picture of version 1.0 of our steering/chair system on the right.

     

Watch the video below to learn more about the technology for accessible sailing at Community Boating:


The program has been amazingly successful. Last spring, we had an article published about our program in Palaestra.  While we've had great success so far; given how much we've learned, the strength of our team and the advances in engineering and material science, we know we are ready to supercharge and upgrade our program to the next level. We found the perfect project partners to help us: Richard Ramos and Aleef Mahmud. 

                     

Watch the video below to learn more about our partners, Richard Ramos and Aleef Mahmud, and their story:

Richard is a long-time CBI UAP sailor and a competitive racer mounting a campaign to qualify for the Paralympics. Aleef is a talented engineer from RIT who now lives in Boston. Working together, along with the rest of the Community Boating staff and amazing volunteers, we believe we have assembled the perfect team to build something amazing.

Our S-T-R-E-T-C-H goal is to enable anyone, regardless of their disability, to get out on the water and become part of the sailing community. We're aiming high. Ultimately, we want to build systems that we can share with adaptive sports programs worldwide. We have the expertise, the experience, the facility and the team – now we need your support to help us raise funds and spread the word so we can make it a reality!

What We Need -- Our #Cheers4Chairs GOAL

$30K = one steering/chair system much like Richard's, we're calling it version 2.2, so our accessible sailing program achieves even more versatility than our current steering/chair design (version 1.0) can provide. 

This high-tech steering/chair system (version 2.0) belongs to Richard and he's kind enough to let CBI borrow it from time to time. This campaign covers the cost of a new version of Richard's chair (version 2.2) with some simple modifications. Community Boating would own this system and install in a boat for our UAP members to use any time.

$30K = one steering/chair system (Version 2.2) for one Community Boating UAP boat.

Here's a hint: We have ambitious goals because of our passion for this project. Truth be told, we want to go as high as possible - so in addition to our $30,000 goal, we've set pretty big S-T-R-E-T-C-H goals for ourselves.  We'll tell you about those later, if we are lucky enough to exceed our initial goal.....WINK, WINK. WINK...HINT, HINT, HINT - Help us get to the very TOP!

                            


    What You Get -- #Cheers4Chairs Perks

    The Impact

    Today, more people with disabilities are taking part in physically demanding sports like sailing. But the equipment has a long way to go and people who want to compete are actively seeking innovative technology solutions. Richard and Aleef's prototype is one of a small handful of solutions worldwide. 

    We have dreams of joining other like-minded people to create a global movement that empowers disabled individuals to get moving, socialize and participate in welcoming, inclusive communities. 

    While we're focused on thinking of this technology's applicability for sailing, the reality is these designs will have broader implications for other sports as well. Our technology could be applied far beyond sailing to other physical activities.

    We have the expertise and the experience. We certainly have the passion and we have a technical solution that is proven and in demand. We've already gotten calls from as far away as Israel as the word gets out about version 2.0. We want to actively share our experiences with versions 1.0 and 2.0 so people with disabilities don't have to work so hard to find them.

      Risks & Challenges

      We already have a working prototype that we can readily replicate. However, our stretch goals are all about raising the funds necessary to redesign and upgrade the current steering/chair system. 

      The existing prototype, version 2.0, is completely customized for one person, Richard Ramos. Replicating this system will give Community Boating's UAP members with similar body types an entirely new sailing experience - much richer.... more lively and highly interactive. We are excited about that possibility.

      However, our stretch goal is to build a more versatile prototype (version 3.0). This is a much bigger engineering challenge. Building a system that can be easily adjusted to enable a wider variety of sailors with different physical limitations also costs much more than simply replicating the work already done. While designing version 3.0 is a greater engineering challenge, we believe the team's combined experience gives us the data we need to reduce the associated risks

      While we are prepared to do the hard work necessary to build version 3.0, it's hard to predict unforeseen factors we might encounter along the way. There is a risk that the final product may not have all the versatility we are striving for in our current plan, and that not everything will go according to our expected timeline. 

      Regardless, we know we have the basis for an improved prototype that will move us closer to our ultimate goal and we're ready to take on this new challenge. When we have our launch party in 2015, we're confident we'll be one step closer to our goal. For us, the size of the step matters less than the progress forward.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Community Boating's non-profit mission is to provide sailing that is accessible for all. We're very passionate about it. This means reducing ALL barriers including physical, social and economic ones. Our UAP members (and our junior sailors) pay what they can based on their economic circumstances. 

      Because we understand the challenges that they may face, we are committed to providing access. We work hard to find creative ways to fund our programs. We never want to deny any member access to the water for any reason. 

      To support our mission, we have a scholarship program that allows economically challenged Junior Program sailors to sail for a whole summer for just $1. We are always on the lookout for new ways to increase funding for this program. We currently serve about 2,000 children during our summer sailing season so there is always a financial need. 

      In addition, we have developed a wide array of STEM programs that run in conjunction with corporate and educational partners like Google, MIT and others that create STEM learning programs tied to sailing. Since sailing incorporates physics, math, water science and engineering, this is a natural fit. We explore innovative ways to expand this work through active partnerships with cool people doing cool things in these fields and engaged funders who appreciate our mission.   

      CBI is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that depends on its committed, energetic volunteers. We have a HUGE volunteer program that makes it possible for us to keep things "ship-shape". We welcome new members willing to contribute time and expertise in a variety of areas. Volunteers become part of our lively community. It's a fun and exciting way to meet new people and learn new stuff while you contribute. If you live in Boston, we hope you'll consider joining us and having some fun! 

      You can also find and follow us at  www.facebook.com/communityboating, www.twitter.com/sailcbi, and www.instagram.com/sailcbi, or sign up for our newsletter on our website at www.community-boating.org. 

      Help us help others enjoy the freedom and life-changing experience of sailing. 

      P.S. Even if you live elsewhere, we ask that you help us share our message with as many people as possible. We're active on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. We'd love to hear from you! Please help us spread the word for our #Cheers4Chairs campaign to provide #Sailing4All at Community Boating. 

      The Indiegogo share tools also make it really easy - please help us spread the word! And when you do come to Boston, stop by for a visit, we'd love to show you our beautiful river!

      Thank you for giving us your time and positive energy! See you on the water!

story:
About Us

We are committed to helping people make positive changes and achieve their personal goals towards financial freedom. CreditUgly is an affordable and secure way to manage and improve your credit profile from the comfort of your own home.

While working in the industry for over a decade, our founder and CEO noticed there were major security issues and flaws in the credit repair process. With a rapid increase of identity theft and credit score issues, he knew there was a need for a better solution.

Developed in 2013, CreditUgly has revolutionized the credit industry by not only offering a private and secure way to resolve personal credit and budgeting concerns, but also by eliminating the financial burden often paired with credit repair.

The founder and CEO has enlisted the help of Florida Atlantic University business students, who have a focus in Entrepreneurship, to take CreditUgly's marketing campaign to new heights.


Our Goals

By launching our Indiegogo, CreditUgly plans to strategically use all funds raised to execute our marketing campaign. Alongside our marketing campaign, our objectives include increasing our customer reach, website design and management, acquiring Google AdWords and implementing a customer support department.


Our Software

CreditUgly is a do-it-yourself credit repair and budgeting program.

Here's a look inside...

Enter and upload all required information

In this section, you will enter all credit disputes. These are located on your credit report. Step-by-step instructions are provided.

Use this section to maintain your finances and control your budget.

The following video should simplify the described process, and sum it up:


CreditUgly automatically selects the appropriate dispute letters. All you have to do is choose the bureau, print and send. It's as easy as 1, 2, 3.

"Be smart, fix it yourself!"


Your Reward

By supporting us with your donation of $5 or more, you will receive our exclusive Indiegogo version of CreditUgly.

The programs in our software are cutting-edge and simple to use.

Here's whats included:

  • CreditUgly for (1) device and (1) user
  • Budgeting program
  • Recurring payment reminder
  • Credit card analyzer
  • Debt reduction program
  • Amortization loan program


The CreditUgly Team

Lindsay Drobes
- Major: Management, Minor in Marketing
- Project Role: PR and Operations

Andrea Kimpel
- Major: Marketing
- Project Role: Marketing

Hassan Ahmad
- Major: Management
- Project Role: Sales and PR

Thomas Tanner
- Major: Business Administration
- Project Role: IT

Having met in our Entrepreneurship class at Florida Atlantic University in Boca Raton, FL, our creative team instantly clicked and knew we could make CreditUgly a success.

Risks and challenges 

Over the past decade, the credit repair industry has had its share of controversy. Due to false advertisement and identity theft, companies in our industry have been labeled, marked and scorned.

Regulatory agencies have pushed for people to repair their own credit. Because CreditUgly is compliant with all regulatory agencies, we are confident that our software has combated these challenges.

The software has been tested thoroughly, and therefore we don't expect any early bugs. As IT progresses continuously, the software will have to be constantly updated. CreditUgly will make sure a qualified IT team is set in place.

CreditUgly is trademarked and patented. Legal issues are therefore not expected.

story:
What We Are About

The mission of our center is based on the idea that the world can only heal once we have healed ourselves. The healing services we provide enable our Human Beings to heal themselves - whether it is from our food made with love and concern for all beings, our compassionate and healing hearts and hands, or our events that are so filled with creativity, good feelings, community, and love that the body can’t help but feel good.

We turn no one away for monetary reasons.

  • Dr. Bob has been giving to the Golden Gate Community for over 15 years and has been a healer for over 35 years.
  • Dr. Bob is partnering with Tom "Spiraling Fox" LaBonty from  www.Massage4.us and aBodys Massage. Tom has been a Massage Therapist and Healer for nearly 20 years and an Entrepreneur for 35 years. In addition, he is a Chef and has culinary training with Chef Kevin Enright and from OCC College.

What Your Funding Will Provide For Detroit

Food is the Body's Medicine. Help us buy, grow and store fresh produce for the Veggy Table Cafe and the Palmer Park/Golden Gate neighborhood! 

We need to custom build a walk-in cooler in the basement to keep fresh high quality organic produce. We will be able to support local urban farms like Pingree Farms and Robin-Hood Urban Farm, and purchase in case load quantities. This will allow us to provide healthy food choices in the Golden Gate neighborhood by having produce for sale at the Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand, and a "U Buy We Stir Fry" program at the Veggy Table Cafe!

We are excited to be in the process of being able to accept EBT Food Stamps. We will be working in cooperation with Detroit's Eastern Market to provide fresh produce to all.

  • Over the winter, build the walk-in cooler: custom build insulated walls, floor, ceiling, and cooling unit. 
  • Over the winter, purchase a used commercial 6 burner stove and oven for the Veggy Table Cafe.
  • For spring 2015, build the Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand.
  • For spring 2015, install a new sign for the Veggy Table Cafe.
  • For summer 2015, expand urban farming: extend Dr. Bob's farm; assist the Robin-hood Urban Farm project on Robinwood Street and Woodward Avenue.

The Impact

It's hard to measure the impact Dr. Bob and Tom have had on the lives around them. The improvements will expand the reach of the healing center in the community: 

  • Having healthy food easily available will improve health by having options other than processed foods at gas stations and convenience stores.
  • We will be able to serve our community healthy food more efficiently and more cost effectively.
  • The Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand and the expansion of urban farming right on Woodward Ave will be highly visible and create conversation around sustainability.
  • This is the first step of many in expanding and improving this community, and the vision we have for Wellness Village Detroit.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially at this point... and you can still help:  

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

We turn no one away for monetary reasons. 
Dr. Bob has been giving to the Golden Gate Community for over 15 years and has been a healer for over 35 years. Dr. Bob is partnering with Tom "Spiraling Fox" LaBonty from  www.Massage4.us and aBodys Massage. Tom has been a Massage Therapist and Healer for nearly 20 years and an Entrepreneur for 35 years. In addition, he is a Chef and has culinary training with Chef Kevin Enright and from OCC College.

  What Your Funding Will Provide For Detroit Food is the Body's Medicine. Help us buy, grow and store fresh produce for the Veggy Table Cafe and the Palmer Park/Golden Gate neighborhood! 
We need to custom build a walk-in cooler in the basement to keep fresh high quality organic produce. We will be able to support local urban farms like Pingree Farms and Robin-Hood Urban Farm, and purchase in case load quantities. This will allow us to provide healthy food choices in the Golden Gate neighborhood by having produce for sale at the Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand, and a "U Buy We Stir Fry" program at the Veggy Table Cafe!
We are excited to be in the process of being able to accept EBT Food Stamps. We will be working in cooperation with Detroit's Eastern Market to provide fresh produce to all.


Over the winter, build the walk-in cooler: custom build insulated walls, floor, ceiling, and cooling unit. 

Over the winter, purchase a used commercial 6 burner stove and oven for the Veggy Table Cafe.

For spring 2015, build the Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand.

For spring 2015, install a new sign for the Veggy Table Cafe.

For summer 2015, expand urban farming: extend Dr. Bob's farm; assist the Robin-hood Urban Farm project on Robinwood Street and Woodward Avenue. 
  The Impact It's hard to measure the impact Dr. Bob and Tom have had on the lives around them. The improvements will expand the reach of the healing center in the community: 


Having healthy food easily available will improve health by having options other than processed foods at gas stations and convenience stores.
We will be able to serve our community healthy food more efficiently and more cost effectively.
The Woodward Avenue Organic and Farm Grown Vegetable Stand and the expansion of urban farming right on Woodward Ave will be highly visible and create conversation around sustainability.
This is the first step of many in expanding and improving this community, and the vision we have for Wellness Village Detroit.

  Other Ways You Can Help You may not be able to contribute financially at this point... and you can still help:  
 Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Please help Ahbonbon lead this grassroots movement to help millions of Americans be more aware of the food toxins that they eat !

The modern life of an average working person is fast-paced and stressful. As a result, we end up eating convenient, highly processed foods, loaded with trans fats, salt, and sugar. We have chronic illnesses and serious diseases that were not around 30 years ago. More and more children are born with autism or some kind of birth defect. When three of my relatives in their thirties came down with cancer in quick succession, I decided to devote myself to studying the keys to healthy living.  I am now on a mission to help people be more aware of food toxins and to promote a homemade food movement to encourage people to prepare healthful, delicious meals from scratch.

Our food supply today is not as high quality as the one that our grandparents used to purchase. Therefore, as consumers, we need to be smarter when buying food and should be more aware of the food that we eat. We live in a society where large corporations are driven by profit and return of investment to their shareholders. Consumers are heavily influenced by food advertising and are misled by food labels. We are conditioned to eat so much sugar and salt from processed food that we are now addicted to them. The food supply is mass-produced and stuffed with fillers, trans fats, preservatives, chemicals, artificial coloring, and additives. Our bodies are distorted from inflammation due to the amount of food toxins that we consume every day.  If we continue feeding our body with toxins, we will not live long!

Author Biography

Lynn D. Ahbonbon has traveled the world and lived in France, Germany, South Korea, Vietnam, and the United States. Her passion has been cooking and inventing new healthy recipes since she was ten. She graduated from the University of Southern California (USC) with a B.S. and M.B.A., and was a strategic planning administrator at a large automotive corporation before providing education in entrepreneurship and healthy living to thousands of business owners for 15 years. She is currently founder, author, and publisher of Ahbonbon, LLC. Her company distributes self-help books.

What We Need & What You Get

The fund will help Ahbonbon, LLC with a head start to pay for book inventory, marketing, and public relations to officially launch the book nationwide. In return, Ahbonbon is offering a special edition “Food Made at Home” eBook, bookmark with cute Italian dogs (from the video), and autographed print book. The book is a great gift for Christmas or any occasions because they are beautiful, easy to follow, and informative. For the book details, please visit our website at www.ahbonbon.com or download a sample here.

Food Made at Home (ISBN 978-0-9893563-1-2 Paperback, ISBN 978-0-9893563-3-6 eBook)is a healthy-living and food guide. It is not just a typical cookbook or another diet guide. It goes beyond the practical tips for healthy living by pointing out  hidden toxins in food and providing international recipes with cultural and nutritional information. Using recommended dietary guidelines and techniques from national nutrition  experts to decipher the food pyramid and promote healthy eating patterns, this book will broaden your horizons and  enrich your knowledge. Good nutrition helps prevent many serious diseases and gives you tools to live a healthier life and to enjoy your life to the fullest, a joie de vivre!


(Book cover and bookmark, front and back)

The Impact
The impact can be very powerful. You can help us change the life of one reader at a time and help Ahbonbon lead grassroots movement to promote abundant, healthy living. Therefore, we can make a big difference in millions of people's life. This is good for the community.

Risks & Challenges

There is no risk involved in the project. For the past 2 years, we have set up a solid infrastructure for the book distribution to ensure great success.  Our books are already available at major bookstores in both eBook and paperback: Amazon, Barnes and Noble, Walmart, Sears, iTunes, Kobo, and more. You may also go to www.ahbonbon.com and click on bookstore links to find the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

Words of mouth are very powerful. Please post this link on social media and tell your friends about Ahbonbon's books. Please give your candid review online.

Peanut Butter Cookies - Recipe

story:
Who Are We?

We are two web developers based in the Los Angeles area with interest in the vegan lifestyle. We noticed that when people are first transitioning to the vegan diet, many of them do not know what to buy or prepare. Our app for iPhone and Android will solve this problem by generating a daily meal plan including breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The daily plans will take into account allergies the user has and the daily calorie count they desire. We hope to make eating vegan cheap and simple on a wide scale. 

In our day to day busy lives we can often remain stuck to eating the same things due to time constraints preventing us from researching new recipes to create. VegMealPlan aims to add variety to dining by providing preparation info for meals of all flavors from different cultures. The only thing the end user has to do is obtain meal ingredients and follow the cooking instructions.

Full Features

Home Page - Shows a feed with friends and their recent activity (recipe likes, their breakfast, lunch, dinner)

Plan Page - Shows the user's daily plan including breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Users can click individual meals for detailed info on preparation and ingredients. Users can generate new meals if not satisfied, for example if a user is given Sweet Potato Pancakes for breakfast and is not satisfied with that option, they can swipe right and another random meal will replace it.

Recipes Page - Shows latest submitted recipes. Users can browse recipes by top rated, newest, or by certain chefs.

Settings Page - Allows user to change privacy settings, set alleries, and input daily calorie requirements.

    What We Need Funds For?

    Chef Consultations - We want to travel and consult with big name vegan chefs around the world. This will allow us to get a good idea of what types of foods and combinations are popular. Most importantly, certain chefs are experts in specifics such as gluten-free and nut-free preparation, and with their input we can better tailor the app's experience to users with allergies. In addition we would like to complement this research with input from allergists and nutritionists.

    Design Work - The apps main layout has been designed already, but we would like to pay designers for additional work such as icons and graphics that will appear in the different pages of the app.

    Photographers/Cooks - Creating an expensive database of recipes will require paid volunteers to help cook and photograph recipes.

story:
Doula --> A trained professional who provides continuous labor emotional, physical, and informational support to mothers during pregnancy, labor, birth, and early postpartum. We are women that serve women. 


Start From Seed (SFS) is a non-profit organization that empowers and strengthens families during the childbearing year by providing comprehensive doula services and childbirth education, regardless of income level.

We have been been helping families have more healthier, more satisfying births since 2011.

Our team is made up of dedicated, caring women who come from diverse backgrounds and skill sets. Our Program supports women living below the poverty level and have complex health conditions proven to adversely affect maternal and child outcomes. Volunteer support is also offered to women that face language barriers, substance abuse, physical/sexual abuse, and teen pregnancy. SFS receives referrals from many wonderful community health organizations in Buncombe County, NC. 


We have built this campaign to help raise the funds needed for a year's worth of rent in a new office space. We currently use our office space for childbirth education classes, breastfeeding classes, doula trainings, and prenatal meetings with doula clients. There is something happening in the office almost every day. The building we are in now does not have adequate heat in the winter, lights don't get replaced in stairwells or parking lot, elevator breaks often... you get the idea. With your contributions to our campaign you are directly keeping this program going. We do not receive grant funding at this time, so every little bit donated goes a LONG way for us. By contributing, you are directly strengthening the fabric of our communities. One family at a time. 


Why doulas and childbirth education are SO important to the women we serve:
  • 28% decrease in the risk of cesarean section
  • 31% decrease in the use of pitocin
  • 14% decrease in the risk of having a newborn admitted to special care nursery
  • Overall increase in satisfaction with her birth experience
  • Increased breastfeeding initiation rates
  • Increase confidence in parenting
  • Decrease in postpartum mood disorders
The women we serve may be:
  • Residents of homeless and/or domestic abuse shelters
  • Teen mothers
  • Women in residential substance abuse programs
  • Immigrants and/or non-English speaking mothers
  • Women receiving pregnancy Medicaid and WIC services
  • Disabled or intellectually impaired
  • Women recently released from prison

WE NEED YOU!
We are raising $10,500 for this campaign. Where your money goes:
  • Rent for one year on a new classroom/office space off Merrimon Ave. The space is roughly 500 sq ft, humble, and very yellow (at the moment). It was a hair salon for the past 47 years. 
  • New flooring due to water damage from the beauty salon sinks
  • Building a tiny, tiny kitchen that will be a short counter top and small sink.
  • Paint and painting materials
  • Getting utilities turned on
  • Oh! There is a precious window box out front, so we will probably buy some plants

The perks include some awesome SFS "EVERY FAMILY COUNTS" merchandise. We have canvas tote bags, American Apparel T-shirts, buttons, pens, doula services, cupcakes... take a look. 

Here are what some of our clients have to say about us:
"What a great service you all provide to mothers and fathers...without it I probably would not have had a doula. I can not imagine my birth without Luci! She was such a great support for my husband and I. Thanks for everything Luci and SFS!"
"Just wanted to let you know that I was so, so very happy to be matched with Gloria Maria. She provided so much emotional, physical, spiritual and educational support to me during my four days at Mission last week. And although I'd been hoping to avoid an induction, she helped me get to the mental space I needed to reach to let go and trust the process...and in the end have the water birth I'd dreamed of. I see now why having a doula is so very valuable. And now we have a beautiful, feisty baby girl. Thank you for all you do!"
"Loved our childbirth education classes with Allison. Third time 'round and I still felt we learned so much! We also made a great friend in a new doula. I would highly recommend any services backed by Start From Seed!"

The nitty gritty --->
The reality is that we have been operating for 3 years without any secure funding. We have applied for grants but as you can imagine, this money is hard to come by. We have worked with over 250 families in this short amount of time, 98% of these doula services being volunteer. The Program Director and Program Adviser have never been paid to do what they do. This is definitely a passion project that we don't see ending anytime soon. We have sustained this long thanks to individual donations and successful fundraisers. Recently, we received a contract from the Buncombe County Department of Health to teach Childbirth Ed. to mothers receiving Medicaid. This contract means the world to us and we are honored to be educating and empowering low income families. The women we serve need the services we provide. We are the only program in our area that provides doula services to high risk, low income women and we are one of two programs that teach Childbirth Ed. classes to women receiving Medicaid. We really need to move and find somewhere a little more comfortable with better landlords and we really need your help. 

If you cannot donate money at this time, we are always accepting very gently used baby items, such as, Moby Wraps, Halo sleep sacks, some clothing, strollers, etc. If you or someone you know wants to donate flooring, that would awesome. Or maybe you're a plumber... We will take the help. You can also help by sharing our campaign with your loved ones or old high school friends on Facebook. We appreciate every eye that can see what we are trying to do. 

If you made it this far, thank you for reading. Thank you for supporting Start From Seed. We love you. And we will see you at the house warming party.

story:
DECEMBER 3rd UPDATE:

All refunds have been issued in full. If a refund did not appear in your Paypal account or in your email inbox at any point, please contact me at theorganizer@airmail.cc so we can resolve the issue. 

-----------------------------------------------------------

Your #PantsUpDontLoot Refund 

Thank you for your recent interest and support in the #PantsUpDontLoot billboard project. Due to recent circumstances (mainly the media's premature awareness) it has become essentially impossible to do any business with advertising companies. They do not want the potential PR nightmare that could ensue, and that's understandable. After lengthy discussion with the small circle I've been working with, it has been decided that this project will no longer be pursued.

 A full refund of your donation is being offered via the PayPal address used for your donation. All refunds will be returned via PayPal by December 3.

Any rejected refunds after December 3 will be donated in full to a Ferguson-area charity, perhaps Shield of Hope. That will be decided on December 3 or in the days immediately following.

 If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to email me at theorganizer@airmail.cc. I'm sorry we couldn't make this happen, but outside pressure just made it too hard to acquire the business of any ad companies. Thanks for giving this a chance.

- Organizer

story:
Breve reseña

Cristina Contreras, mujer emprendedora que lleva a cabo este proyecto y que cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el ramo de las grúas, propone abrir una empresa que ofrecerá el servicio de renta de grúas móviles autopropulsadas para movimiento de cargas pesadas en la ciudad de México, orientado a diversas empresas de todos tamaños y giros.

La señora Contreras actualmente trabaja como intermediaria del servicio de grúas y cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes, quienes le han sugerido constantemente abrir su propia empresa, por lo que decidió hacerles caso y elaborar un proyecto de inversión, por lo que busca financiamiento para realizarlo.

La empresa practicará una filosofía de empleo incluyente, al generar puestos de trabajo de calidad, con capacitación continua, bien remunerados, para personas que comúnmente tienen dificultades para encontrar empleo tales como jóvenes sin experiencia, personas de la tercera edad y mujeres.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos $3’000,000 Pesos (Equivalente a $200,000 USD) para dar el enganche de una grúa e iniciar nuestro negocio.

Con este dinero también se contratarán al operador de la grúa, a su asistente, al agente comercial, al contador, al asistente administrativo y al operador logístico.

Nuestras recompensas son fantásticas! Queremos agradecerte por tu aportación para este negocio, que ayudará a crear empleos en México, pero estamos seguros que las recompensas te van a entusiasmar!

  • Por tu aportación de $100, te mandaremos un mouse pad con Gel descansa muñeca, que te permite trabajar muchas horas con el mouse sin que te provoques síndrome de túnel carpiano.
  • Si aportas $200, te enviaremos una fabulosa playera Polo
  • Aportando $400, obtendrás una increíble chamarra de moda.
  • Por una aportación de $600 ganarás una súper práctica pluma con USB
  • Con una aportación de $800 te mandamos una sensacional mesita para tu lap
  • Con $1,000 de aportación, de regreso te mandamos un compresor para que lo traigas en tu coche, con el que podrás inflar una llanta baja. Si no lo necesitas nunca mejor, pero si la llegas a necesitar, allí estará en tu cajuela.
  • Si aportas $2,000 te mandaremos como recompensa una Bocina inalámbrica que funciona mediante bluetooth de última generación, es recargable, y tiene un alcance de hasta 8 metros
  • Por una aportación de $3,000, te mandaremos una Tablet 7" Apex Dual Core 1.6Ghz, Android 4.1 Mod. AP-EM63

Además, cualquiera que sea tu aportación, la mejor recompensa será el agradecimiento permanente de las personas que obtendrán un empleo gracias a tu generosidad.


El impacto

La tasa de crecimiento económico en México en los últimos años es baja, y nosotros como ciudadanos tenemos la responsabilidad de trabajar para que ese crecimiento sea mayor. Las pymes son el motor de la creación de empleo en el mundo y también en México.

Por otro lado, existen grupos de personas para las que es especialmente difícil encontrar empleo, como las personas mayores de 40 años, las personas con capacidades diferentes y las mujeres.

Tu colaboración ayudará a alcanzar dos objetivos importantes: la creación de una nueva empresa y la creación de seis nuevos puestos de trabajo. 

Desde luego, la señora Contreras se beneficiará como empresaria y sus clientes también se beneficiarán con el excelente servicio que la señora Contreras les ofrece, pero ahora a través de su propia empresa.

Tu colaboración, cualquiera que ésta sea, es importante.

RECUERDA QUE EN UNA TONELADA DE ARENA, CADA GRANO PESA


Riesgos y desafíos

Abrir una empresa es un desafío. La cantidad de riesgos es importante, pero para enfrentarlos, además de la amplia experiencia y éxito de Cristina Contreras en el negocio de renta de grúas, ella se ha asesorado por consultores  que le ayudaron a formular el plan de negocios, proyecciones financieras, consulta fiscal, plan de marketing, etc. No se está improvisando nada.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Recuerda que tu colaboración ayudará a crear empleos, en especial en grupos segregados del ámbito laboral, pero que cuentan con capacidades y experiencia normalmente sub utilizadas. Estas personas desean ofrecer su capacidad y experiencia en favor de su país.

Ayúdanos a difundir el uso del servicio de Grúas Conbar entre:

1.  Los constructores

2.  Los ingenieros

3.  Los parques de diversiones

4.  Los centros comerciales y naves industriales.

5.  Los artistas plásticos

Y entre todos aquellos que necesiten una grúa.
story_txt:

Cristina Contreras, mujer emprendedora que lleva a cabo este proyecto y que cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el ramo de las grúas, propone abrir una empresa que ofrecerá el servicio de renta de grúas móviles autopropulsadas para movimiento de cargas pesadas en la ciudad de México, orientado a diversas empresas de todos tamaños y giros.
La señora Contreras actualmente trabaja como intermediaria del servicio de grúas y cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes, quienes le han sugerido constantemente abrir su propia empresa, por lo que decidió hacerles caso y elaborar un proyecto de inversión, por lo que busca financiamiento para realizarlo.
La empresa practicará una filosofía de empleo incluyente, al generar puestos de trabajo de calidad, con capacitación continua, bien remunerados, para personas que comúnmente tienen dificultades para encontrar empleo tales como jóvenes sin experiencia, personas de la tercera edad y mujeres.

para dar el enganche de una grúa e iniciar nuestro negocio.

Con este

comercial, al contador, al asistente administrativo y al operador logístico.
